description:
4.5 stars for the amazing sushi and the prompt service. 

After having read many reviews and after seeing so many pictures of the sushi rolls we decide to give this place a try on a Saturday date night. Being a beautiful day in the city by the bay we reached a little late, nearly an hour before closing. No wait and we were seated straight away.

Sushi Time!!..
After having gone through multiple reviews here on yelp we decided to order four rolls. Here are they in the order of agreed upon priority:
1. Sexy Scallop: very tasty and the spicy albacore was so fresh and nice. 
2. African Spider: really liked the crab and albacore in it. The fried pieces in the middle of the roll were also good. 
3. C-2: very unique flavors. Liked it a lot too. 
4. Spicy Crunchy Roll: nice and fried roll. The house spicy sauce was amazing. I used it with some of the other rolls also. 

Overall an amazing time and we will be going back for sure, with more sushi lovers.
author: Nipun S.

description:
This was a pretty average sushi place, which are a dime a dozen in the city. While the rolls were big, that doesn't always mean they taste good. Meat to veg. ratio was off in our rolls. 3 stars because the rolls were overpriced compared to the taste/ quality.

Also, my girlfriend's English is not that great, and the waitress was a bit clueless on how to treat a customer when it's obviously they don't speak English. Don't: Shout "what?" 3 times as she orders.

Try a variation like, "excuse me, I didn't hear you."
author: Andrew S.

description:
After perusing the Yelp reviews, this definitely seemed like a roll sorta spot, but I rolled (ha) the dice on nigiri / sashimi anyway.

Ikura: Super salty, firm, but no rush of seawater flavors.

Salmon: Buttery, with okay salmon flavor. The size was easily 2x the size of regular sashimi (4" long at the longest part, 2" wide, regular generous thickness. 

California handroll: Not too much mayo on the crab, which is always a plus. Really good (read: very little) rice to fish ratio, which is always appreciated.

Postmates delivery is definitely the most expensive, but definitely has the better Japanese spots in town.
author: Nicole H.

description:
I had limited time in SF and really wanted to get some good sushi for my last meal in town, but was really disappointed by Sushi Bistro. The ratings looked great but it's a shame when Yelp fails me.

My first impression was that the restaurant ambience was a bit disorderly. There was some sort of reggae/rock music playing and sports playing on TV. The plates on our tables were all different colors and sizes. Some were triangular, others rectangular, some were round, and some were curved upwards on the edges. My serving plate was blue and my boyfriend's was yellow. Visually, it made the experience a less appetizing.

As for the food, if you like avocado come here. We tried several different rolls, but I felt like each one was an avocado roll.

Double Jeopardy - This is described as a tartare, but I felt like I was eating a guacamole, that happened to have bits of fish in it. There was just so much avocado filling up the dish. I liked the use of the shrimp chips and the flavors I got when I wasn't eating mouthfuls of avocado.

Drunken Halibut - The halibut was a bit overcooked for my liking. It was a very average dish.

Uni Nigiri - Very average quality uni. It's not bad, but it doesn't do uni much justice either. 

Five Wishes - The presentation was very unappetizing. The house sauce was all over the plate and it just looked messy. I appreciate that real crab was used, but this dish was almost inedible. Something about the flavor was just off. We just ate the salmon and pieces off the tops of the rolls. Again, there was too much avocado. It said that the rolls were topped but a mixture of fish, but two of the cuts were entirely topped with avocado.

Sashimi spirit - I did not taste the spirit of sahimi in this one. The flavors were bland. I don't think the soy paper enhanced the dish in any way compared to the traditional wrap.
author: Sany N.

description:
A dining experience unlike any other. We came in for a team work dinner and were warmly welcomed by the staff as well as owner of the restaurant. Almost instantly we had an assortment of cold and warm sake at our fingertips. Side note: they carry a unique variety of craft beers if you're into that- we tried a sweet potato flavored lager. The staff also brought out a small kimchi dish and hot edamame. For dinner, we decided to go family style and order lots of different sushi rolls. It was my first Sushi Bistro rodeo but my teammates were seasoned professionals. We told the owner a couple rolls we had a good history with and then told him to surprise us with the rest. 

All the sushi was out of this world.  

I can't remember the names of all the rolls but one of our favorites was the Legacy roll. All the fish is extremely fresh and the mixture of ingredients melt in your mouth. The shrimp tempura roll was also spot on. We also enjoyed a poke seaweed salad which was also incredible. 

The overall atmosphere was very very clean and the staff were more than accommodating. I can't wait to give out recommendations  for this restaurant and take my sushi loving friends back for a delightfully tasty dining experience.
author: Kara N.

description: Sushi is mediocre. Too much to imitation crab. Just goto yuubi a block away. Hehehehheheheheheheheh
author: Ray C.

description:
We arrived at 8:30 PM and it was pretty crowded, but there was enough room at the sushi bar for the 2 of us to sit. They immediately gave us water and these cucumbers. I love cucumbers, so I really liked that they gave them to us. 

We ordered, the spider roll, the chicken teriyaki and tempura platter, and the chicken udon. I thought the udon would be a little bigger and it was also a little salty. I was quite thirsty after eating it. My boyfriend LOVED his platter. They give so much food for that. It's definitely worth getting those dishes. The presentation is also very pretty. We didn't expect to get that much food, so we had to take the spider roll to go. My boyfriend really liked it, so I bet their other sushi is delicious as well. 

I would definitely come back and get one of those platters.
author: Allyson L.

description: My favorite place in SF and close by to my house. Love coming here and bringing friends. Highly recommend if you're a sushi lover, they have great nigiri and fusion dishes. Red Devil and Crunchy veggie are my go-to's. If I feel hungry enough I get Dave's Legacy, which is off the menu. Highly recommend the striped bass nigiri if you like traditional sushi style.
author: Mike A.

description: Been going to Sushi Bistro pretty regularly for about 6 months and after last night I'm sad to say I won't be coming back. To be fair, the fish is usually pretty tasty, but the prices are definitely on the high end and the service is terrible. Last night my gf and I ordered a bunch of apps and sides (these were fine but nothing really stood out) and a couple rolls. When we received the rolls one was completely fried and tasted like garbage (who wants fried sushi anyways!?) When I told the bartender this is not what we wanted she just shrugged her shoulders and said there's nothing she could do. The manager then came over and said it was clear that what we ordered is a fried role (which is absolutely not true!) and made no effort to correct the situation. To add insult to injury we were charged full price for a roll we didn't touch and not one member of the staff said thank you for coming in. So yeah, I will definitely not be back and wouldn't recommend anyone coming here, esp with all the options in the neighborhood.
author: Andrew M.

description:
A coworker recommended Sushi Bistro to me, so a group of friends and I tried it out. 

Between all of us, we ordered:
-gyoza
-miso soup (probably not worth the $4)
-African spider roll
-butterfish blaster roll 
-monster in law roll 
-Waikiki roll 
-mango madness roll
-crouching tiger hidden dragon roll
-sexy scallop roll

Everyone really enjoyed the rolls. I think the sexy scallop and African spider roll were the biggest hits. Nothing disappointed. 

Our biggest complaint was the service. The waiter was friendly but our food took quite a while and came out so sporadically; one of our friend's rolls came out probably 20 min before the next roll, and the remaining were another 20 after that. This made it hard to enjoy everything together. 

All in all, we would all come back to Sushi Bistro if we were in the area. Seems to be reliable and your typical good sushi restaurant with average SF prices.
author: Jessie K.

description:
Asian fusion restaurant. 
Note : Make reservations because it gets packed. 

I heard so much about this place and had to check it out !! We were seated promptly with our reservation and the service was very very efficient explaining the quick turnaround per table. (Our server came to clear each dish as soon as the last piece of sushi was picked up , midway in the air on the way to the mouth !!) :-P

The sushi was very fresh, well prepared and the flavour combinations were great. Very good fusion rolls. 

Below are the comments on each dish we got. We were 3 people eating:

1. 49ers- the roll was delicious but the lemon slice on top was too sour so we removed it. 7/10
2. Crunchy- Great roll, very crunchy tempura and not soggy at all 9/10
3. C2- delicious lobster filling and shrimp topping! Really good. 9/10
4.Stinky salmon- garlic onion and mayo twist on salmon sushi 8/10
5.Seaweed salad - so fresh and very good 10/10

The meal was very good overall and the restaurant has a good ambience  too! If you are craving sushi this is a very very good option to enjoy great flavours and unique combinations of ingredients and sushi rolls.
author: Shivani B.

description:
This place used to be my favorite go to for sushi, until I recently discovered Sakesan (good cheap sashimi) and Amami (good cheap omakase). Don't get me wrong, sushi bistro is still good in my book. It's just a TAD pricey for what you get. They definitely give big portion for sashimi/nigiri here. I love their seared white fish nigiri - it's the perfect combination of Smokey flavor and tender richness. Salmon is good, can't go wrong. Though a friend pointed out to me that I might like it because it lacks fishy flavor - as in it is lacking any flavor. 

Their rolls here are pretty innovative with a contemporary mix. The butterfish blaster that everyone suggest is just OK. Too expensive for a few bites of art. Can't go wrong with classics like dragon roll and spider roll. Love the salmon roll. My favorite here is the red devil!! It's made with brown rice but I think that extra chew from it actually makes it better. Topped with chopped fried garlic, super yummy. 

That being said, I like that all their rolls are actually pretty different and interesting flavors. Unlike some restaurants where every roll start tasting the same because they use the same sauce (y'all know what I'm talking about!). 

Never had trouble getting a seat here but they do take reservations so why not secure a spot if you can?
author: Susanna C.

description:
Really loved everything here! the rolls are amazing, loved the flavour

The oyster is very fresh and refreshing, the toro sashimi is tasty too and it was a huge piece! For the giant scallop we ordered the nigiri, the scallop was really good, but the sushi rice was so so
author: Emily H.

description:
I love coming here just for their giant sushi pieces.  Probably 1.5x bigger than many of the other places sushi. I always have to remember not to order as much as other places b/c of their huge pieces.  They also have a great selection of beer and sake.  It's like a pub feeling when you enter the restaurant.  They don't have a great selection of specialty fish, but the classic ones are great and are giant.  

I love the king salmon and yellowtail belly here.  They are giant and great quality.  I would say it's the best bang for your buck.  Their uni is local, which is not bad.  And of course they are huge.  

They come out with some specialty pieces on the weekends, but not a great selection.  I would go to Daigo instead for the special fish.  Sushi Bistro's "fresh" scallops isn't that fresh actually.  Scallops are hard b/c the average piece would have a fishy taste to it.  Their giant fried shrimp head isn't all that great either.  It's not fried that well that you can eat the whole head.  Other than that, the classic sushi pieces are awesome.  Their appetizers aren't that interesting. Just get the classic sushi pieces are you're in for a treat.

They also have Kirin on draft.  I don't see that often.  Yay!
author: Shirley C.

description: This is my favorite sushi spot in SF. The presentation and the amount of fish they give you on each piece is way better than any other sushi place. The service is great and the owner is also very nice!
author: Jesse R.

description: One of the best sushi places in the city! The fish is always very fresh and the service is always outstanding. Lucky to live in the neighborhood, this is a regular spot for me!
author: Ali W.

description: I know there's hundreds (even thousands?!?!) of sushi choices in SF, but Sushi Bistro is definitely one of the best. As very close neighbors to Sushi Bistro, my family eats here a few times each month and we never tire of the diverse menu and fun fusion apps. Our favorite picks: Caucasian Afro, Red Devil Roll, C2 Roll, Drunken Halibut, Aloha Roll. The service is great every single time, the staff are always pleasant and it is obvious the owner puts his heart & soul into this place.
author: Ellen M.

description:
This place was pure disappointment. We complained about our food (primarily the terriyaki -- it was gross, and chicken was overcooked), but the server didn't do anything about it. The table next to us complained about their food as well and returned it. 

Their sushi was okay, nothing spectacular.

Definitely not returning.
author: Eunice M.

description:
So I've been a vegetarian for my entire life and over the years, I feel like every close friend I've made has a strong penchant/love for sushi. I'm usually happy to oblige when it comes to food plans though I'm somewhat sick of eating avo-cu rolls at times. Sushi Bistro really helps me with this struggle by offering a variety of veggie sushi rolls that are delicious. I've had the shitake veggie roll, the crunchy veggie roll, and the in the sun veggie roll and enjoyed all 3. In the Sun really has a great flavor (don't worry the mango is not overly sweet or overwhelming). It has a very playful look as the tomatoes are sliced to almost look like fish! 

There is ample seating and service was great overall. I would highly recommend this place to vegetarians and encourage sushi-lovers to bring their leaf-eating friends, such as me, here.
author: Lakshmi M.

description:
Parking: street/metered

Service: great, our waiter was very friendly and attentive

Food:
Negi-hama roll: the ratio of fish in this roll vs this roll at other places I've been is so much better. more fishhhhh (that's what we're paying for)
Hamachi nigiri: YO. THE HAMACHI WAS THICC. TALK ABOUT DAT RATIO!!!! and it was smoooooth.
Shiitake Veggie Roll: if you love mushrooms like I do, you'll like this roll. It almost had a semi-sweet taste once you bite into the sushi roll

My family also ordered the Dragon Roll, Spider Roll, OMASAKE (FISHY FISH), Rock N' Roll, and Salmon Teriyaki & Tempura Combination Dinner. 

It's definitely great quality for the price. Great for groups.
author: Cheri C.

description: Really solid sushi. It has a simple and sweet ambiance inside. My favorite roll was the Hawaiian...the flavor and freshness of the roll was really incredible. Another good one we had was the red devil with white rice...the flavor was so good in this one as well. Also got the aloha which was great, especially the dipping sauce, but I prefer rice rolls and that one didn't have rice. And last but not least we had the crunchy...wasn't mind glowingly flavorful but it was solid. Miso soup was yumm and the green tea tempura ice cream was delish!!!
author: Jenna B.

description: Solid sushi spot....  one of the better midrange sushi spots we've been too since moving to the city the past few months...  we got the Hirame fusion and the ruby rainbow.... both were good... nothing spectacular but good... downsides: gotta pay for hot tea and somewhat slow service due to all the takeout orders
author: Jonas E.

description: A little pricey, but definitely worth it! Very exotic sushi roll flavors and each delicately made. Some favorites are Hawaiian breeze, In the Sun, and Stinky Salmon. Oh and you have to get the Hot Love!
author: Jessica W.

description:
This will probably become my go-to sushi place in SF! The atmosphere is cozy yet classy. We came on a Thursday night at 8 with a reservation. It wasn't packed, so we were able to be seated within a couple of minutes.

The menu is long but I'm pretty sure most if not all of the items will satisfy. I highly recommend the Double Jeopardy, it's so damn good. The rolls were very good too. The ingredients were noticeably fresh and the combinations were very tasty.

The service here was the best I've ever gotten in a restaurant--even better than the fanciest restaurants I've been to! I don't think I ever had to wait more than 60 seconds with an empty plate on my table or a glass not filled.

5/5 would come back.
author: Jasmine H.

description: Great sushi and very family friendly!  We've been eating here for a long time and our toddler loves it too!  Their omikasa is generous as well!
author: Whitney C.

description: This place was really good! I'm not from California but I've been told that I need to try sushi in California. The sushi options were different from what I'm used to but I'm so glad I tried it! Some of the sushi names were hilarious which made it more interesting. The service was so fast. I would recommend this place for any one from out of town
author: Cristina S.

description: There was actually no wait for a Friday night. But it was pretty early like 5/6pm. The service is very good. We got the toro fatty tuna, butterfish blaster, and sashimi special. Everything came out super fast. Toro was buttery and yummy. Butterfish blaster was buttery and yummy, kind of Americanized sushi tasting but still yummy. Kind of orgasmatic. It has crab and avocado inside. Sashimi special had different kinds of sashimi inside. It was kind of bland but you dip it in sauce and it's good. So we felt super congested after because of all the omega fattiness. It's like the feeling after you eat lots of cheese or fat stuff. But it was yummy and the service was good. Bathroom was clean and beautiful. This is quite the fancy Americanized kind of place but still yummy.
author: Amanda L.

description:
First time & last time!! Chicken was dry, mask with sauce and beef like jerky. Veg was frozen & microwave
Sushi was okay. Portions were decent. Atmosphere nice.
author: Al F.

description:
Favorite sushi spot in the city. Super lowkey and delicious. 

Go to order for two:
Spicy girl - avocado, spicy white tuna with macadamia nut and creamy sauce. Absolute killer. Modest portion but definitely worth it.

Sunomono aka cucumber salad. You get a taste when you first sit down. Its crack. Double down and get the full thing.

Salmon sashimi - life changing

Sexy scallop roll - spicy albacore, salmon, and avocado topped with chopped hokkaido scallop, tobiko and scallions in soy paper.
author: Timur Z.

description: We love this place, been one of our go-to sushi spots for a long time now.  The regular rolls are fantastic, but we always defer to the items on the "something unique" part of the menu (butterfish blasters, spicy girl, double jeopardy) and their signature rolls are so darn solid.  I will also do their omakase now and then.  Staff are super welcoming, we now have an almost 2 year old and have realized it's a very family/kid friendly spot.
author: Patrick L.

description:
Had the best sushi I've ever had. Service was phenomenal. Owner ensured we had a great time!  Definitely recommend.  Family friendly. Took my granddaughters. They loved the sushi, mochi, and edamame. 

I'm back again. Whenever I visit from Maryland, I make a beeline here. It never disappoints. Once again, excellent, warm, and innovative. 

Thank you.
author: Jet H.

description: Unreal sushi and oysters. Service phenomenal. Owner is on premises and makes sure of perfection.
author: Byron H.

description:
Sushi bistro is fantastic! The sushi here is probably the best I have had in the city.
We made a yelp reservation, and it was accepted immediately when we showed up.
We ordered 4 different rolls. They were all delicious.
I recommend the dragon roll and the spider roll. 
The rolls are about $15 each... I know, a bit pricey but man are they good!
I've seen people complain about the parking in the area, it's not bad. Maybe they don't want to walk a block?
The service here was excellent. I read previous reviews about a lack of service. Everyone we interacted with was friendly and very informative on great recommendations.
I will definitely be back here again.
I think this a great special occasion spot. 
4 rolls and 2 drinks were about $90. But worth the nice dinner. 
Check this place out!
author: Kevin S.

description:
Surprised this has 4 stars and from 1,400+ reviewers.. I ordered omakase 12 piece sashimi so I'm guessing this place might be better for sushi/appetizers. Nonetheless, I'm giving 2 stars (which is "Meh. I've experienced better." people!) b/c:

- It was some low-grade fish... not fresh and totally not worth the $37 it costs... no fatty tuna or salmon was included. 
- If you compare it to the alternatives in the area (Sakesan Bistro--kickass sashimi), it's disappointing.
author: Olivia P.

description:
TLDR - Decent spot for sushi. Lots of options for rolls, including riceless, brown rice and veggie rolls, but nothing really special and somewhat pricey for the portion sizes

I'll preface this review by saying that I was doing a Whole30 when I dined here, so what I could eat was very limited. That being said, the menu does have some options that can easily be made Whole30-friendly and is allergy-friendly in general.

For those not restricted by allergies or elimination diets, there's plenty to choose from on the menu: various rolls (classic, "unique", riceless, brown rice, veggie), sashimi/nigiri, lettuce cups, teriyaki, noodles, salads and appetizers. I loved the cute names they had for a lot of their rolls (like Nemo Found), but they mostly looked like any other sushi bar's rolls, aka a more-or-less random combination of fish with avocado and cucumber, maybe some other veggie, and some sort of sauce. Nothing super special or unique.

I went with 2 of their riceless sushi rolls due to my dietary restrictions and found them to be just okay. I've had riceless sushi rolls at other places that were more inspired than just fish, avocado and cucumber, so I found their rolls to be disappointing in comparison and lacking in creativity. Also pretty pricey given there wasn't necessarily any more fish in them than a normal roll. The 2 rolls were in fact pretty much the exact same thing, just presented differently - one had everything wrapped in cucumber, the other had the fish on the outside. Unfortunately they don't have fresh snow crab, only crab mixed with mayo, so I had to leave that out of my rolls. Instead, they just replaced it with more avocado or cucumber.

* BIG ISLAND ($14.95) - 3/5
[salmon, tuna, albacore & tobiko, snow crab, avocado & sprouts wrapped inside a thinly sliced cucumber; no rice]
Came with 6 pieces, which was a very small portion given it costed the same as the rolls with 8 pieces. The cucumber wrap had a pleasant crunch. Fish/sashimi was pretty fresh but I've had better

* FIVE WISHES ($15.95) - 3/5
[snow crab topped w/ salmon, tuna, yellowtail, albacore & avocado, served w/ mixed greens and house creamy sauce; no rice]
Pretty much the exact same thing as the Big Island.
author: Jessie L.

description:
We paid $108 dollars for 3 California rolls, five wishes and a Sashimi Spirit roll. As is my habit with any new restaurant I visit, I put my mobile device timer on after we ordered our main course. The seaweed salad and miso soup came out timely. No issues there. Then a party of 9 sitting next to us who arrived after us started receiving their appetizers and main course before us. Ok. No big deal. Then I looked at my timer. Twenty five minutes and counting. Our food should arrive soon. 5 minutes pass. Then another 5 minutes. More food arriving for bigger party. The attentive waiter at first hadn't visited us in twenty minutes to inform us of any delays. I went to talk to them at the sushi bar. They apologized. Main courses arrived within five minutes. Small portions, good sushi. But small portions. We felt we paid too much. 

1 star off for the 40+ minute wait, 1 star off for the small portions.
author: Reno U.

description:
I've been going here for quite a few years now.
I love the food. Staff is always great, friendly and make sure you have everything you need. 
The space is nice and chill. 
Excited to go visit again soon.
author: Junior A.

description:
Now that my first 1,000 reviews are done, to kick off the next 1,000 (I hope!), why not tackle one of the places that I've always had trouble writing about?  Honestly, I have no idea why it's been so hard and taken so long for me to write this review.  Despite having eaten here multiple times, I can never seem to get anything done for Sushi Bistro!  Maybe (probably) it's just me being lazy...

Compared to my first trip here, when they were a tiny restaurant just a few doors over, Sushi Bistro has changed quite a bit over the years.  The space is larger, the look/vibe is trendier, and the menu is larger.  Yet, despite how much they've grown, their food hasn't changed.  Whether it's the rolls, sashimi, starters, small dishes, salads, or combo plates, everything looks and tastes just as good as before (from what my friends and I can tell, at least).

-- AHI TUNA POKE SPECIAL - Cubes of Garlic-Soy Marinated Ahi Tuna served over Organic Baby Greens, Avocado, and Crispy Potato Vermicelli...$15.95
(https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/sushi-bistro-san-francisco?select=J6OS2QeY_TidZm1fXbP74Q)
Pretty good all around.  Not surprisingly, being a Japanese restaurant, the tuna was terrific (so fresh!).  I liked the texture contrast of the potato vermicelli as well, but I felt the sauce was a little lacking, both in quantity and flavor (specifically, it could've used some sesame oil).

-- AFRICAN SPIDER - Tempura Soft Shell Crab, Fried Albacore and Salmon, topped with Avocado, Sprouts, Drizzled with a Sweet & Spicy Eel Sauce...$14.95
(https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/sushi-bistro-san-francisco?select=ApC9vqCx6aWCY2u1su9amw)
My favorite of the night, though they have better rolls.  The soft shell crab was fried up quite nicely (crispy!) and each piece was pretty meaty.  Plus, while I'm not usually a big fan of fried fish, it actually worked well in this case.  A little heavy on the sauce, which I found to be a bit sweet, but solid overall.

-- NEMO FOUND ROLL - Salmon, Unagi and Avocado wrapped in Soy Paper and topped with Eel Sauce...$11.95
(https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/sushi-bistro-san-francisco?select=xSuhZo_7Uem9o8i4bWvvnw)
My least favorite of the night, unfortunately.  On paper, it sounded great, albeit simple.  However, despite how fresh the salmon was and how well it usually goes with unagi and avocado, the flavors seemed really light.  So much so that the eel sauce overshadowed everything else.

-- SEXY SCALLOP ROLL - Spicy Albacore, Salmon, and Avocado topped with chopped Hokkaido Scallop, Tobiko, and Scallions in Soy Paper...$13.95
(https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/sushi-bistro-san-francisco?select=8kgQoull4U6MDktD4oC3NQ)
While I generally like rolls with scallops, I thought this one was just okay.  On the one hand, the scallops were tasty (delicate, clean) and the salmon was great.  On the other, I could have done without the spicy albacore, though I'm generally not big on any "spicy (fish)" in my rolls.

-- UNI NIGIRI...$13.95
(https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/sushi-bistro-san-francisco?select=LXqVraMCyy7MkNJAvb7hxg)
Delicious!  Each piece of uni had that bright, mustard coloring to them and were oh so flavorful.  The price seemed a shade high for what you get, but there's no question that it was good!

Although my experiences with these particular rolls were rather mixed, I've had others in the past that were much better in comparison, such as the Butterfish Blaster, Sashimi Spirit, and the Hirame Fusion.  In addition, their lettuce wraps are worth trying as well, though I've only had the Summer, Fall, and Equinox wraps.

As far as service goes, I've never had any issues with it myself, but I can see why some find it rough/uneven.  However, what really stops Sushi Bistro from being part of my regular sushi rotation is the parking.  I don't hold it against them with their rating, since it's well beyond their control, but I'd be lying if I said it wasn't something I keep in mind (desire to come back vs willingness to circle endlessly).  If there was a guarantee of finding a space though?  I'd definitely come back more often.
author: Mike L.

description:
I came here twice in the last month. I have to warn you, this place has NO PARKING. I don't have much patience so when it comes to parking, and not being able to find one, it definitely kills my vibe. Although I try to keep my ratings independent of the parking, I would still like to share the pain in finding parking around this area. The first time I came, I rated this location a 4 star, and I loved the food and service. The second time i came, we spent about 20 minutes looking for parking, I would rate the parking a 2/5, saying downtown SF is probably a 1/5. 

We ordered the genmai tea which was 1.5 each, out of a teabag. The tea is great, but service was bad. I had to ask every single time for the server to come and fill my tea. There was never a time where the server decided to check on my tea or us in general to see if we needed anything. It wasn't until when we were almost done and leaving did a nice korean server come by. She checked on us a couple of times and that was appreciated. 

This time around, we ordered complete different items to try out their menu as a whole. We tried two different lettuce wrap, the Solstice and winter. Solstice was composed of diced ahi tuna seared, avocado, crunchy flakes and tabasco sauce for $6.95. Winter was made of spicy tuna, avocado, aioli and shrimp tempura. I have to argue that the winter lettuce wrap was more flavorful. I tried winter first then went to Solstice and it tasted very bland. Each of the lettuce wrap was a few cents off from 7 dollars. In my opinion, I fee like they are over priced for what they are. 

We also ordered 5 wishes which was a popular item off yelp. 
$15.95 Five Wishes made of snow crab topped with salmon, tuna, yellowtail, albacore & avocado, served with mixed greens and house creamy sauce (no rice). I would rate this a 5/5. This was very fresh and I enjoyed the taste and texture of this. Beautiful picture as well. There was no rice in here. 

$14.95 African Spider made of deep-fried soft shell crab, fried albacore and salmon, topped with avocado, sprouts, drizzled with a sweet and spicy eel sauce. I think this was my least favorite because the stuffing inside was pretty thick and hearty. Felt very oily and a bit too much. It was also very salty in the middle too. I would say this is a 3/5. This was a bit too much for me in terms of how heavy it was. I did however enjoy the sauce in this dish. 

$12.95 Albacore Dream composed of spicy tuna and avocado topped with albacore, served with house special and spicy sauce. This would probably be a 4/5. This dish was pretty spicy, as it was topped with spicy tabasco like sauce on top. I did like the middle which was the spicy tuna and avocado inside. 


Overall food is great, service is highly lacked, and parking is horrendous. I would recommend coming here if you wanted some good sushi in the area, but I wouldn't necessarily drive all the way out here for this place as you'll end up being more disappointed.
author: Amy Y.

description:
Came here last night for dinner. 

It was my first time here. Came here because of all the great yelp reviews.
No wait with our reservations.

We were seated in the back. Nothing special about the back part of the restaurant but it was nice that we could hear each other and have a conversation. 

We ordered the nigiri omakase. It came with miso soup and salad. I ate everything. Along with the tempura, tamago nigiri and chocolate bread pudding with green tea ice cream. I didn't try any of the rolls.

Great customer service.
Parking is a big problem.

Wouldn't come back. Will try other places in the city.
If your in the area this is a safe option.
author: Jewelyn T.

description: I live a block away and come here often, but tonight, I was gravely disappointed in the New Legend roll. I've never ordered it before, but it was recommended to me. It tastes like salty rice with salty gummies sitting on top. I'm honestly shocked because I could and would live off of their lettuce wraps, but this roll has left me shooketh. I'm not sure if I'll still eat here because of how gross and salty the New Legend roll is. Send help, I'm bloated and feel like I would float from all the salt in my body.
author: Rebecca G.

description: My favorite neighborhood sushi spot. Everyone is really friendly and welcoming. The sushi is really fresh and delicious. Great place to go with friends.
author: Alejandro C.

description:
The most disgusting Japanese dinner I ever had!!! 
The combo plate was mostly over cooked vegetables and there was literally 5 pieces of over cooked beef which was probably microwaved.  Teriyaki sauce was horrible and tempura was very oily.  I cannot say or give credit to anything.  They use green tea teabags.  The glass of water was about the best thing. I don't understand how this place was given a 4 star rating.  I will never believe Yelp reviews ever again. To add to it.....the back room smelled like it was cleaned with a freakin dirty a*s mop!!!! 
Very, very, very disappointed!!!!!
I usually don't like to yelp and trash talk any business but I feel Sushi Bistro is taking advantage and ripping off customers and take no pride in what they serve.  Sushi Bistro, how can you? 
Wait.......did I mention "hella over priced"?
Come to think about it....I didn't see any Asian customers (we know what that means ;)
author: Alice L.

description: This is my favorite Sushi place in the City. I love their sashimi and their portions are generous. They also have some delicious appetizers too. Enjoy!
author: Jade C.

description:
Don't matter what you order it will be good!
Except my bro got the teriyaki chicken (but I mean come in he should have got sushi) and it was way too uhhh...teriyaki (too much sauce).

So I take that back all the sushi is good trust me! They won't disappoint. 

I go the fried mushroom things last time and WOAH! Must get that as an app trust!

Also, they're Michelin recommended so there's that.
author: Amber T.

description: BEST ROLLS IN TOWN. Definitely satisfied me and my boyfriend's sushi craving! We enjoyed all four of the rolls we got. Our waitress had great recommendations- don't remember what they were but guaranteed you'll find something you like.
author: Katherine L.

description: One of the best vegetarian sushi I have had. Cozy feel, very friendly and attentive service, and most of all, the sushi was amazing.
author: Aaliyah P.

description:
YUMMY sushi rolls! Special rolls are a tad bit pricey (NYC pricey) but I was full off one roll so I guess it wasn't too bad

we sat at the tiny bar in the very back since it was just the two of us
---Crouching tiger hidden dragon roll: mmm eel and shrimp tempura in one!
---Dragon roll: just as you'd expect

NOTE: Parking was hard to find on the street around here late at night, we had to circle a few times before we lucked out on a spot
author: Jenny S.

description:
This restaurant was a great place for a spontaneous dinner. We waited about only 10 minutes before getting seated at the bar. My friend and I came at around 7PM and it was already crowded. 

Parking wasn't too bad, but I heard it could be a nightmare. We got lucky.

The restaurant layout was very spacious and very well decorated. I loved the decor. The staff was also courteous with questions and was prompt with our orders. No issues with customer service.

I got the Dinner: Chicken Teriyaki with steamed vegetables. This entree took awhile to prepare. The chicken wasn't too tender, unfortunately. I think it was breast meat. The teriyaki sauce was also a bit overwhelming. I wouldn't order this again.

I ordered Crunchy ($9.99), which was a regular classic roll and not a Signature Bistro Roll. This was definitely delicious and not too bad for the price. This is a safe order. If I come here again, I'll try one of their Signatures next time.

My friend order a sashimi bowl and he loved it. They were also flexible with the fish cuts too, which was awesome.

Overall, I would come here again. Like all sushi places in SF, you'll probably put a dent in your wallet when you dine here.
author: Chinsin S.

description:
After a long search for baked sushi, I finally found what I needed in Sushi Bistro!

I reserved a table for us on a Wednesday night at 7:45 and it was still packed! Good thing we arrived around 7:20 and checked in. We were able to be seated at roughly around our reservation time. We squeezed into a tight table that brought us closer to our neighbors than to one another and panned the extensive menu. We were greeted by an amazing waitress that seemed a little flustered with the busy night. We asked for recommendations but she was speaking so fast that we had no idea what she was saying... But no worries! I did research! 

I read that their African Spider Roll was pretty popular so of course that was going to be on our list! We also ordered the M&L and started with the gyoza. The gyoza was quite small, but it's an appetizer after all. It was sadly lacking the crunch though. The M&L was a huge roll! I had to split it in two in order to finish it whole. I felt like the fish was a bit over cooked inside, but the spicy tuna was great and definitely gave this roll a kick. Lastly, the African Spider Roll was definitely more exotic than rolls I've ever seen and rolled in the perfect bite size.

I would recommend to make reservations before going and trying anything that you've never had before because I'm sure you can find it here!
author: Linda K.

description: I was visiting with a few friends and we decided to try this place. I don't really eat sushi but didn't want to ruin anyone else's sushi cravings. I loved the feel of this place and our waitress was really great and pretty on point with our food! I ordered the Sesame Chicken which was ok. Obviously it isn't their signature thing so I was ok with it. I also decided to go out on a limb and I ordered a California Roll and I actually really did enjoy it! Hopefully when I'm back on the west coast I'll be able to come back and try some more serious stuff ;)
author: Christina B.

description: This is an upper scale sushi house in the inner Richmond of San Francisco. Sushi on the more pricier side, but worth it. I had the Fall Lettuce Wrap and New Legend Roll. Both were really tasty. Would come again.
author: Marc H.

description: Amazing and phenomenal sushi.  The portions are great, the quality of fish was amazing, the staff was friendly an recommended some amazing choices.  I've had a lot of sushi and this by far has been my favorite spot in San Francisco.
author: Robert W.

description: Honestly, I've had the same quality of sushi from grocery stores. The udon was good though. The noodles in it are thick and the flavor is strong
author: Becca U.

description: I love this place!! Amazing sushi and staff. Prices are affordable, people are friendly. Guess what, they brought special designed sticks for my old mother... if you love sushi, this place might turn into your favorite location. Thank you for everything that you offer.
author: Daniel T.

description: 5 stars because they didn't give us a dirty look when my buddy and I ordered only two rolls. I'm sure they expect people to order appetizers, drinks, rolls, etc. The service was just as great when we spent only $15 each while others had a sushi & beer buffet. Thanks Sushi Bistro! I'll be back...with a bigger appetite next time.
author: Ato Z.

description: Bad over the top M&L roll, the rice fell apart around the roll and the nigiri rice did not stay together long enough to dip into soy sauce. The only thing we walked away happy with was the beer... Sorry Sushi bistro, but we'll be going elsewhere in the future.
author: Brianna S.

description:
This place serves really refreshing and unique sushi. Wouldn't be my go-to spot for sushi, but love how they have a different take on making their sushi. 

Definitely will be coming back and recommend ordering only from their "speciality rolls".

Highly recommend their ahi tuna poke special, tempera, and M&L roll. Can't wait to try other stuff next time.

I also had really good service here as well. That's always a bonus!
author: K B.

description:
Decided to try Sushi Bistro on a whim after driving by.  WHAT A TREAT. Quite frankly, service was five stars in and of itself ! I sat at the sushi bar and was greeted warmly and promptly by the bartender, the food runner and the Owner(or so he seemed). Almost as quickly as I ordered my beer, miso soup and wakame salad- they were delivered. Nigiri is fresh and Big Island Roll was so CUTE. 
This is definitely a delightful Sushi destination. I'll be back soon with family,  for sure!
author: S J.

description: Not the overly fancy places you find in other parts of San Francisco, but it is moderately priced and provides quality and ambiance to match. A bit strange that they place a small cut of the same fish over their sushi, but overall a good, easy date night place if you want to enjoy decent food without spending several hundred dollars.
author: Kimberly H.

description: This place is reliably good. Warm atmosphere, sports on TV, usually pretty busy. It's a trendy spot. The sushi is high quality and the prices are also sometimes a bit high for the neighborhood. The miso soup is too sweet for my taste but the sushi is delicious and it keeps me coming back for more.
author: Jeromy C.

description:
I would say that Sushi Bistro is my favorite sushi restaurant in SF! I was amazed by the variety they had for veggie sushi rolls and they were all so unique! My boyfriend and I cobbled down two rolls so fast and we were definitely satisfied. 

We ordered the In the Sun and the Veggie Crunchy Roll. In the Sun was so unique, fresh, and light. I loved the sliced tomatoes on top - it made it look like some authentic seafood sushi. The Crunchy Roll was one of the best Veggie Crunchies I've had. I loved the sauce it was served with! 

We came on a Monday night and the place was still pretty crowded. We were lucky enough to be seated at the bar immediately. The service was good and the rolls came out pretty fast! The only thing is I wish this place was closer to me, but I will venture out again just for this amazing sushi!
author: Malika R.

description:
Always a pleasant experience. The sushi is fresh, the waitstaff is excellent and they take reservations. 
Hamachi, as well as, all of the nigiri items are generous and not overloaded with rice. Tempura is fresh and light.
author: NEIL L.

description:
This is by far one of the best "bang for your buck" sushi spots in San Francisco. The quality of fish is really great and the portions for the nigiri are easily the most generous I've seen in my life. I haven't had a ton of their rolls, but they are always really good and see people enjoying them throughout the restaurant. For me, it's all about the nigiri. 

Go To's: Ikura, Masago, Tobiko, Aji, Maguro

They have daily selections which are really unique and worth exploring. My advice would be to do some sort of omakase as the chef always knows best. Right? 

It's worth the trip to the Inner Richmond for those of you who don't live in the neighborhood. You'll be impressed.
author: Benjamin F.

description:
Best sushi I ever ate. So delicious everything we ordered without exception. The service was great,too!
I would definitely go there again.
author: Ira J.

description: I don't even know how this place got 4 stars on Yelp. My boyfriend and I came here on Valentine's Day since daigo was closed. Biggest mistake ever. We had the 10 piece omokase, uni nigiri, fatty tuna nigiri, blue fin tuna nigiri and the crouching tiger roll. Presentation was nice but man the taste was definitely not at all there. First bite and all the fishes were bland. When I take a bite of fish, I expect that buttery melt in your mouth taste. I didn't get that at all in any of the nigiris except the uni. My boyfriend will eat anything, but even the last piece of nigiri he spat out. The crouching tiger roll was just way too saucy.
author: Ada H.

description: Good neighborhood joint with a wide assortment of creative rolls and great service. Average pricing. However, not unique or amazing enough to make the commute if you aren't in the neighborhood, especially given the lack of parking. Only got rolls so can't comment on salads, cooked dishes, or nigiri.
author: Judy C.

description:
I ordered the butterfish blaster since it's a highlight here. It sounds good, but it's literally a chunk of imitation crab and avocado wrapped in butterfish. Sushi is getting more expensive in San Francisco and it's just not worth it. My boyfriend and I walked out here unsatisfied even though the bill was roughly $60. 

They take reservations even if it's literally an hour before the time.

We ordered 3 orders of nigiri and for some reason it came last.

Street parking may be difficult during the night.
author: Danae L.

description:
Sushi Bistro is probably not the best place to manifest simple authentic sushi. There are other spots in the city that are better suited for that. 

That being said - if you're craving unique playful sushi, or the not so healthy variety of hearty tempura filled rolls - Sushi Bistro is on point.

Sushi Bistro's menu is impressive and diverse. It's a great spot to cater to people who are a little apprehensive about sushi  - or those who are looking for quality vegan or vegetarian rolls. 

I like to order Sushi Bistro through a delivery app and I'm always satisfied.

In the past I've ordered the African Spider Roll, The Solistice Lettuce Wrap, the Crunchy Veggie Roll and the Butterfish Blasters. The Butterfish Blasters - didn't travel well during delivery - but I imagine they would be a fantastic appetizer if you eat them fresh at Sushi Bistro.

Sushi Bistro isn't cheap - but if you plan ahead and order wisely - it's a solid spot for a satisfying and enjoyable sushi experience.

Trust.
author: Jessica T.

description:
WORST place - AVOID!

No parking, rude staff, SHITTY rolls.
author: Duke Vespa P200E D.

description: Enjoyed the Tako (king Tuna belly), tempura squid with hella garlic flavor, butterfish and sexy scallops! Everything was delicious. Defiantly coming back for the poke with potato noodles which came recommended. Oh, awesome service too - very friendly :)
author: Clara A.

description: This is one of my favorite sushi places left in San Francisco. Great neighborhood gem. The sushi is phenomenal and I like the vibe inside. It's a popular spot so you have to get there early. I'm glad they now take online reservations through yelp.
author: Nicole M.

description:
Three girls. Five plates of sushi. It's a challenge!
Idk what we were trying to prove to the servers but we must of been hangry! We made reservations thinking that it may be packed on a Monday night at 6:15PM. We were wrong. Plenty of space however the place filled up quickly after we ordered.
The sexy scallop roll was my favorite! It was slightly warm with lots of sauce. It also had a good kick with every bite. I was intrigued by one of the special rolls that had the word 'Ceviche' in its name. It was a very light and refreshing roll. I would recommend it if you really like avocado because it includes a full bit of it! We also ordered the African spider roll as per suggestion from one of the servers. He informed us that the African Spider roll earned an award some years back. I thought it was a decent roll but not my favorite. Overall, I would come again if I was craving sushi that wasn't going to break the bank!
author: Sally Z.

description: Came to SF on a business trip and ate here after a long high through the presidio. Loved the African spider roll, agedashi tofu, and Miso soup. Great service and the restaurant is nice and spacious. Excellent experience.
author: Peter X.

description: Super close by to me, so location is a huge winner.  A tad pricey when you go to town, but if you choose a few appetizers/small plates, you don't need as many rolls, which is the perfect combination.  I am not the most adventurous when it comes to sushi, but I will say that they're spicy tuna is so simple and so perfect and I could eat it forever.
author: Maggie A.

description:
Great place! Sushi was great, sake was great, sapporo, service, atmosphere.
We didn't like the texture of the caucasian afro so much. 
The magic mushroom dish was a bit too fried for my taste. 
I would have done better staying away from the unique menu, but I had no regrets.
Would recommend.
author: Michael P.

description: First time here...with so many Japanese restaurants in the area, it was difficult to make a decision which one to go with.  We made the right decision!  Sushi was delicious and fresh!  Daughter also ordered agedashi and I had the udon.... Really happy with the food and service..
author: Pammy C.

description:
The Tic and the Tacs: 

Tics 
*Love interior, very modern with nice bar, rooms with karaoke machines for private parties, and a big karaoke screen in the common area. 
*Happy hour Monday-Thursday 10pm-12am
*came since they had the $10 for $20 deal on yelp
*Fried oysters $5 for 5 pieces of breaded fried oysters during happy hour
*Raiders scallop: baked scallops roll! I enjoyed this one most! Although portion was  small. 
* make reservations on yelp through open table and I guarantee you no wait!

Tacs
* although I had the deal, it is easily overspent since they have small portions with a higher price
*Lion king roll: wasn't the best... It was kinda oily and too much mayonnaise... The salmon was a bit.... thick for me and the rice was super soggy from everything 
*angry bird roll: I personally would skip this next time... Cooked roll but I didn't really like it since it was drowned in strips of cold seaweed? 
*service was a hit or miss. Sometimes I got nice servers. sometimes... Not so much... 
*as you can tell from the name it isnt a 100% authentic Japanese place, so the sushi rolls were all.... Very decent... As in I won't come back unless someone paid for me and begged to come here...

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/sushi-bistro-san-francisco?select=ajG0qBJm5zQrhUuNrT6Ijg
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/sushi-bistro-san-francisco?select=ajG0qBJm5zQrhUuNrT6Ijg#y4cuJ8Aa0qEYFG_ewPRwag
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/sushi-bistro-san-francisco?select=ajG0qBJm5zQrhUuNrT6Ijg#PW5Hm16rXbgDW4PL9Xq9NA
author: Chena N.

description:
Fish was a little under cooked

No but seriously this place was delicious. I'd highly recommend the new legend roll or the hot love.
author: Mike D.

description: This place is great. Excellent food and an exceptional staff. It's on our shortlist of SF treasures.
author: Rick R.

description:
I'm torn between giving this place a solid three stars as in my opinion, only one dish that we ordered for dinner hit the mark. Our family had been wanting to try this place for some time based on the 4 star yelp reviews and recently decided to give it a go.

Like other yelpsters have mentioned in their posts, this place can best be descrbed as hip  with a certain upbeat vibe. Having made reservations, we were immediately seated by the host who may have been one of the mangers and he described the specials in detail that were on their "specials" list. Unfortunately, we were missing one individual in our party who was parking the car even though he knew there would be four people dining. It would have been nice if he had waited until everyone was seated.

Like Anu P stated, our party might have had the same non-smiling female server as when my wife asked what was popular regarding the sushi rolls, she could have done a better job of recommending some based on asking what our tastes were like.

We ordered the Butterfish Blaster which is a SB Favorite and our party agreed that this was pretty good if you like seared fish.

African Spider was nothing special as was the Monter in Law. Two of us ordered udon of which I had the Nabeyaki which was pretty good with the only exception being that the tempura was presented in the broth at the time of service which meant part of the pieces were already soggy by the time I pulled it out of the soup. A better way would have been to present the tempura on a separate plate.

Final rating is 2.5 stars for this lackluster dining experience.
author: Richard H.

description:
I really love this sushi spot! I had dinner with a friend here and could not have been any happier with the food and service.  

We ordered 4 rolls: 
Butterfish Blasters
Red Devil
M&L Forever
The New Legend

Butterfish Blasters:
"Snow crab meat and avocado wrapped in butterfish, torched with a garlic-soy." I would say without a doubt that this is one of their must-have rolls! The butterfish had a smooth texture. Very good!

Red Devil:
"Butterfish tempura, aioli, avocado and cucumber, topped with scallions and spicy tuna, red serrano lemongrass sauce." I probably could've eaten all the rolls myself because they were so flavorful! The sauce had a good kick to it and the spicy tuna was a great touch.

M&L Forever:
"Spicy tuna, crabmeat, Cajun flavored albacore, avocado and grilled big eye tuna inside a crispy exterior drizzled with bonito sauce." These rolls were pretty big and tasty. I wouldn't have thought that Cajun albacore would be good, but it was!

The New Legend:
"Shrimp tempura, spicy aioli, avocado topped with seared albacore, spicy garlic sauce and scallions." The albacore was really fresh and I enjoyed the little bit of heat from the aioli. It's definitely another must-have in my book!

Overall, I had a great experience here. We were greeted once we arrived and didn't have to wait for a table because we got there soon after they opened. Our waitress was attentive as well and always refilled our water. I highly suggest making your way down here if you're craving specialty rolls. It also seems like a good place for a date!

Total:
$64 including tip.
author: Fallon P.

description:
Really good service and food!
Started: Miso Soup and Edamame
Drank: Kirin on Draft
Food: Crouching Tiger (favorite but I love eel), Rainbow Roll (also delicious), African Spider (really good), and 49er Roll (saw good reviews on here...it was good but I'm not a huge fan of the lemon flavor on top...took the lemon off and it was good!)
Desert: Mango ice cream (not the best ice cream I have ever had but really good for the $2 cost and a decent portion) and the Mango Mochi (which was good)
author: Patrick S.

description:
We have come to this place several times, and we always love their menu, everything is really good quality and service is great, friendly and always pending of needs.. 
Recommend UNI and all the vegetarian sushi's
author: Arturo D.

description: Amazing sushi!  My first taste of sushi after giving birth and it was well worth the wait.  The sushi is always really good. I love all the unique rolls.  My favorite is the butter fish roll.  To die for!
author: Jeannine M.

description: Great service. Love the food and unique taste. Tried the veggie rolls and they were both amazing. The avocado roll was delightful. Must try this place again
author: Tech F.

description:
This place is delicious!! 

Ambiance: Very cute and not too crowded. A variety of people- in jeans and converse, dressed up nice- you can make it whatever you want.

Service- Amazing service. Everyone was very fast and attentive. After ordering our drinks, I wanted to switch tables because I was cold by the window, and they gladly helped us move.

Drinks- I got the cabernet, which was really good and not ridiculously expensive ($8 for a glass)

Food- The butterfish/ avocado roll-up under "something unique" was SO good. I would give that 4.5/5 (only because the butterfish was cooked and I think I like raw butterfish better). For rolls, we got the Red Devil which was really good!!! I would say 5/5. We also got the M&L roll. I liked it but the cajun albacore was kind of weird. I would give it 3.5/5, but my date probably would say 5/5.

Overall- Will definitely be coming back!
author: Jenna G.

description:
This place is the best of both worlds. It has something for everyone. Here are some highlights

- Best veggie udon I've ever had

- Very creative rolls and dishes (like the hot love, magic mushrooms)

- Really good brown rice rolls (I like the prawn pod and red devil)

- Excellent veggie rolls (into the sun, Asparacado)

The fish quality is also excellent. You can't go wrong by just ordering nigiri/sashimi at this spot.
author: J. K.

description: Ordered through Postmates and this was disgusting. I got the omega-3 one that literally tasted like canned tuna in a roll, completely inedible. The new legend was also not good as the fish on top did not taste fresh at all. I could even finish two pieces. Had to throw the whole order out. Postmates won't do anything in terms of a refund because they said that's not their problem, and the website had no email address so that was a waste of $40
author: S J.

description:
There's a time & place for Jiro Dreams of Purists. (http://www.yelp.com/biz/okina-sushi-san-francisco?hrid=Iv3WI4QUyt1uiRfMIEgYfg) But that time is not hangry o'clock & that place is not Sushi Beastmode.

Soosh Beesh is more in the #doowutchyalike (http://youtu.be/yMZ6D2usdFU) camp, similar to Korean-owned sushi where anything goes with roll names and ingredients.

Though I'm rounding up to 4 stars, I must address two of the menu items:

Billie Jean roll: Unless squares on the plate light up when I step-hop my food across it, this is just a tease.

Watermelon-man roll: There's no. water. melon. in this roll. It's not enough to name a roll after a cool jazz song. I'm the type of man for whom the word "watermelon" is like a dog whistle - I *will* come running and barking whenever it's said. And when it's said, there had better be some.
author: Dan B.

description:
Wow. Each slice of a sushi roll feels like you've eaten a whole hamburger. Each bite is so packed that I feel like I'm a judge on Top Chef as I try to find out what ingredients were used. It's impossible to describe each flavor because every bite unfolds differently with every passing moment. I just feel overhwelmed and full just thinking about one bite. Best bang for your buck.

Fantastic for groups and late night girl gossip. Order one roll for each person, then share! And, the hot tea and mochi ice cream are delish!
author: Regina D.

description:
Easily one of my favorite places in SF.  Everyone there is awesome and the food is fantastic.  I would definitely recommend this place to anyone.

Favorite Items:
5 Wishes
Crunchy Roll
Red Dragon
author: Steven D.

description:
Lots of creative sushi rolls.

Good quality on the fish.

Call ahead, cuz the wait is an upstream battle...
author: R J.

description: We got here at 7:30 and it took us forever to find a parking spot here. Only had to wait 10 minutes however they seated us at a bar even though there was a few table that were open. It would be nice if the host ask us what we prefer though. We got the 12 piece sashimi, crouching tiger, African spider, 49ers, and whole grilled squid. Everything was okay nothing really outstanding. I wouldn't come again. The bill total was 97$ without including tips.
author: Tina C.

description: Can where with a group for dinner, and it was great! The fish was fresh and tasty, and the ambiance inside the restaurant is super cool and modern! My bf and I split the pepper poppers, the crouching tiger hidden dragon, and one of the other specialty rolls (can't remember which one) we loved them all, and we could've even ordered another to split! Would definitely come back to try some of their other rolls!
author: Rachel D.

description:
Venue: looove the ambiance, cute date spot for dinner, everything is clean and sleek
Parking: always a pain, went on a Sunday night and parked about a block down

Sushi:
African spider - cute presentation, taste good as well. I get over the soft shell crab bits in my teeth after awhile
Crouching tiger - they put huge chunks of very soft, fresh, and tasty unagi! LOVED that it was saucy with extra unagi sauce on top, def ordering this again
Hawaiian breeze - very interesting! Tasted good. The pesto was very different for me but it grew on me because I love tuna + mango in sushi

All of the staff was very helpful, attentive, and sweet!
author: Elle P.

description:
Muah! That's what you give a man that takes you here! 

Very short trip to SF, but couldn't miss grabbing sushi dinner in the Richmond district. Now that my expenses are paid Piti can fill you in on Yelp about this hidden gem. 

I've always assumed that people from SF know 2 things, good wine and good sushi. I can now confirm 1 of those 2 things. I may need some convincing that the SF crowd may know good wine :) 

After some intense smooching, we headed over for a fairy tale of sushi. The two of us knew we had 1 night of passion. We shared a ridiculous amount of the sushi we both craved. Monster in law and red devil. Stop. It ends here. If only. 

We had to let things end. We ended in tears. Maybe from the wasabi, or maybe from our desire to keep smooching across the street.  Beautiful.
author: Leah D.

description: From someone who knows exactly what good sushi is, this place didn't meet my expectations. Not sure what the rave is all about. I'll have to say the best thing is the SUSHI RICE, which is quite disappointing. It's overly expensive for some mediocre rolls. However, the service was excellent. I just probably wouldn't ever come back to spend $100 on a couple rolls.
author: Michelle L.

description:
After spending 4 days in San Fran guessing at places to eat, we finally met up with some local friends who brought us to Sushi Bistro.  I wish we had asked days before because we would have had dinner here every night!  I had to get everything cooked (pregnant) so I went with the African spider which was delicious!  Also got the grilled squid which was yummy as well.  

My hubby highly recommends the Aladdin saki and whatever the tuna special is at the time
author: Lauren W.

description:
Beautiful presentation for all their dishes! Decent sushi rolls with creative names. Very dim lighting.

We came as a large group for dinner and was seated in the back. Decent service, but felt really rushed towards the end of our dinner, as the waiter kept come back to check on us (where were you when we needed you earlier that night?). 

Long story short, my eyes were delighted with their presentation but stomach was only satisfactory.
author: Sara T.

description: Very solid choice for sushi. I thought the sushi and sashimi was fresh, flavorful, well-balanced. Had several rolls (including Albacore Dream, Nemo Found, and the class Spicy Tuna) and they were all delicious. Service was good, and the restaurant itself fostered a good ambiance and environment. Will plan on returning.
author: Will H.

description: We spent $50 per person on low grade fish in an environment with screaming kids who kept kicking the partition between our 2 tables.  The service was sub-par with waiters quickly setting down the food without saying a word.  It would have been nice to know what fish we were eating.  What a disappointment!
author: Alice L.

description:
Hubs and I came in for a late and light dinner and were seated right away. 

Food was ok. Loved the thinly sliced pickled cucumbers w/ sesame seed. The miso soup was a bit bland, miso cod was silky, toro was fresh, Uni was unctuous and the spider roll was a bit oily. 

The staff in general were nice - cleared our finished dishes right away and made sure my water was always refilled. Our waitress was meh. It's a pet peeve for me when I hand my credit card over only to have the receipt be brought over to my dinner mate after the charge. Like, you saw me open up my wallet and hand you the card. Why the hell would you then make me reach across the table to sign for it. Ugh.
author: Julie L.

description: This is my all time FAVORITE sushi place!!! The Hawaiian Breeze is my jam! I live right down the street and visit this place at least once a week! It has a really cool vibe inside as well with a sushi bar, a regular bar (complete with a couple of TVs playing sports) and great service! My sister, who doesn't like sushi, actually requests that we go to this place...that is how amazing it is! I am such a fan, definitely visit this joint when you get the chance. Prices are reasonable too!
author: Natalie F.

description: Best neighborhood sushi and bar - love it- for tech history buffs was one of the original snapshots on the first iPhone ad on tv
author: Thomas B.

description:
After watching Jiro Dreams of Sushi, the hubs and I had to satisfy our sushi craving.  We wanted to try a new place and we were not disappointed.  Definitely a place to come back to.

- Service: great - friendly and attentive
- Price:  reasonable
- Food:  overall really delicious
  - Unagi Nigiri:  my favorite of everything we tried
  - African Spider:  great presentation & texture
  - Hawaiian Breeze:  pleasantly surprised
  - Uni Tempura (special):  the only dish I wasn't crazy because it lacked flavor
author: Rose A.

description:
I found this place by accident, and it suddenly became my go-to sushi spot. They have really unique rolls which I think sets it apart from the other sushi places I've been to. While you order, they give you a small plate of cucumber sunomono as a free appetizer. I try to stay away from the usual rolls when I come here (rainbow, 49er, spider, etc.) and go for their more unique stuff. My absolute favorite is the double jeopardy. It's basically a tuna/salmon tartare with shrimp chips. This is like crack to me. I order it every time I come here... along with another roll. My other favorites include Hawaiian Breeze and Monster in-laws.

I highly recommend this place! And try to order something from Something Unique/Signature Rolls!
author: J K.

description:
We stumbled out of Golden Gate Park into the Inner Richmond and decided to look up the nearest sushi place on a whim. OH MY GOD. We ordered some nigiri and yes, it is a tad pricey, but you receive HUGE pieces of fish - like, despite my best efforts, I could not have eaten the whole piece in one bite. I ordered the king salmon off the seasonal menu and I think I got high when I ate it. I'm going to dream about this dinner for 6 years. We ordered a caterpillar and a ruby rainbow roll too and they were both good and well portioned. 

But really.

Go. Eat. Nigiri.
author: Natalie P.

description:
Came by for dinner the other night. Made a reservation a few days in advance to ensure a table upon arrival.

The staff and clientele were mainly Caucasian...

Started off with the miso soup which was okay. The side salad came with very little dressing...very healthy...

The Yellowtail belly sashimi was very fatty and tasty.

The lettuce wraps were decent with the Equinox being better than the Solstice. This was basically sushi without the rice.

The Sexy Scallop was my favorite roll of the evening being flavorful and small. I'm not a big fan of huge rolls that I cannot put in my mouth...

The Crouching Tiger Hidden Dragon was pretty much a Dragon roll. It was decent but the Unagi was a little too thin for my tastes.

The Red Devil was okay...probably the least favorite roll of the evening.

Service was decent...but the staff removed my soup before I was done?!?

...parking was very difficult as it took me ~20 minutes and I still only parked ~5 blocks away...

~$45/head after tax & tip
author: Derek S.

description: Nice little place for sushi and such. Has a bit of a bar vibe in there but we loved the sesame chicken & crunchy veggie roll!
author: Janell S.

description: We came here with friends who are regulars. It was FANTASTIC! We ordered butterfish bladders which were amazing; sushi which was so fresh; and tempura that was perfect! GO! (PS staff was very toddler friendly)
author: jen m.

description:
Sushi Bistro wasn't crowded at all when my bf and I came right when the restaurant opened for dinner on a Monday. We shared three rolls, all of which I thought were very tasty: 

**African spider: although the crab legs served alongside the roll were super crunchy, the soft shell crab inside the roll was a bit soft.  

**Butterfish blasters: these just melted in my mouth. flavorful and savory. i could eat 2 orders by myself. 

**Monster in-laws: wasn't as spicy as expected but it was a nice roll that didn't include a battered ingredient and focused more on the raw fish.

Even though we ordered just  rolls, we didn't get them all at once. We would get one roll, finish the plate, and then get the next roll. I would have preferred to have all rolls on the table at once so I could enjoy different pieces simultaneously. Nonetheless, service was very friendly. After we inhaled the rolls and got the check, it seemed pricey but considering that each roll had fresh and well put together ingredients, I feel that the food quality justifies the price.
author: Maya S.

description:
Big portions. Good quality fish at SF prices.

Sushi Bistro was a pleasant surprise. I ordered 4 seasonal nigiri dishes, 2 pieces per, at about $10 per order. The sushi was flavorful, and the portions were much bigger than expected: long and thick cuts of fish that I had to work into my mouth almost like a noodle. A nice sensation!

After the nigiri, a roll, and a beer, I left feeling full and satisfied that I got great bang for my buck.

4 stars, would come again.
author: Matthew K.

description: Sushi bistro is a favorite in SF! Not only are their sushi rolls original, creative and delicious, but you won't get the quality or amount of sashimi anywhere else in the city! This is a must try for sushi lovers!
author: Carey T.

description:
Great service, mediocre food.

Got the beef "rib eye" teriyaki and tempura. The over marinated dainty 5oz piece of meet was slathered in sauce and only had a slight essence of beef. The tempura was nothing to write home about.

On the sushi rolls- we got the african spider, caterpillar roll, m&l roll and the sexy scallop.  The best roll was the sexy scallop, the rest were unauthentic amateur hour sushi rolls. The menu should clarify that you will not be getting sashimi grade tuna but something that resembles starkist canned tuna.

The place is ok if you are into that sort of thing? But if you are looking for actual sushi, skip!
author: Trish M.

description:
Great neighborhood place with nice staff, good food, decent prices.

When I walked in I knew it would be good as they recognized and greeted my dining companion who had no doubt eaten there many times. It was full-ish, and we sat at the sushi bar which was just fine. 

We shared a variety of dishes, some farmed bluefin tuna, some sea urchin, miso soup, some rolls and a cooked fish dish, as well as like a fish tartare of some kind we spread on little crackers. Everything was good and fresh tasting and service was excellent.

Also we shared 3 bottles of Aladdin sake which comes in a little Genie bottle which is cute and it's pretty decent non-filtered sake.
author: Jordan C.

description: The perfect local spot for sushi fans. I come here on about a bi-weekly basis, and the rolls are always good. Big fan of the spicy crunch roll.
author: Sunja C.

description:
This is my favorite sushi/sashimi in San Francisco. I eat here often enough in my travels that the owner knows me-okay he already knew my friends so that helps.

I always sit at the bar and have them bring me whatever is on the specials list. Add in a few great apps or oysters to start-and away we go.

If they have the King Salmon, get it. It's the best I've had including fresh at Tsukiji Market in Tokyo. 

The last plate came out in a circle of fish. 6 different orders. Each bite better than the next. 

It is not inexpensive but it should cost more than it does for this quality.

My best advice-ask for recommendations and go outside your comfort zone. You won't regret it.
author: Michael R.

description:
After a long mixed review, owner kindly replied and explained.  Appreciate his commitment towards their customers.

I like their food, fishes r always fresh and rolls ajd specials are very creative. 

Their customer service  is most likely friendly. 

We've tried nigiri plates, and fish slices were generous, rice was good.
author: Stacy U.

description: Fresh fish for sashimi! Yellow tail sashimi is great. Vegetarian tempura was very good. Miso seabass average. Gyoza was great. 4 fish combo was great. Bread pudding not so good. Mango ice team tempura was good.
author: Sridevi K.

description:
Came here to celebrate my dad's birthday on a Monday evening. We were able to get a spot on the online reservation the night before. 

What we ordered (taste ranked):

- African Spider Roll         
- Sexy Scallop Roll            
- Butterfish Blasters             
- Omega-3
- M & L forever
- Crouching tiger hidden dragon

Many reviews on Yelp have said that the Crouching Tiger Roll was very delicious. It was highly anticipated and when we finally tried it, we were quite disappointed. There was too much rice and too little eel. It also seemed like the shrimp tempura inside had gone a little stale. I usually really enjoy dragon rolls but this one just wasn't for me. On the other hand, the African Spider Roll was very delicious. Inside had soft shell crab which made it taste even better. I would definitely recommend ordering this one. The M & L forever and Omega-3 did not really leave an impression on me. It was just "alright". I consider them as the rolls that are "okay" priced and will fill me up. There wasn't anything special about them (flavor, presentation) so that is why i rank them lower. Sexy Scallop and Butterfish both were very delicious and unique. I had never eaten Butterfish before and I was glad to try it at this place. Though the portion was small (tiny 6 little pieces), I thought the presentation was unique and the sauce was wonderful.
author: Tiffany L.

description: Delicious vegetarian sushi! They are made with brown rice and are so fresh and yummy. They have about 10 options there. Gluten free if you ask for it without soy sauce or sauces. Worth the wait. Make a reservation first, though. Wait for the Bar is 20 minutes. Nice waiter, too.
author: R. M.

description:
First, I have to saw that many yelpers really liked the butterfish, but I am telling you: beware!! Our experience was great, and then it was not so great. We saw good reviews so decided to try it. As soon as we saw a butterfish roll on the menu, we knew we had to get it because butterfish is bomb. 

Unfortunately, when it arrived it was not butterfish. We had asked the waiter what escolar was initially, because it said it was in the roll & didn't know what it was. When it arrived, it sort of looked like calamari-wrapped-sushi. After taking the smallest bite, I knew I had to look at the description of the roll again - lo and behold, this "escolar" was the calamari-like thing. I used my handy dandy Google machine and found out that butterfish is sometimes fraudulently sold as escolar. 

Escolar can cause many health problems apparently, so after telling the waiter that this is not what we ordered, he finally took it back. I mean, hey, he literally told us that escolar is butterfish when we had asked! They took it off our bill and our other rolls were actually pretty good. The salmon nigiri was delicious as well. JUST BEWARE THE BUTTERFISH!!!!
author: Callie S.

description: Been here a few times now.   Great food every time.  Sat at the bar once and twice at a table.   Last time was for the wife's birthday.   Food is always great, fresh and service comes with a smile.   The only complaint is that the place is LOUD!    if you're looking for a date night with an intimate setting where you can have a great conversation without yelling... this is NOT the place for you.   its like grand central station.   In many cases... there is little to be done about that... but here they encourage the loudness.    I thought it was just a fluke the fisrt time, but its now been every time... so next time I come back... I'm wearing earplugs and will be texting back and forth with my wife across the table.    However... The food was great!
author: Vlad C.

description:
Took the bf here for his birthday dinner - we both loved it! 

Ambiance: Lively and fun energy. We saw people in jeans, on date nights, and everything in between. 

Service: Extremely fast. Our rolls came out before we finished our edamame and since we ordered so much...dining disaster on our tiny table for 2. Our waitress wasn't the nicest (no smiles, small talk or recs), but she was quick, refilled our waters etc. 

Food: Being a vegetarian, I'm always on the hunt for good veggie sushi. Sushi Bistro kills it with unique combinations and flavors. No avo-cucumber rolls here, folks. I got 2 vegetarian rolls (a little ambitious): Notorious VEG (fuji apple, inari, cucumber topped with avocado served with ponzu) and In the Sun (avocado, cucumber and mango wrapped in soy paper topped with thin sliced tomato). Both were fantastic - generous servings of avocado and since we were celebrating, I had them use the white instead of the typical brown rice they put on veggie rolls. This might be why some of the sushi was not as put together as usual when I picked it up but didn't matter much.

Pricing: Extremely affordable. We paid about $80 for 4 rolls (2 of those were veggie), edamame, plate of inari (highly recommend), a beer and a lemonade. We had enough for a late night snack with how much we ordered - the rolls are definitely not small. 

Verdict: Our new favorite sushi spot!
author: Anu P.

description:
Delicious sushi for a reasonable price (for the portion, quality and presentation). I won't be coming here often (I don't usually eat out much and, when I do, I try to spend much less on dinner) but the fish is fresh/delicious, the rolls are unique and expertly crafted, and the staff are wonderful (my friend and I loitered at the sushi bar for 2+ hours with minimal interruptions yet they were extremely attentive). The atmosphere was very hip and upscale. It was very easy to carry on a conversation.
