Had the Butterfish Blaster roll (the sauce!), Spider roll (not as good as other places- wish there was more crab and it had been fried longer for crunchier texture), Monster In-Law roll (tos of meat), Summer lettuce wrap, a bunch of Nigiri (including ocean trout omg), and Suigei (drunk whale) sake. Everything was delicious!!

Had quite a few veggie roll options which I will definitely have to come back to try the next time I want to splurge. Had no wait on a Monday night. Thanks to Sushi Bistro and for my friend for introducing me to it!
author: Nas M.

description:
Went there really late last night about near closing time and they were still able to take my order for take out.

Rainbow roll was small but very good!
author: Kenny P.

description:
Popped in shortly after they opened and were seated right away. The first thing I notice is the floor, I hated the texture, but otherwise the decor was nothing special. Tables are, sadly, pushed too close together and we have to squeeze through to get to the Bench Seat, HUGE pet peeve of mine. 

The menu was massive, and we settled on some yummy rolls:

Watermelon-Man: Surprisingly Spicy, the mango really added the sweetness needed to cut the pepper flavor of the spicy tuna, loved the avocado on top, but didn't really get a taste of any macadamia nuts.
Photo: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/sushi-bistro-san-francisco?select=8CxsVqrtqRM0biN3MO55EA#8CxsVqrtqRM0biN3MO55EA

Billie Jean: My favorite FOR SURE. Baby Lobster with fresh avocado, cucumber and wrapped with soy paper (I love this stuff) and aioli and topped with salmon, which was a GREAT touch. Very light and fresh.
Photo: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/sushi-bistro-san-francisco?select=8CxsVqrtqRM0biN3MO55EA#hMiABn0zYF4M4m_0k2f2vQ

M&L forever: spicy tuna, crab meat, cajun flavored albacore, avocado, and grilled big eye tuna inside a crispy exterior drizzled with bonito sauce. (pulled directly from the website). This was an interesting roll, the cajun flavored albacore was really mild, the grilled big eye tuna had the texture of dried pork. Needed more Bonito Sauce. Not a favorite.
Photo: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/sushi-bistro-san-francisco?select=8CxsVqrtqRM0biN3MO55EA#l4hmcKxDRohAFItSPSWfMQ

Butterfish Blasters: Anything wrapped in Butterfish is delicious, but it's a total win when it's snow crab and avocado with a torched Garlic-Soy glaze. THIS was a wonderful dish and it was so beautiful! 
Photo: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/sushi-bistro-san-francisco?select=8CxsVqrtqRM0biN3MO55EA#J-UFpj2s2OoZ7RuTNf2X_A

Quality of the fish is fresh, some of the sushi rolls fell apart when we picked them up.

The waitress was nice enough, but forgot to bring us cups of tea when we asked for it mid-way through our meal. 

Over all, this was a decent place, but my boyfriend and I agreed that it wasn't anything to write home about and we could have gone to our usual spot for half the price and the exact same quality. You pay for presentation here for sure.
author: Meghan L.

description:
Super confused and disappointed. I was being undecisive and may have ordered some of the crappiest rolls ever. Well to be fair, I had assumed that the rolls would come with raw fish but instead were all cooked. Still, cooked rolls could be tasty! These weren't!!

We had Ahi Tuna Poke Special $15, which was the best dish we had
Billie Jean $13 - "baby lobster, avocado, cucumber wrapped with soy paper and aioli and topped with salmon"
Spicy Crunchy $11 - "yellowtail, salmon, snapper, shrimp and macadamia nuts deep-fried served with spicy house sauce"
Tempura $9
Agedashi Tofu $7

These are the descriptions pulled from their menu on their website. Pleeeease tell me I'm not the only one that would assume Baby Lobster should be raw?! And also the yellowtail, salmon, and snapper in the second roll???

Omg I was so mad when these rolls came.. Mostly at myself first, but now after rereading the menu, at them!! 

I feel completely jipped and unsatisfied. Not to mention, this meal wasn't cheap. $55 before tax and tip for two.. I could get the same weird fried/cooked rolls from Kiki's for half the price. And their's may actually taste better.
author: Athena L.

description:
Fabulous Neighborhood Restaurant!

We came here as a large group and they could not have been more accommodating and helpful.  Excellent selection of fun and creative rolls along with many of the traditional items.  Solid selection of Sake, good service and reasonably priced.  If you have folks in your group that are not sushi fans no worries there is a bunch of options.
author: Jonathan G.

description: This is my favorite place for sashimi in the city. Generous portions, fresh, and exquisite. Get the omasake sashimi. You won't be disappointed.
author: Christophe T.

description: It is difficult to find a great sushi spot in the city. We sushi lovers all know that. But this place will be my regular spot. I came here for valentines days and I was not expecting anything close to an even average service because of the busy night but we received a great service. The foods are all yummy so you will never get disappointed with what you order.
author: Yashar M.

description: Amazing quality and big portions. Get what's in season and it won't disappoint you. This is high crafted sushi. I'll see you there
author: Zane D.

description:
Excellent fish, good selection, interesting menu - Sushi Bistro has some great, modern (read: non-traditional) sushi.
I've come here three times and have especially enjoyed the "magic mushrooms" off of the "something unique" section of the menu.
author: Jeff C.

description:
I am so lucky to have this place basically in my backyard weeee. Fish is always fresh and decor is contemporary and modern. Loud enough to bring friends or go on a date here before going out later but small enough to just come here and spend a night in.  Wait time is usually not bad and you can call to make a reservation.  

Uni is good when they have it. They give yummy pickled cucumbers as appetizers. I like their uni and their soft shell crab dishes when they have it.
author: Kristin C.

description:
I love sushi bistro! I'm not extremely into sushi (shocker, I know) so I usually go with the teriyaki salmon or the fall lettuce wrap..... 
The fall lettuce wrap is incredible. Salmon, avocado, rice, spicy mayo... Oowee!! :)

Sometimes a bit noisy, but reasonably priced and always amazing service!!
author: Alyssa H.

description:
Mehhh
Food was not impressive. A bit disappointing since their menu looked pretty cool with brown rice and veggie options.

Started off with miso cod.  It was over cooked and texturally tasted unfresh. Definitely tastes the frozen fish they used. No grilled marks; seems as if they steamed it and dumbed a lot of miso on top.  Very salty as well.  we could not even eat it. We only ate the steamed string beans on the bottom.
We shared a few rolls, which had overcooked rice.  
Nothing impressive. Service was ok but they seemed rushy for a half empty place during the 5-6 pm time.
author: Linda T.

description: Cute neighborhood sushi place. Great for a late-night bite to eat on 24th (most of the restaurants close fairly early in this neighborhood. This is one of the last to close.).
author: Dani D.

description:
We have been here a couple times and each time we try something new. 

Watermelon-man, aloha 101 were both similar and pretty tasty. We were not a huge fan of the way the ahi poke was presented (although it was good)...I prefer smaller cuts and not mixed as a salad as it is here. The veggie goyzas left something to be desired. 

Stick with the sushi as it is fresh and delicious. Always happy to try something different when i come back.
author: Derek S.

description:
I love the inner richmond and restaurants like sushi bistro are the reason why. what a chill, cool little restaurant. We went early ...like when they open at 5. So we were seated right away and the staff was really wonderful. I have walked my four legged friend by here later at night and the place can be just crazy busy...so word up.

The sushi is really awesome..we had the basic rolls and they were all fresh tasty and just outstanding. Their fish is top quality and their portions are good. Prices are reasonable for sushi. They also have Asahi on draft...yum

I would highly recommend. Parking is not too bad compared with clement or geary.
author: David G.

description: Love this place!  High quality sushi!
author: Steve R.

description: The sushi here is amazing. Prices are well worth the standard of sushi here. If you are going out for sushi this place is the place to go - a little loud but if you have a large group you can request to sit in the back where it is quieter. I've already been twice in one week...  YUMMM
author: Mark M.

description:
THEY USED CANNED TUNA INSTEAD OF FRESH TUNA!!!!!!!!! I shit u not ppl!!! Maybe it's cause we were so late to arrive? But yes. They used canned grey tuna in all of the rolls that were supposed to have fresh tuna.. Never seen something like this before. No money off the bill either. Towards the end of the night they ran out of fresh tuna so they used this. what in the world.. I've never seen something like this before. 

The waitress was also so beyond rude and demanding then towards the end when we got our bill put on this bizzarely fake happy voice to try and get a good tip I suppose lol. 

I'm just stunned...Canned tuna. At a sushi restaurant. Any sushi chef who is willing to send out a roll with canned tuna is obviously not one who takes his craft seriously. Do not eat here. Just buy a can of tuna at Safeway for 75 cents. 

Terrible service... Food was just confusing & really unappetizing. Idk why sushi bistro has 4 yelp stars.. This restaurant is an absolute joke. Again, canned. Tuna. i....i....just.... don't....understand. End rant.
author: Jayne O.

description:
I love this sushi place ! It's always fresh fish and David the owner is very accommodating ! 
Try Red Devil roll and Double Jeopardy !!! 
Bon Apetit
author: Alia B.

description:
I came here randomly last night for a late dinner. This sushi restaurant had a very cool and sleek interior. It had dimmed lighting with dark furniture. It was more spacious than your average SF sushi spot. The ambience was hip and somewhat romantic. It would be a good place for a date or a just a fun dinner. It was also very casual with an intimate setting! The staff here was nice. Our waiter was very helpful with suggestions and friendly. 

They offer a large variety of rolls. They also have brown rice rolls! All of the sushi rolls we ordered were fresh and delicious! I want to come back to try their salad wraps.. they sound very refreshing.

We ordered the Albacore Dream, Aloha, and Hirame Fusion sushi rolls. My favorite was the Albacore Dream! It was so good .. maybe because I personally love albacore. None of the rolls were overdressed of sauces. The Aloha roll was my least favorite. It looked like it was going to be very flavorful in the pictures but it was a little bland. It might have been because mango is not in season. However, they gave large portions of ahi tuna in the roll. For something flash fried, it was also very light.

Happy eating!
author: Thatcher H.

description:
The sushi is great, without a doubt, but the reason this place stands out is because of their creative options. Pick an entree from their "Something Unique" section and you'll find that they are pushing into fusion territory with unconventional ingredients and entree categories (they have a hefty salad menu.)

Props for being innovative and doing it well.
author: Mimi X.

description:
I FINALLY made my way out to Sushi Bistro, I've read about it, heard people rave about it but had never made the trek. I'm SO glad I finally went there, it more than lived up to it's rave reviews. I went with a friend and we got a few rolls to share: The Notorious Veggie, 49er, Spider Roll and the Hawaiian Breeze. The Hawaiian Breeze was my personal favorite, it was so different from anything I've had before, it has this cilantro pesto on it with macadamia nuts. I was skeptical at first but out waiter said it was one of the best so we gave it a shot and I'm so glad we did! 

The restaurant itself is pretty big but it does get filled up around 7 or so. I had made reservations so we were able to be seated right away. The staff was super friendly and welcoming. I will definitely be back soon, there are still so many rolls I want to try! Dare I say it's my new favorite sushi spot in SF :) It's 100% worth the trek out there.
author: Lizzy U.

description:
I've walked by this place for years and finally tried it out. I was not expecting much;  seemed not authentic and a bit hipster ish for me,

Well I was sorta kinda wrong. Yeah, not authentic, but damn what I had was good! 
The ahi poke salad had giant glistening chunks of fish, baby greens and crunchy noodles ( reminiscent of Chung King...but good)

All of the rolls I saw looked good, but just tried one and  I loved  it, and wow gorgeous. Chosen for no rice ( trying to cut carbs) the Big Hawaii was not inexpensive, but definitely worth the $15. It was filled with crab, avocado, ahi...and forget what else. 

I can't speak to any of the home style stuff, but for sushi and the poke salad, I'll be a regular.
author: El B.

description:
I ordered an appetizer and a roll. 

At the waiter's suggestion I got the double jeopardy as an appetizer. 

It was a salmon, albacore, avocado, tartare mixed wth wasabi aioli, spicy garlic soy & served with warm shrimp chips. 

It was very good. 4 stars

For the roll, also at my waiter's suggestion, I ordered the monster in laws. It was fresh yellow tail with spicy albacore, cucumber, jalapeño topped with ponzu and spicy sauce. 

Once you got passed heat from the jalapeño it actually tasted a bit plain-ish. It was hot-spicy but without the flavor. 2 stars.
author: Ahmed A.

description:
There are two things you need to know about Sushi Bistro.

1) The food is great. They have quality ingredients, they care where they get their fish, and it really shows. The menu is expansive, with a wide range of both traditional and more creative sushi options. This place is one of my favorites in the city.

2) Dave (I suspect he's the manager or owner?) is one of the nicest, most positive and energetic people you will ever meet. He always makes you feel welcome and when he asks how your meal is going you can tell he really cares. The rest of the staff is great too, but Dave just deserves his own shout out.
author: Will G.

description: This is one of my go to restaurants in SF. Always easy to get a table, great menu with wide variety of rolls. Highly recommend the Red Devil! Great customer service...they took my favorite roll off the menu because they stopped carrying the type of fish in it, but they still make it for me every time and substitute a similar fish! Such a great sushi restaurant.
author: Eric W.

description:
fast service, fresh fish, lively atmosphere.  what is not to like?
had some very nice hamachi nigiri along with sashimi and several rolls tonight. all were executed very well and we left satisfied and content.
even though the restaurant was full, we got our sushi ordered within minutes.
the only negative on the menu tonight was the sesame chicken. lightly battered but very very dry white chicken meat.  definitely will skip this dish in future stops.
check out my photos on yelp. 
JYW likes it!
author: Jeff W.

description:
It was OK. 
For me the problem was that the sushi had a slight aftertaste to it and I had no idea what it was. Maybe it was the menu I got but I'll give it another go sometime.  But other than that, the portions were alright and the agedashi tofu (that I snagged a bit from my friend) was pretty good. The servers do need to be called for their attention.
author: Sarah K.

description: Recommended by a few friends and the entire experience did not disappoint! We ordered the Ahi Tuna Poke Special, Baked Oysters, Red Devil, The Legend, Alaskan Uni (special for the day) and Tempura Green Tea ice cream. The food was excellent - each dish had its own unique twist but  all compliment each other perfectly. The staff was awesome and the service was great. A must try when in SF!
author: Patricia G.

description:
Came here thinking it was just my best friend treating me out for my birthday, but instead it was a surprise dinner with all my friends. We were seated in the back room since we were a huge party. The servers were good at getting all of our orders down but once they were done sending our food, they ended up ignoring us for the rest of the dinner until we had to pay. Since we had a big party, they were kind enough to charge more then 2 credit cards for our table, which made paying a lot easier.
I got Volcano Roll, Agedashi Tofu, and California Roll. I don't know why but I love eating California Rolls and I would have to say there California Roll might be one of the better ones I have tried. The Volcano roll had a hint of spice and it reminded me of a Lion King roll. The Agedashi Tofu was huge! I wasn't expecting such a huge bowl for this since it was an appetizer, so for the price of it, it was worth it.
author: Nickie D.

description:
PARKING:
Let me preface this by saying: everyone saying they're not basing their review rating on parking yet still have enough gall to say that it puts them in a bad mood before eating sushi is an idiot.  It's San Francisco, moron. Not San Bernardino.  Not Scottsdale, AZ. The parking struggle is real, even in the Outer Sunset and even in the Outer Richmond. Parking does suck here. With that said, if you can't factor in finding parking in a crowded metropolis or don't want to chance it with parking lot at the Safeway or don't want to pay for the meter, then take your happy ass onto the 31 (it stops RIGHT THERE) or in a Lyft (not Uber 'cause screw them) and get your butt down to Sushi Bistro!

WHY WOULD I REVIEW?
I love this place: it's 2 blocks away.  Does that make me biased? Fo SHO.  I'm also a regular so Dave the manager knows my dumb face and my dumb name.  He's always friendly.

THE MENU:
Not upscale. Not dirt cheap.  That savory spot in the upper middle where the ambiance fits everyone looking for some decent sushi with their friends or Grindr date.  JK, judging from most of the clientele that I've seen here on a weekend- it's probably Bumble / OK Cupid.

There's a tartare style plate called the Double Jeopardy.  If you like raw fish, garlic, and those greasy shrimp chips, consider this your "Japanese Nachos." Yum.

Look - the style of dishes here ranges from "veggie" to "California-pansie-palate-roll" to "doh mai gawd it's got jalepenos and mango."  This is the catch-all sushi lovers spot. Not for people on a dirt-poor budget and not for super acutely judgey sushi snobs.  I say, "Get bent" to the latter type.

THE SERVICE:
I've been here with all sizes of groups and yes, the service can get spotty.  I've definitely been dehydrated, as I usually am, wondering where my water refill was thinking, "I'm DYING."  Muh B, I could have just asked to keep a pitcher at the tabes. BUT, I give them extra room as for timing just 'cause I come here often.  Can't be gettin' all c*nty (for all you math aficionados, * = u) with people who are constantly handling my food.  If you want to host a big group, you can do so by making a reservation ahead of time like a normal human being for the front (if you want the extra security of being able to flag down service without getting up) or in a backroom they have.

DESSERT:
Ice cream scoop, mochi singles, or SCOOPS OF GREEN TEA ICE CREAM WITH DEEP FRIED OREOS AWLKALWKLAKWLAWKLAKLAK *wipes drool*

AMBIANCE:
 Trendy, dark, cool lighting / decor, bar stocked with wine and of course sake and beer with a couple of HDTVs behind the bar for those of you bored to death of your date's inane, senseless jabbering.  The bar's not a bad place for going to eat sushi solo if you wanna watch a sporting event.  Unless couples bother you... what? They don't bother me.... *sniff*
author: Lauren C.

description:
Such an awesome time! My wife and I are frequents to this space  (about once every other month) and we love it. The rolls are large and fresh, and the price is worth it.  If you walk in,  it's typically a 20 minute wait, so I suggest a reservation. 

The owner (forget his name) is so nice and prides himself on his customer service and restaurants appearance.  Don't be surprised if a roll or beverage is comped from time to time.  They're really that great! Will continue to enjoy this spot for a long time.
author: Garrett L.

description: Since my favorite sushi place was closed on Sundays, I decided to give Sushi Bistro another try seeing that the dinner wait without a reservation on Mother's Day was less than 10 minutes. The host was friendly. We chose the rolls he recommended based on the fish that I told him I liked, but the rolls were wet and fell apart. We tried the grilled squid which was decent. My dad loves tempura having worked in a Japanese restaurant before and was very disappointed that their tempura did not come with any grated radish to add to the dashi dipping sauce. When we asked the server, rather than bringing radish over, he insisted that they added the radish already although the dip didn't look like it had any radish inside. Also, they charge for tea which is a cup with one tea bag of very bland genmaichai.
author: Diana B.

description: This is my absolute favorite sushi restaurant in the city!! So fresh and very flavorful. It's a beautiful place with great customer service and calm atmosphere. I love this place and will rave about it for days. Had the Hawaiian role but honestly all the rolls are amazing.
author: Karine P.

description:
Decent sushi, though nothing spectacular. You'd think with so many 5 star ratings, this place would be rockin' your taste buds. Prepare to leave with unfilled cravings and a twinge of disappointment mixed with frustration... sushi should be satisfying, not infuriating. I had such high hopes for this place.

It's time to tone down those high marks with a honest "meh" and shrug.
author: Yuchi W.

description:
My favorite spot for sushi. One of the PERKS of living in the Richmond District. :)

I always order the five wishes (snow crab meat topped with salmon, tuna, yellowtail, albacore & avocado, served with mixed greens and sauce = no rice!!!!!)so I decided to venture out and boy was I in for a surprise!

My new favorite items: 
Y.T. jalapeno   
slices of yellowtail topped with thinly sliced 
jalapenos, sea salt and lemon juice

Sexy Scallop
spicy white tuna, salmon, avocado and topped with spicy chopped day-boat scallop, tobiko and scallions.

Lettuce Wraps - 
Fall 
rilled cajun salmon, avocado, sushi rice, onions & sauce. 

For dessert -
Hawaiian breeze 
Mango, avocado and fuji apple topped with tuna, macadamia nuts and drizzled with cilantro pesto.


Simply delicious! So fresh! Amazing staff, the same 2 guys are always there when I go and they could not be more friendly and attentive! Thanks for making each experience that much better!
author: Jenny B.

description: I just love this place.  This is definitely one of my favorite sushi places in SF.  Fish is fresh, rolls are creative, ambiance is wonderful, prices are fair.  Their UNI is so fresh!  Also had the squid salad, which was also super delicious.  We always get the butterfish blasters.  They're amazing!  Their sushi nigiri are awesome.  They're long slabs of meat - it's a generous portion!
author: Nutmeg Y.

description: I love Sushi Bistro!! The food is always delicious, the staff is friendly and the restaurant is super clean. My friends and I eat here about once a month (raw fish eaters, cooked  fish eaters and vegetarians/vegans); there is something for everyone. I also frequently order food to go for my mother and myself, and have never been disappointed! Parking can be annoying, but that's living in the City. Fabulous place!!!
author: Heather M.

description:
Do not come here if you're looking for some authentic Japanese experience.  Yes, Japanese people do work here...but ultimately, this is a fusion restaurant.

But just because something is fusion, does that mean the quality of fish will be poor?  No!  And that is why I love SB.

I've ordered some of the crazier stuff, such as the Caucasian Afro (they get brownie points just for the name alone), but wasn't impressed.  The best part about this place is the sashimi.  You get nice cuts for a great price.  Once in awhile you'll bite into a stringy or tough piece of fish, but for the price you have to pay, I'll definitely take it!  Some of the rolls are way overpriced, though (hence why this is only 4 stars).  Stick with the sushi and sashimi.

All sushi restaurants specialize in a few fish.  SB's specialty has to be the butterfish (aka escolar).  Order anything with that and you will be happy.

The paucity of parking and long waits (make a reservation!!!) are counterbalanced by the great food and excellent and efficient service.
author: Tiffany H.

description:
If you walk past this restaurant, you will stop! It will smell like good, good, good food! This restaurant is named Sushi Bistro. It is good for 2 and up. It is inspiring and fun. It is the best sushi, ever.

Addy (age 7)
author: Robyn M.

description:
I am sad to report visit number 2 was less than ideal. 
On a Monday evening, it was lovely to get a seat right away. 
But the place was SO LOUD despite not being very full. It was hard to relax!
ANd there is nothing more I dislike than feeling misled. 
Veggie/shiitake roll said , "grilled vegetables topped with shiitake"
What comes out? cucumber roll topped with shiitake. 
Do I look that gullible? 
And the pot stickers took FOREVER, finally coming out 10 mins after everything else was eaten. I dont see the logic there, it was almost like a joke being played?
I cant see myself returning due to this evenings experience... and Im sad to have to say this.
author: Kim D.

description:
I can't understand why this restaurant has such a high rating. Maybe I went on a bad day for them. But regardless, I came in having high hopes, given its Yelp reviews. 

In particular, I had high hopes for the Chilean sea bass. Unfortunately, it turned out to be dry and oversauced. It's hard to mess up Chilean sea bass this badly. The lobster roll was only just ok.
author: Erick T.

description: OK tried this place by my sister's place cuz she said that it looks pretty good. Checked on yelp and it has pretty good reviews. So checked it out with family and it is pretty good except for the fact that waitress recommended stinky salmon roll and that was yuck. Everything else was delish. We had Afro spider roll, crouching tiger hidden dragon roll, salmon nigiri (must get), uni nigiri (must get), California roll, and nebayaki udon. Told waitress about yucky stinky salmon roll but she basically was like whatever.  Oh well, food was good. Just know what not to order.
author: Nancy C.

description:
They only let us set at a small table for two or the bar as we are a party of two. But there are two tables for four are available and no one in lines...speechless 
Otherwise, the lobster salad, African spider, butterfish blasters and 10 piece sashimi are great!
author: Huilin S.

description:
Obsessed.

I got:

Red devil - second favorite. Yum.

African spider- good but not my favorite (that also is because I prefer lighter and fresher sushi and am not that into fried)... But it was my boyfriend's, who is very into fried, favorite.

Butterfish blasters- so so good. The only thing i would change was that the inside was a little cold while the outside was warm and I wish they put the sauce in all its chunky glory on top of the roll because it's hard to get some on with chopsticks. 

Hawaiian breeze - amazing and so different. This was hands down my favorite roll. It really is a little bite of Hawaii. 

Also- I love the free cucumber appetizer they give you. So yummy.
author: Jessie L.

description: YELP you have really really let me down. So I eat sushi 4-5 times a week except for Sunday's. I decided to try this place out because it's close to my boyfriends home. We get here on a Friday and it is DEAD. I mean TWO other people in the entire restaurant. A women with a huge Herpes sore on her mouth seats us and walks away. She then returns and I'm already having a bad feeling as her hands graze our condiments that she sits on her table. I order: a rainbow roll/ salmon/ ikura w quail egg/ toro/ and scallop hand roll. Now as a avid sushi water I can tell you if the most expensive sushi doesn't taste good then " it ain't fresh!" The food was SO disgusting I couldn't even finish any of it. Between me and my boyfriend we only ate 20% of the food because it was THAT BAD! The waitress (who only came up to us twice and spent her remaining times laughing and talking with the other workers) came to grab the food and as I expressed my concern she was very rude to me. She also never even took our order and I had to get up myself and tell the chefs what I wanted because she wasn't doing her job. After we finished our beer we waited for our absent server and ended up going to the front to pay. I asked if DAVE was the manager and proceeded to telling him how we hardly ate any of the sushi and it wasn't fresh. Not only did he begin shouting at me as I remained calm and talked to him about my concerns, but he even assured me that the fish was fresh (I assure you it WAS NOT) and charged us the FULL PRICE about $88 for BAD FISH we didn't even eat. He then proceeded to balling up our receipt when my boyfriend handed him the card. When I asked for another receipt he printed one stapled it together and threw the stapler and handed me the receipt in a rude forceful manner. Now I'm going to tell you something. I HAVE WORKED IN A RESTAURANT. It saddens me when you calmly speak to staff about a problem and they do NOTHING TO ACCOMMODATE you. Instead they are rude and inconsiderate. When I was a server I went above and beyond to understand someone's complaint... within reason. To fully charge us when we obviously didn't like the food as we didn't even eat any, to give such poor service when there are only 4 people in the entire restaurant, and lastly for the manager to act extremely rude and unprofessional gives this place 0 stars. I will say one thing the sushi chefs were really nice. It's not their fault that they are serving old sushi. I'm not doubting the reviews here but if your a serious sushi water who knows the difference between crap and fresh (obvious difference) then this place is NOT FOR YOU.
author: Gigi M.

description:
The food here is delish!! My sisters ad I came here the other day to get a sushi fix and we def got it. Majority of the tine when you go to other sushi places it's the same flavors for every roll but not here. Every roll and every dish you have is an explosion of different and unique flavors. 
Tried: butterfish blAsters, miso glazed chilean sea bass, m&l forever, omega 3, sesame chicken and African spider roll. 

I definitely recommend all the dishes listed above, all of them are unique and tasty. The Chilean seabass with the sriracha sauce is delicious because you get the miso taste and a kick of spiciness. The butterfish was so soft, smooth and cooked to perfection combined with it's sauce it is melt in your mouth good. :)
author: Stella J.

description: This place knows how to do sushi without the pretentiousness. Billie Jean and New Legend knock my socks off each time. There is also never any doubt about the freshness, which means you can pig out with peace of mind. I would go into the restaurant more if parking was easier.
author: David S.

description:
Definitely one of my favorite sushi places in the city so far. I've been to both this location and the one in the mission and neither has dissapointed. The venue is very clean and welcoming. We brought a couple bottles of wine and the corkage fee was $15 each which was really good.

We ordered the:

Shashimi - fish is really fresh and the portions are HUGE
Nigiri - same as above
African spider roll - delicious
49er roll - standard 49er roll which I loved
C-2 - had a little spice to it but really tasty
monsters-in-law - a must have - probably my favorite roll of the night



Service was very fast and friendly. I honestly didn't have any complaints and will definitely be back.
author: William L.

description: Wanted to try a new sushi place. We got a few rolls and it was delicious
author: Jessica S.

description:
Sushi Bistro is tucked away on Balboa in the Inner Richmond, between 5th and 6th Avenues. On a cold San Francisco evening, it seems a little weird to meet up with friends to have sushi, but this girl loves her sushi! 

When I walked in the door, I told the hostess I was meeting about 4 or 5 of my friends for dinner. She was rather rude to me, looking at me like I didn't belong. Then said they weren't there. Then said "There is a group around the corner". Kind of confused, I ended up finding my friends.

We were waiting on a 5th person to arrive who was running late, so we decided to order drinks. They have a pretty nice selection of beers, wine, and sake. I ordered beer, one of us ordered hot sake, and the rest had wine. 

Our server kept coming back to see if we were ready to order. She was rather rude about it as if we were taking up a valuable table. By the time our 5th friend arrived, only 20 minutes had passed so it wasn't as if we had been waiting for an hour. And there was a good crowd in the restaurant so it wasn't as if they were losing money on us sitting at a table having drinks. 

We placed our order and the food came out fast. Probably the fastest I've experienced from a sushi restaurant. Because my rule of thumb on trying a new sushi place is to order the spicy tuna roll I ordered that and the unagi. The spicy tuna roll was not too spicy and not too mild and the tuna was really really fresh. With the unagi, you receive 2 pieces and they are huge and really really fresh. 

After dinner ended, we ordered more drinks so we could spend more time catching up as we all hadn't seen each other in a while. However, after we had been there maybe another 20 minutes after our plates were cleared the server was growing anxious to get us out the door. She gave us our bill and told us that we could only pay with 2 credit cards (apparently they only allow 2 credit cards per table) so we had to split the bill in half and pay each other using Venmo. Which is not a big deal, but the restaurant should have a sign up front letting customers know their credit card policy (if they do I did not see one).

All in all, it was a positive dining experience. I would give 5-stars but the attitude of both the hostess and our server dropped it down to 4-stars.  Usually I do not complain about service unless it is horrible, but I do think that if you're going to work in an industry that serves the public, you should at least try to be upbeat and nice.
author: Erin W.

description: Nothing let down! There were some super interesting flavor combinations. For example the hawaiian dream would not have been one of my usual orders but the sweet savory combo was but a dream. The fish was fresh, nothing was over sauced.
author: Kessa P.

description: Very fresh fish and a large selection of different and unique sushi rolls. Nice vibe. We liked it very much....will definitely be back.
author: Dana S.

description: This is our go-to sushi spot in the city.  The fish is always fresh and they always have special items just in for the day.  Dave and his crew offer great service and they are always willing to be creative and spice things up!  Highly recommended
author: Karlito S.

description: Really great sushi and lots of innovative options. Very long drink menu too. Lots of flavor and a wide variety of sauces to go with combinations of fresh veggies and fish. While the sushi was great, it was a little too loud for my liking. The noise from parties at the tables as well as the bar really carried through the whole space. That aside, the space has a nice vibe to it.
author: Hanna C.

description: My Favorite Sushi place in San Francisco.  I woukd suggest getting chefs choice.  roll the dice and you will be impressed.
author: Taylor M.

description:
Saw multiple awards on the door of this sushi bar and decided to come in.
Sushi was just not good though. Would not come back and would not recommend to go there.
author: Elena D.

description:
I went to Sushi Bistro for the first time for a friends birthday. My friend had been raving about this place and I trust her opinion so I had high hopes. 

We went on a Saturday night (there were six of us) and we had to make a reservation earlier in the day. When we arrived, the place was a little smaller than I thought it would be. First impressions: fun, hoppin', hipster type of place. We checked in with the host who seemed a bit frazzled but I think that it was just because it was busy. 

We were seated in the back area which looks like it was a back employee room turned into space for more seating. We didn't mind except it was SO HOT back there and kind of noisy. Our waiter came by to take our order. He was not very friendly and didn't smile (until the last 3-5 minutes that we were there). 

My husband and I shared a couple of rolls and an udon. My sister and friends all got rolls. The fish was really fresh! and the broth in the soup was delightful.

I definitely want to try this place again as the food was really good and I am sure the service was just a reflection of the hectic and busy night they were having.
author: Thea M.

description: Sushi Bistro is a must when I'm in San Francisco. It was a staple for me when I went to school in the city and the service and quality of the sushi never disappoints. Rolls are creative, fresh and truly unique.
author: Cristina C.

description:
Service was good, friendly, and prompt. 

Food was mediocre. Did not meet expectations of reviews as well as price. 

I ordered a Sexy Scallop along with the Butterfish Blast. 

The Butterfish Blast came first and it was not too bad nor was it excellent. Definitely not worth the $13.95 for rolls. 

The Sexy Scallop lacked in flavor. I personally thought it would have been better with a seaweed wrap rather than soy paper. 

Overall my experience was not the greatest. Don't think I will be coming back.
author: Anthony K.

description: We love sushi and were just not impressed by this place. We each got nigiri, classic rolls, and specialty rolls. We did not particularly like any of them. Everything was very wet which I have never experienced before. There was no sauce - the rice and sushi were just dripping wet. It tasted very odd. It was also a bit more expensive than most places which was especially disappointing given the quality. I also got a basic salmon and cucumber roll and there was not much salmon - though it did taste better than the specialty rolls which were overly complicated. Overall, I would not recommend this place. There is better sushi out there!
author: McKenzie H.

description:
This place is AMAZING!! I'm from Austin and of course am ruined for Sushi forever. My favorite item was the butterfish blasters. They melt in your mouth!!

Delicious place and great service!! This is my boyfriend's favorite Sushi place in the states (he lived in SF for 4 years).
author: Hannah G.

description:
CHECK OUT THE 147 FILTERED 1-2 STAR REVIEWS!

Enjoyed the sight of a cart of dirty dishes upon entering along with a "fresh" musky scent. Ordered a bunch of take out that cost about $100 for 2 people including toro, but was given hamachi instead (half the price). Spoke to the manager to let him know that not only did he not give me my toro but switched it for something else, buttttt, the food is the worst sushi and sorry excuse for Japanese food I have ever had, EVER! The manager responds "Too bad. If you don't like it, go eat somewhere else and I don't care if you give us a negative review on Yelp." Well, here yah go pal! Way to stick it to your customers! What in the heck is all the hype about this place about on Yelp??? Too expensive and poor quality...
author: Eager B.

description: I liked the restaurant atmosphere and menu selection. There was a wide array small plate items to choose from as well as the sushi menu. We got five different rolls which were recommended by the server. I thought they were pretty good but the service was a little slow.
author: Zach K.

description: I only have one question. There is a small cucumber plate that we didn't touch, (I actually finished my plate but my friend did not touch his) I saw the server took it away but placed it on somewhere looks like a serving plate. I hope I'm wrong and he's not planning to bring it to other people.
author: Sophia H.

description:
I took my boyfriend here after a day at the De Young Museum (relatively close by) to celebrate his job offer.

We had a dinner reservation made before hand (I definitely recommend doing this because this place is pretty popular and Michelin Guide recommended) but we were late because it took us 20 minutes of driving around to find street parking! We learned from our experience and will remember to assign time to the agonizing and impossible task of finding free street parking in SF at dinner time. I think what made it especially hard was that Sushi Bistro is located in a neighborhood and not main commercial areas so most of the cars on the street on a weekend would probably never move because they belonged to people who lived in the area.

My boyfriend and I ordered 3 rolls - the Omega 3 (good sauce but I found it to be kind of a weird texture in the middle), the Crouching Tiger Hidden Dragon (really good but not as unique as some of the other rolls that Sushi Bistro offers - tasted like a good dragon roll). My favorite roll of the night was the Spicy Scallop - it wasn't too spicy and definitely wonderful for scallop-lovers like myself. The scallops were so soft! 

I would definitely consider coming back here. I don't think 2 rolls are enough for 2 people if you are coming in even relatively hungry - in fact, I think my boyfriend probably would have wanted to order a 4th one to get really full!
author: Jenny M.

description:
Food was good but the service brings it all the way down to 1-Star (Not coming back).

It's sad as this restuaurant is in the neighborhood that I grew up in and has contune to survive in an area with horrible parking. After all these years, I have to leave a review...a bad rating.

African Spider was good and all their fish seem very fresh. The salmon was incredibly fresh and melted like butter.

Service? We have to asked for Wasabi and Ginger refills a couple of times. They gave us a small plate for 4 adults. Food came out in a bad order; wish they focused on our tab so all the food would come out in proper amount of time. Instead, we would occassionally wait for our next order with no food on the table. 

All the above looks picky right? But they charged us a mandatory 18% for 4 adults and a child. If I was at a typical Chinese restaurant I wouldn't mind that they asked us to hand them out empty dishes because they were too lazy to walk around. Or the fact that they push our personal dishes away to put down new dishes. If you're mandating 18%, rearrange the dishes WITH YOUR HANDS.

Honesty, I'm just angry that they charged us for a roll that I did not order. Not only did I NOT order it, we never received or ate it. They wouldn't take it off the bill and were adamant they gave it to us. We did not receive the Billie Jeanie! No rolls we ate had soy paper wrap or Salmon and lemon on top. We spend $175, why couldnt you just take that roll off the bill? It's only 8% and now you lost customers for life.

I work in Service, 8% is nothing; especially when your customers are being nice but vocal that the restaurant made a mistake. I guess customers are not always right.
author: Eddie C.

description: the cucumber salad they give you once you arrive is pretty good. I had ordered 2 handrolls, 1 roll and a cucumber roll. the cucumber roll i was a bit surprised that it came with brownrice. i guess i should have asked first. i expected a small one of 6. my bestfriend had the seared fish of some sort? i'm not entirely sure but she loved everything she got
author: Nancy W.

description:
This was a pretty good spot for sushi when you go with a group because they also allowed reservations for large parties. Usually, sushi restaurants that allow people to bring large parties tend to be not so good sushi spots. However, be aware that you will be paying a price for all the food you get!

I came here with a large group after I made advanced reservations for 12 people and the restaurant was happy to accomodate. We were definitely late, more than 15 minutes due to not being able to find parking in this area, and they were very nice to allow us to be late and still held our reservation. We were seated in the back but it was fairly spacious. The waiter was friendly, and many waiters came later on to assist with our ordering, and he was more than happy to do splitting of the check etc.

The food came out super lightning quick. Here's where I feel like you're overpaying. Each roll is around $15-17 but they're not large sized rolls. They're actually very small for how much you're paying, so your party ends up ordering 10-12 to share and people ordering other things to compliment their food and pretty soon you're into the $$$ for your bill but you didn't feel like you had much substance.

I know many people feel like this at sushi places, but I have been full from delicious sushi places that made me feel fulfilled. In the end, the fish was great, but way overpriced.
author: Lorrie M.

description: Love this place. My favorite sushi restaurant around bay area. I've been here many times and never got any negativity.
author: Valid H.

description:
Ok, there are 1,333 reviews and four star rating on this restaurant.  Let me share my perspectives with you. 

While waiting for my friend, I saw the waiter grabbed ginger and wasabi with his bare hand and put them in the takeout meals.  Yuck!

He just cleaned his fingers on a piece of wet cloth and went on his business. 

Ok I can forgive the 'sushi chefs' are not Asians nor Japanese.  Even though that's not a good sign. They have a cart inside of the restaurant for busing.  Another Yuck. 

How often you see a busing cart siting inside a restaurant and no moving?  (busing cart is not very attractive anyway) 

One star for Sushi Bistro
author: Sfscubaman T.

description:
Probably one of the best sushi restaurants I have ever been to! Went on a Monday night and only had to wait maybe 10 minutes for a table for 3. Friendly and fast service.
Pork gyoza dumplings were extremely tasty. We ended up ordering 4 different rolls. The best roll (shockingly) was the Hawaiian Breeze...a very pleasant surprise and a definite must try!! 
5 stars...Couldn't fault it!
author: Jodi E.

description:
After picking up my race packet for the SF Wirpo half marathon, the BF and I decided to have an early dinner (5:30pm).  I had been craving sushi for a while so we decided to head to balboa, where there's 3 sushi restaurants on one block!  

First stop, Tekka.  No reservations, sushi only, limited seating.  Legit.  I was looking forward to consuming a fresh plate of sashimi.  Luck was on our side when we scored front parking AND there was no one in line!!!  But, some things are too good to be true.  Since this was our first time here, we didn't know that service starts at 7.  Worth the 1.5 hour wait?  Maybe....but not this time.  

So, we were left with 2 options; Yuubi, a regular sushi restaurant, very affordable, and large space to accommodate big parties OR Sushi Bistro, with their creative rolls, excellent service, and modern decor.  It didn't take long for us to decide... plus the filled seats compared to empty ones helped out too!   

Here's what we ordered at Sushi Bistro:

Butterfish Blasters
Omega-3
C-2
12 Piece Sashimi

Everything was delicious and fresh.  Very creative with their rolls.  The only dish i would pass on is the C-2, very plain, no explosion of flavors in my mouth.  

From 3 restaurants narrowed down to one, I think we made a good choice.  We'll have to review the other two in the future but we'll definitely come back to Sushi Bistro for their other rolls.
author: Linda N.

description:
Came a week ago for a catch-up dinner, and it is a pretty good spot for that purpose. Intimate, small tables, with medium lighting. Nice decor. Saw the splendid reviews and decided to come. My sister advised me that it was decent, so I came in with minimal expectations.

Most tables are for small groups (2-4). We sat at the bar, which was comfortable and highlighted by a bartender with fantastic facial hair. Asahi Kuronama (Black) was delish; tried a sip and was amazed. Really enjoyed the velvety and rich flavor, not overwhelmingly so, without a bitter after taste. 

Loved how many options there were and their unconventional roll names. We tried the Albacore Dream and Five Wishes. I wasn't particularly fond of the first; it tasted fine, but no sparks flew. The sauce was a bit weird too, but it wasn't a typical roll, so it it could be that its creative parts didn't quite pair up as well as they could have. Was pretty happy with Five Wishes' super fat slabs of sashimi - I should have just ordered nigiri or poke, being such a sashimi fan. Something was off though! Maybe the lack of rice? But I've have sushi without rice... The interior texture of minced crab was an odd contrast to the slippery sashimi as well.

We had our waters refilled twice over the course of an hour. My empty glass remained that way for at least 10 minutes, which is not happening when I've added one dab too much of wasabi. 

At the end of the night, my friend and I looked at each other and asked what the other thought of the meal. She said it was okay. I said it was okay. So I guess that means Sushi Bistro (for us) was A-OK (three stars).
author: Tina Y.

description: Very good sushi and great atmosphere. It can get crowded. I love the sexy scallop roll.
author: Tira S.

description:
Tried it, liked it but unfortunately I wouldn't come here as my daily sushi place. On occasion would be nice.

For the price and the wait time even with reservations, my tummy just can't wait. Service wasn't up to par as I would constantly ask for refill of my tea and got annoyed after the 5th time.

I've tried this place several times before I wrote this review. I don't have much to say beside, the sushi was hard - like someone left it out and got dried up. Something i ate was very very salty and it was not the soy sauce since I rarely use it anyway. 

Parking was hard to find but can't really complain since it was dinner time. Approx. 10-20 min to find parking.
author: Julie B C.

description:
Sushi Bistro's unique rolls match the trendy and hip atmosphere. It reminds me of a chill version of "Sushi Roku" @ Ceasars in Vegas. Basically, you won't find any Japanese businessmen or expats looking for authentic tastes of home. 

We got seated right away on a Friday night (w/o reservation) thinking it was Namu and tried to order Korean tacos only to have the friendly waiter say they didn't have them but Namu next door does. Moded! 

It was a blessing in disguise because besides their tasty rolls (C-2 with the lobster and avocado was delicious). They offered this Japanese delicacy that was sublime. They serve it two different ways. Order it appetizer style since they splash some yuzu, lemon, and thinly sliced green onion. It's the monkfish liver aka ankimo. It's rich, creamy, smooth yet light, delicate, velvety and definitely one of the best things I've eaten and now knocked off my "bucket list".  (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/TmXkYM0N-FjrMasxj5uXsA?select=xen6RmYZ84VY9auvi6VZ5w)

Thanks Daniel L, for reminding me about this 5 star delicacy.
author: Earl G.

description:
AMAZING sashimi + nigiri.

The sashimi is so fresh and buttery soft, and comes in huge, thick slices. I think it might be the most high quality and generous quantity of sashimi for its price. I absolutely love the albacore belly (dare I say it is just as fatty and flavorful as the toro, except half the price!). The toro is of course so rich and satisfying. And so is the king salmon. And the hamachi belly. ...Everything!! THREE THUMBS UP.

Although really unique and tempting with all the creative combinations of sauces, components and flavors they offer, not all of the special & unique rolls are perfect...I love the Butterfish Blasters roll (snow crab meat and avocado wrapped in butterfish torched with a garlic-soy). Such a tender roll with a rich blast of flavor. But I warn against the Hot Love (baby lobster, avocado and crab meat rolled in  snapper, baked with spicy sweet sauce). Sounds so good on the menu...but it is drenched in thick, overpowering orange sauce, the "crab meat" inside the roll is fake, and I don't know what is wrapped around the outside but it has a really rubbery texture...the whole roll is just overwhelming and wrong. Order unique rolls at your own risk!

The menu also includes vegetarian rolls, brown rice rolls, signature rolls, small plates, teriyaki, udon, and salads. 

You will swoon over the sashimi (and non-ridiculous wait for a table unlike at some tiny sushi establishments).
author: Jessica C.

description:
I basically live at this restaurant. Im genuinely concerned of the mercury level in my body from how often I eat at sushi bistro (because all seafood has trace amounts of mercury)... because their Caucasian Afro, Stinky Salmon, Pepper Poppers, Yellow Tail basil and basically everything is delicious. Their flavor, swag, style or whatever you wish to call it is awesome. Fun but also a chill spot. Love the reggae music! I go here for dinner with my girlfriend or with a large a group of friends, it's always fun! Service is always fast, friendly and overall great. Shout out to Vince, Dave and Skip.

Parking sucks but where in SF does it not?
author: Gustavo M.

description:
2.5 stars.. I'll round it to 3 to be nice.

The white man has fooled the Sushi Nazi again. After not being able to secure a table at a couple of the more authentic sushi establishments nearby, we stumbled in here, fully aware that this place is a "white people sushi" restaurant. Rolls galore.

However, I have heard nothing but rave reviews about this Sushi Bistro chain, so I had high hopes. "You gotta try it man! I swear it's good!" "Even Japanese people like it!!" "It's the best sushi I've had in SF!"

...Is this all you've got, SF?? Even for non-traditional sushi, this was just average. Fish wasn't high quality, and not a single thing we had was memorable. 

Also, I know butterfish is known as "diarrhea fish", but I mean..... were we SUPPOSED to feel sick after eating here?
author: Kazu O.

description:
I must disclose first that I'm not a huge fish fan, nor a big sushi fan at that. BUT when I do go to sushi with all of my sushi-loving friends or boyfriend, along with every other person in this city, I push to go to Sushi Bistro. 

I love their vegetarian rolls, beer, service, and fun atmosphere while sitting at the bar. My go-to is the avo cucumber roll with brown rice (another point for having brown rice!), miso soup, and/or chicken teriyaki. So vanilla, I know.
author: Alexis T.

description:
Great service! Delicious food. Quality fish used, beautiful presentations, and the rolls have more fish than rice. :)

I'm a regular and they know what I like--extra ginger and low sodium soy sauce. Never have to ask for it. 

Fave's include:

Tuna Poke
Sashimi Spirit
Watermelon Man
Dave's Legacy
Caucasian Afro
Tuna Poke
Solstice
Equinox
Spicy Tuna Cut Roll
author: Danielle K.

description: Mmmmm amazing! Fresh! Delicious! Super light and yummy food! Went for the Friday night dinner, had spicy girl, halibut sashimi and fried ice cream as a dessert. Best ever! Hot saki is very yumm, soft and goes perfect with the food! Would definitely recommend to visit. Little tip: better have a reservation
author: Asiyat T.

description: I came here with a few people looking forward to a deep fried sushi roll. Not only did I get attitude but I also got told that they could not deep fry special rolls although they have the Omega which is deep fried. I told her that I will just not eat due to the disrespectful attitude, all I got in return was an OK and she walked away. The people I came with is my fiance brother his wife and their daughter who is 1 yrs old. They waited for 45 min to 1 hr for their food and all they got was oh were behind due to large orders. To make it even sweeter she checked on all the tables except for us. Now I'm typically a really nice guy so it takes a lot for me to be upset. With that being said if you have any special request this is not the place for you.
author: Brandon D.

description:
I've been to some of the best sushi restaurants in the world. Japan's, Europe's and even a decent place in Peru! Yet when it comes to the atmosphere, the service, the food quality and diversity and most importantly it's staff including Skip, San Francisco's Ron Swanson and one of the best managers in the hospitality industry, Dave.
You may find better quality fish at an expensive sushi place but you'll never find the eclectic combination of food and atmosphere that sushi bistro offers.


-I recommend the ahi poke salad, C2 and the Red Dragon Rolls.
author: Matt Y.

description: Giant slabs of good nigiri/sashimi, fun non-traditional rolls, great prices.  Done.  With the amount of sushi places skimping and adding to the reasons we're all getting nickle and dimed in SF (hey Kiji, I'm talking to you), it's great to know there's a place that you can come out saying 'that was great!' and 'dang those were some big pieces of sushi!'  Quality and quantity.  No it's not an authentic place, so elitists beware!  For what it is,  is the best in class.
author: A A.

description:
I used to love this sushi when I lived in the neighborhood, but now I can love it in a new way, and wonder why I haven't been there more lately!  Sushi theoretically should be a safe-ish option for me, being highly gluten-sensitive, but I admit that I usually don't have sushi anymore because I miss the yummy sauces and crispy fried parts that I can no longer have.  In this case, Sushi Bistro made sushi still feel like a treat!  

I asked about the sauces, and they immediately brought over the gluten-free tamari that so few restaurants carry (yay!) and were able to confidently direct me to which rolls would be safe.  The rolls I ordered were DELICIOUS and the service was fast and friendly, super professional.  The music is played at a regular volume so you don't have to yell (I remember it being a bit loud years ago), and best of all, they let my friend and I sit there and talk for SO LONG.  We hadn't seen each other in a while, and they just kept smiling at us, refilling our waters, like it was totally fine.

So happy to have rediscovered Sushi Bistro... thanks for making a night out so great!
author: Samantha G.

description: I've been to their location in the mission district and I really like their sushi. I had just finished night life at the academy of sciences and this location was just a few mins away. Perfect because I was starving. We arrived at 8pm on Thursday night and the place was pretty much full but managed to sit at the bar promptly. We ordered 2 nigiri's, a lobster hand roll and 2 rolls to share among 2. It was plenty of food. Each dish came out one at a time. The hand roll first, then the two rolls and by then I think they forgot our nigiri. We had to check up on it twice. Other than that food was fantastic. Sushi was fresh.
author: Vinkin Ken T.

description:
It isn't like Sushi Bistro needs another glowing review, but I just have to add my two cents. So here it goes...

I came here for a dinner date with my favorite boy. We didn't have dinner reservations, but luckily there was a table available for two. Like most restaurants in San Francisco, Sushi Bistro was really small in size. I think they could have used bigger tables, but oh well...we made the best of our tiny table for two. 

We ordered a total of six dishes (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/TmXkYM0N-FjrMasxj5uXsA?select=7g90tMXSX7R64KLstEG2yA) and two beers each. What I really didn't like was how our table was so small. We couldn't fit all of our food and our waiter was really terrible with pacing. He kept bringing out plate after plate and I felt very rushed. There was literally no space on our table and instead of giving us some time to enjoy our food, he would stand at our table and wait for us to rearrange the plates somehow so that he could fit the next plate.

On a lighter note, the sashimi and rolls were fantastic. My most favorite roll of the night was the butter blaster (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/TmXkYM0N-FjrMasxj5uXsA?select=FhSDQZYwjvHQ6-gflkFGcg). It was the most tasteful roll I have ever had. It consisted of snow crab meat and avocado, wrapped with butterfish. The butterfish was very rich and soft--I just couldn't get enough of it. I also really liked the yellowtail belly (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/TmXkYM0N-FjrMasxj5uXsA?select=BFanUmX0bKFu2R0IpLJh2Q); it was the most rich tasting sashimi I have ever tasted. Don't get me wrong, everything was absolutely amazing, but those two were the highlight of our dinner.

Our bill came out to be a little over $100, which was fairly reasonable for the excellent quality and taste of the food. 

P.S.
Cheers to my 500th review! ;D
author: Lien T.

description:
I don't tend to eat rolls very often anymore but came to this place for a birthday dinner with friends. It was awesome.

Decor is laid back and hip with a bar and tables. We got seated in the backroom.

As per previous posts and friend suggestions had the following:

- Monster in laws
- Crouching tiger hidden dragon
- Butterish blaster
- Volcano roll
- Omega 3
- Salmon, albacore & avocado chopped tartar style

Add in an Asahi Black and you have a great dinner!

Will be back.
author: Julia P.

description:
Ambiance: A simple restaurant sign, but the inside is filled with a romantic and relaxing ambiance. Complete with low light and warm color tones. Good for 20s and up crowd.

Service: Good. The party was seated quickly. Nothing special.

Groups?: Party of 4. No problem being seated on a cloudy, Saturday afternoon around 530pm. I strongly recommend reservations for larger groups. It is a small restaurant.

Parking: Somewhat difficult. It is SF. I was able to find parking about 2 blocks away. It took about 10-15 min to find parking. 


FOOD!: 
We only ate sushi c:

Spicy crunchy - Fried goodness. It is surprisingly not super oily nor over-battered. My friend who usually can't handle spicy foods liked it.

Rock'n Roll - Pieces of heavenly baked scallops on California rolls. (My scallop loving friend approves. She says she misses the rolls here.)

M&L Forever - A large roll with a generous amount of crab meat and spicy tuna. It is a not a burn-your-tongue-off roll. It had just enough heat that it doesn't overwhelm the rest of the flavors, but gives the roll a nice kick.

49er - I can't say how it tastes since I did not try it. The person who did order it didn't have anything bad to say about it.


Price: The total bills was about $50ish for 4 sushi rolls with tip.

I loved their rolls. Fresh, good quality, and good balance of flavor. I would come here again.
author: Tanya L.

description: Everything I've tried here is fantastic!! Every time I come to the city I'm coming to Sushi Bistro!!
author: Braden F.

description: Came here based on the very positive Yelp reviews. Quite honestly, the sushi rolls were just mediocre. I've had better sushi. The fish used didn't seem that fresh.
author: LANCE C.

description: Really great sushi!  The menu is unique and different.  Nice staff, cute locations.
author: Christina S.

description:
Sushi for white people. Ya. 

Lots of weird vegetarian options, brown rice instead of white rice inside the rollls, soy wrapper instead of seaweed, stuff like that.

Had two orders of unagi nigiri, this was the cheapest, and the best out of everything we ordered. 

Udon and roll [forgot which it was] not worth mentioning. 

Here you will find the WORST chicken teriyaki in all of SF. Funny because this was the most expensive dish. The chicken strips were tiny, extremely dry, and tasteless. Get it if you like eating sandpaper. Yep..

Super expensive for mediocre food. Around 60 before tip for all that crap. Portions are not large at all.
author: Christina X.

description:
This is not a five star sushi shop. Think 3 1/2 with benefits. Although the menu looks fun it doesn't translate to your taste buds. 

The sushi here isn't really all that great. Its fresh but not special. It's not bad and the service is really good, friendly and well organized in well thought out restaurant. The problem is its lacking that little kick. This can never be a five star experience. I'm tempted to give it three stars but it's better than that.

We ordered:
Ahi tuna poke special. Very fresh and great portion for the price. Think tuna salad as opposed to a bowl of fish. It wasn't bad but I definitely won't order it again.   

Butterfish blasters: Good but not multidimensional. The best part was the avocado.

Magic mushrooms: This was good with great mushroom flavor and just enough pesto power.. I'd have this again.

African Spider: Great name but not spicy and lacking a lot of flavor. It was good I guess but not special. 

The house hot saki was great.
author: Justin S.

description: This place is definitely a good stop for sushi! Most of the rolls that we tried tasted fresh and were packed with flavor. Didn't try any sashimi or sake but both looked great. I look forward to going back soon.
author: Sam A.

description:
Sushi Bistro gets a 5, with the caveat that I'd like to go back and try their sashimi or nigiri to 100% confirm the rating.

Called and left a reservation on their answering machine day of and easily sat down at a 6:30 seating. Had an absolutely fabulous meal; creative food that left the taste buds cheering, great service, and more. 

What we had:
$13 - Monster in Laws: chopped spicy albacore, cucumber topped with yellowtail, jalapenos, spicy and ponzu sauce
-Delicious with a spicy kick. Not for the folks who don't like a little extra heat.

$14 - Red Devil (brown rice): butterfish tempura, aioli, avocado & cucumber, topped with spicy tuna, scallions, and red serano ginger sauce.
-Yes please, this was smooth in the way the flavors blended together. Recommend!!

$14 - Double Jeopardy: salmon, albacore & avocado chopped tartar style, mixed with wasabi aioli, spicy garlic soy & served with shrimp chips.
-Also, delicious. The tartar mix was a nice topping to the crispy chips. Flavors were legit. Recommend!!

All in all, I think we had 3 items with 2 large beers, 2 large sakes, and dessert and it came to $52 per person with tax and tip. Not too bad! 

Two thumbs up!
author: Rachel R.

description:
Come to Sushi Bistro if you're looking for interesting and unique sushi rolls.  This little sushi restaurant sits in the residential area of the Richmond District in San Francisco.  The restaurant was a little dark but perhaps the lighting is suppose to set the mood.  Maybe the lighting is trying to follow the lyrics of the song "Better with the lights off" by New Boyz.  Who knows.  I walked in cause I was starving and needed some grubs. 

Long story short, this place has great sushi and I would totally recommend it to anyone that need any rolls out of the ordinary.  Pricing of the rolls and small dishes were a bit high but the creative names made it fun to eat.
author: Shirley T.

description:
Lots of seating and a party room in the back. There's no wait for Sushi Bistro. Maybe it's because the sushi chefs are working so fast. We had a chance to sit at the sushi bar and witnessed a small army of people prepping the food.

The fish is super fresh, not the greatest I've ever had but definitely hits the spot.
author: Calvin W.

description: Love this place! Their salmon teriyaki is just superb. Looks small, but they have more room in the back. The decorations and atmosphere are great too, although seating is a little tight.
author: Adamme K.

description:
Striving toward perfection is not for everyone.  Which is why this place should strive toward mediocrity first.  Anyone who rates this restaurant more than three stars has had little to no exposure to good food. Not good Japanese food, good food in general.  It doesn't take a connoisseur of fine eastern cuisine to know how fresh tuna and salmon taste.  One doesn't need a degree in culinary science to tell good cooking oil from a five-gallon jug bought at a dollar store.  And anyone over the age of twelve would surely know that seven leaves of lettuce sprinkled with carrot shavings does not a salad make.

The restaurant does have one of the best atmospheres in the area.  Very idilyc, good for a first few dates.
author: Jolly R.

description:
I've always loved Sushi Bistro, but the last few times I've been here it has just seemed...different.  Tonight was the straw that may have broken the camel's back.  I made reservations for 7pm for 2 people.  I arrived right at 7, but my friend was having trouble parking so I had her pick me up and we circled the block one time and found parking.  We were seated by 7:10 and ordered quickly.  I ordered a small Sapporo, and we got some edamame (thank God).  We also ordered three rolls and an Unagi Nigiri.  The Unagi, beer, and edamame came right away, and my friend and I settled in and started catching up.  And we caught up for at least 30 minutes before we finally realized our food was no where to be seen and the tables to our left and right ( who had arrived well after us) were being served.  I finally got the attention of an employee, who "went to check" on our order.  A couple of minutes later out waiter comes over and says that our ticket was lost, but they are making our sushi now.  No biggie - this happens sometimes, and we are enjoying catching up.  They then bring out our Watermelon Man, which is delicious as usual.  And then we wait....and wait...again, as our neighboring tables receive even more food.  Finally our second roll comes, and a few minutes later our third.  We finished our meal, and then waited, again, for the check.  Two HOURS after we arrived the check comes, and NOTHING is comped.  Are you serious?!?!   I've had it at this point.  We signed the bill and I (stupidly) still tipped 20%.  On the way out though I did stop the manager to say that I was disappointed.  And the response?  Not "oh I'm so sorry - let's take care of that, you should have been comped something".  A half hearted sorry, with a terrified look on his face.  Seriously.  Maybe you don't recognize me, but I come here often, and I order take out regularly and bring friends here.  

You made us wait for an HOUR for our food - it is a given that you should comp SOMETHING.    NOTHING.  Guess what - you are not the only sushi in town, or even in the neighborhood anymore.  I won't be coming back, or updating my review any time soon.  Sorry Sushi B.  You failed tonight - I'm so sad, because I had a love affair going on that I thought would never end.
author: Cori D.

description: Tried their crunchy veggie roll and volcano roll for takeout dinner - both were delicious and satisfying. Will come back and maybe stay for dinner
author: Olga R.

description:
Hands down my favorite sushi spot in the city.

I was introduced to Sushi bistro by my roommate, because her brother was roommates with the owner in college! Small world!!!!

Anywhooooo..... so when I go there I typically start out with some miso soup (of course). I will then order the butterfish blasters, OMG YUM YUM YUM!!! THESE MELT IN YOUR MOUTH I AM NOT KIDDING. This is by far my favorite sushi role EVER! 

After that I typically order the Agedashi tofu because I am a tofu freak and i love how they serve this dish with that sauce, soooo good.

My boyfriend LOVES the Spider roll, it's not my thing but he literally will order like two or three of them and finish every single bite hehehehe.

Also, if your a vegetarian try the asperacado roll, really yummy.

They have this dessert that is TO DIE FOR!!! It's deep fried green tea ice cream with deep fried oreos. mmmmmmm I can eat three of those things with my sweet tooth :)

I'm hungry now, tonight I am going to Sushi Bistro!!!!!
author: Courtney S.

description:
lol ..what? 

why does this place have such good yelp ratings? if you Know.. and like quality sushi, you won't like this place... 

1) SO loud - the waiters are loud when they talk amongst themselves, the tables are so close together that if the people next to you are loud and laughing, you have to talk incredibly loud yourself. 

2) the sashimi combo was SO disappointing. my parents wouldn't stop talking about how bad it was . low quality sashimi (not fresh at all) , very poorly cut, the variety was so disappointing as well (come on, for the deluxe? should have at least 5 kinds for that price). or at least.. put out quality fish. 

3) the udon was overpriced and salty. 
4) the bbq dinner combo-tempura was poorly fried and really dry meat.. 

only delicious thing we had was ikura. 

would not come here again - feels more like 5-10 $ range .
author: Dina K.

description:
If you've had a long week and just need to stumble into a food establishment for an affordable meal, this is a great spot. The service is always friendly and reliable. Their sushi rolls are affordable which is nice given that the atmosphere and decor are above-average. 

The only time I waited a long time for food was for an order of gyoza. They took longer than our sushi rolls but once they arrived, they looked perfect. They tasted even better. I definitely recommend this spot for a pick-me-up at the end of a long work week.
author: Eva R.

description:
Forever searching for good sushi in the city, We decided to give this place a go. Wasn't our first choice but it was open on a Sunday which settled it. 

The service was very quick and friendly, barely had to wait between our order of 3 rolls. Each roll is 8 smallish pieces. What I totally loved was how little rice the sushi had! This allows you to taste all the flavours and none of that glutenous rice taste. This in itself would bring me back here. The choices are amazing and the combination of flavours, although sometimes unusual, melt so well into each other. New age sushi for the adventurous palate.

I have forgotten the names of our rolls having changed our mind so many times before the waitress took our order. But what I remember so well is the Hawaiian Breeze, something I would never usually go for fish mango and apples with cilantro pesto, oh my! Brilliant absloutly brilliant. Everything else was just well put together. 

Now what I don't like about the place is the smell of heavy musty air inside and the swarm of fruit flies by the door. They really should work on that. We almost walked out if the place didn't look clean. Still rather a turn off. Also when we asked for a price of two fish pieces, we could swear the waitress said $6.50 not the $8.50 charged. It pays to double check everything (although you shouldn't have to do so). The interior wasn't quite there for me either it looked more like a sports bar. If they could fix some of their negatives, they will surly go to the next level.
author: Nora B.

description: Constantly good food, service, and prices! One of my sushi favorites.
author: Anna V.

description:
I'm terribly fortunate this is my neighborhood sushi spot. Sushi Bistro is consistently delicious and always cures my sushi cravings that need to be sated on at LEAST a bi-weekly basis (because #California). 

They take reservations which is ideal as it does get hopping pretty much every night of the week. It's one of the better sushi spots in the Inner Richmond, so the wait is to be expected.

Service is great (especially when you bring along an extra-charming comrade who causes the waitresses to swoon, but that's another story). The rolls are fresh, high-quality, and scrumptious and realistically I'd like to wolf down maybe 100 pieces or so but you know how reality is. Sigh. 

Anyway, a solid sit-down sushi spot in the Inner Richmond. If you're hankering to douse yourself in wasabi and soy sauce, make your way on over.
author: Meredith C.

description:
OMG OMG - If I could eat here daily I would. It is so amazing. The only thing is it is kinda loud and you usually have to wait for a table - but it is well worth the wait. The POKE is to die for and those crispy noodles it comes with - UNREAL !!!! Crouching Tiger Hidden Dragon, Hawaiian Breeze, New Legend, Red Devil, And....I could go on and on...... 

I have never had a bad roll and the quality is amazing. Just order slowly one at a time as the tables are small and once they start they come out fast....

YUM!!!!
author: Viji V.

description: Solid sushi spot.  Not really very traditional, but a lot of very inventive and original rolls.
author: Anthony D.

description: Sushi Bistro has very good food and is one of my favorite restaurants.  The waiters are very friendly and they will give you a good recommendation.  (This is Rebecca using my Dad's phone).
author: Leo S.

description:
I can't believe it took me so long to try SB. Arrived early on a Monday night, and we were seated immediately at the bar. By the time we left, all tables were occupied and there were about 6 people waiting outside.

Overall, the service is sharp. Our server took our order rather quickly and the dishes we ordered came out surprisingly fast for how busy it was. Plates were cleared as soon as we were finished, and plates were spaced apart just enough that we paced ourselves.

Food was bland bland bland. We ordered several different rolls: prawn pod, Billie jean, and big island. All were very different in terms of flavors. Unfortunately, when we tried them, none of the flavors were distinguishable. Everything tasted dull and forgettable.
As a freshness test, we ended with a sake nigiri. The cut was rather large and the amount of rice was too small. Not a big deal. The nigiri was much better than all the other rolls.

Our bill came, and we found an order that we had not made so had to send it back.

Won't be coming back; especially when there are several other sushi spots in the area with cheaper prices and better flavors.
author: Alyssa G.

description: Their special rolls are incredible. I love the Hawaiian breeze and the Watermelon man, both of which feature tuna and a variety of unexpected ingredients in sushi: apples, cilantro pesto, and, most of all, macadamia nuts, which are incredibly delicious.
author: Mel C.

description:
Sushi Bistro is probably my favorite sushi place in SF! Everything is super fresh, really good customer service, and pretty reasonable prices for the quality you get. Really cute place for a date or just dinner with friends. 
I always get: 
Five Wishes - super yummy. Fresh and doesn't have rice so it's perfect for low carbers ;)
Sashimi dinner- has all my favorite fish and comes with soup, salad, and rice. Always very very fresh. 
Oyster- we always get at least a dozen oysters. They are SUPER yum, fresh and I believe $2 an oyster which isn't too bad for a sushi place.
