And Sushi Bistro either sears or deep fries all of their rolls. WTF, yo? Just give me some damn raw fish! No I don't want nigiri or sashimi, I want a roll with raw fish! 

(Yea yea, cry me a river, build a bridge and get over it. I'm going, ok?)
author: Leilani H.

description:
Sushi Bistro - you never disappoint.  As sure as the sun will rise...the food here will be consistently awesome and totally solid.

We had;
M&L Forever: unbelievable - fav of the night
Sashimi Spirit: different and yummy
Hot Love: the name says it all
Spicy Tuna: yay!

I actually haven't been to Sushi Bistro in quite some time and was happy to see they have moved to a bigger spot (2 doors down for the old place).  Makes it much easier to go here without a reso and be able to sit at the bar.
author: Megan H.

description:
Went here on a Friday night and was seated right away. Very cute but small place. Got the special ahi poke ( good but the ahi wasn't fresh), waikiki ( great but mango overpowers the roll), hotlove (scallops cooked perfectly), and crouching tiger (best roll we had). The food was a little above average, service was great and fast and the meal with 2 apps and 2 rolls were $40 ish, not bad but not great. If the price was a little lower I'd say I would have been happier and more likely to go back.

Food - * * *
Price - * * *
Service - * * * *
Ambiance - * * *
author: Jess K.

description: OMG was that good. Expensive, but good.  Black Snapper was quite possibly the best sashimi I've ever had.  The Caucasian Afro was amazing.  Seriously, try this place!
author: Ronan L.

description:
I don't understand why this place has so many reviews with high ratings.... I went to Sushi Bistro because I didn't want to stand in line at the little sushi place Tekka up the street (They were LATE opening up the restaurant). 

The food was just ok. I wouldn't say anything was really good. There was a lot of people there but I hear it's because they are the first sushi place that comes up on some mobile app. This place kinda reminds me of those Americanize sushi places where the siracha/mayo sauce rolls are the only thing people order which I don't mind but I think this place is just a bit overly hyped up. It's a nice restaurant with good ambiance (4 stars) but the food was probably 3 stars. That's just my honest opinion of this place.
author: Karen L.

description: Hands down the most kid-friendly, service-oriented, and accommodating Japanese restaurant I have ever had the pleasure of dining at. And that says nothing about the inventive menu and great food being produced by the sushi chefs. From the front of the house to the back of the house, count me in as fan of Sushi Bistro.
author: A -.

description:
Went here for a friend's birthday. Excellent service considering we had a big party, they sat us in the back which was awesome so we could make our own noise and not drown in everybody else's ...

The rolls are great! Most of the sushi rolls on the menu aren't quite typical. My favorite is the one with the butterfish, very soft and melt in your mouth texture! I recommend coming here for any type of occasion.
author: Hannah T.

description:
Yummy, yummy, yummy! This is our favorite sushi place ever. We found it less than a year before we moved away from San Fran, and we made sure to go regularly. Now that we have moved, we visit Sushi Bistro every chance we can when we come to the Bay Area. We miss this restaurant and talk about it often!

The sushi is super fresh and delicious, and the rest of the food is incredible as well. The prices are EXTREMELY reasonable, and the service is friendly and very quick.

We love you, Sushi Bistro!
author: Lauren E.

description:
So many rave reviews, so I went there today.
We were the first customers. The space between the seat,like some reviewer said, is really tight. We were enjoy the food until two other clients came in and one of them was really fat n stink! Smell like shit! The waiter seated them beside us, when there were still so many empty seats. The stinky smell ruined the whole dinner. We did not finished the meal, paid and ran out of door for fresh air!

Tempora was good. Sushi was big. Unagi was too saucy on the top.Did not order any roll, suggested by others here, I can understand the way they over dressing the sushi.
Oyster was small. Dame bartender charged me tea when it supposed to be FREE!

Not a place that I wanna returned. Not authentic enough.
author: Cola C.

description:
Great food, good and friendly service, only one missing device: allergy-free menu.

I have a number of food allergies, including gluten, so sushi is usually a safer option relative to other cuisines.  The servers were impressively thorough in checking that certain dishes were made without soy sauce, dairy, and egg. The only reason I give them 4 stars instead of 5 is the lack of a gluten-free or allergen-free menu on hand. This would save the customer and the servers a lot of time. (They do get a bonus for having gluten-free Tamari sauce in place of soy sauce). 

I will definitely come back!
author: Stephanizzle P.

description:
I have only been to the location in the Inner Richmond.  I have not gone yet to the Mission location.  Although I have heard from several people that the Mission location is better than the Inner Richmond location.   I had heard about this place from several people and it received some great reviews and when I arrived I saw that it was Michelin Guide Recommended so I was very excited.  The menu was a little overwhelming.  There were tons of options.  Do not get me wrong, I believe the ability to make decision are great, but not so much when it comes to my food.  As Chef Gordon Ramsey always suggests, keep the menu simple. The first time I went to Sushi Bistro, I was so overwhelmed with the menu that after checking in on yelp I checked the highlights and recommendations.  I was not in the mood to take 10-15 minutes to make an order.  The highlights and recommendations were spot on accurate.  I ordered:  salmon nigiri, crouching tiger hidden dragon, butterfish blasters, and sexy scallop.  Dish after dish was delicious.  I could not have asked more from this place.

I had such a great first experience that when I had a friend come into town I recommended that we go there.  The second experience was not good.  The food was good, but not as good as it was before. The first experience met the standard of reviews that it received.  The second experience fell short.  It could have been my taste buds, but my boyfriend (who had gone with me the first time) stated that he agreed that the first time was significantly better so it wasn't just me. Also the food came out very quickly, which I would never complain about, but all of our food pretty much arrived all at once.  There was a group of 5 of us and we were not able to fully take in the experience because it seemed very rushed and then we were done eating so we left.  Also, the place wasn't packed so it wasn't like they were trying to get seat other people.  In fact, we were seated in the back room and we had it all to ourselves the entire time until the very end when we were paying our bill.  It could have been a different chef that night.  The thing about a truly great restaurant is that the food is consistent night after night.  Based on that I have to give this 3 stars.  Consistency is key.  Also I have to try the location in the Mission which I heard is better than the Inner Sunset one.
author: Vagabond V.

description:
We love trying a place that does very successfully bring new flavor combinations.
Amongst our favorite of our first try: The Caucasian Afro.
This is a place where I will want to go back again and again. Perfect for our the movies since it's open late even during the week.
author: Elsa T.

description:
Well, I'll start off by saying I don't like being greeted with "Do you have a reservation?" Before "Hi", but I'll let that one slide. 

After that my experience got much better. We had to eat at the sushi bar...I guess since we didn't have a reservation (on a Tuesday night? Really?) But our server was awesome, very nice and drinks were never empty. 

The food was pretty good, but since I've never been here before I fear I ordered the wrong thing. I'm a big fan of raw fish and the two rolls I ordered (crouching tiger hidden dragon & spicy crunchy) had mostly cooked fish. But as it were, they were excellent. My friend had the mushroom appetizer and it was delish! I would highly recommend those 'shrooms! 

All in all a pleasant experience, I like the ambiance and the music wasn't too loud like other Yelpers have complained. I'd definately go back!
author: Stephanie W.

description: This is our go-to place for high quality sushi at reasonable prices. Nigiri and sashimi are the only things I order here, although the rolls are good as well.
author: Jason H.

description:
Not terribly impressed.  Food was OK but in the attempt at "new" sushi was a little too outside the box for me.  Sushi is supposed to be light but the cooked fish that was put into some of the dishes (aka M&L forever roll and the omega-3 roll) didn't taste too well.

The wording on the menu is also extremely small.  You know that ancient asian art of being able to write on a single grain of rice.  Yeah.  They found that person to write the sushi bistro menu.

Food was good but not great.  A little overpriced.  A little slice of overpriced fancy schmancy sushi dining in the Richmond.  Feels a bit like heaven doesn't it?
author: Aron L.

description:
Was recently part of a birthday outing here.

Group rate pricing worked out to $64 a person after tax and gratuity.This did not include alcohol. For my $64 I ate 5 pieces of sushi. Everyone i talked to agreed that they were still hungry when the evening ended.

The sushi tasted good but this was a terrible value.
author: John S.

description:
Went there with a friend on friday and there was a short wait, we sat at the bar so we didn't have that problem. i really enjoyed the dim lighting and atmosphere of the place.

we ordered a sashimi plate, which was pretty fresh
the aloha 101 roll, it was more of a fusion type of roll with a spicy garlic that goes really well with the ahi tuna, fresh mangos, and cucumber!! i loved it!!
but the best was the plate of butterfish! im not sure what butterfish is, but the texture was creamy and the taste was mellow. must try this dish! :]
author: Jess L.

description:
I would give this place a 3.5 but it's not a 4 so I gave it a 3

Sashimi was really good and good quality. I especially liked the butterfish and hamachi.  However, I did not like their rolls too much. I forgot which roll I ordered, but the scallion was way overpowering and that's all I can taste. 
This place is a good environment for a date. Kind of have the dark, nice, and clean restaurant. You might want to come early for parking and there's a wait.
author: Huyen N.

description: I don't remember what I got, but it was very good. Slightly more innovative approach to sushi. I would not hesitate going here again.
author: Huey N.

description: Came here on a whim for the greatest day out the year!....my birthday. In the calendar it's also known as Presidents Day. Everything was as smooth as my sake bomb! First, I booked my reservation for about 15-20 people only hours before our 830pm boogie down. Service was professional, knowledgeable, and hassle free. Of course the entourage took awhile to settle in our private room, the staff was patient with our ratchery. For many of us in the group this was our cherry pop into sushi! Our waiter was extremely diligent ensuring drinks were kept filled, plates were cleared without feeling rushed and had no problem with us consistently ordering food throughout our dinner. Try everything twice because we did! Thanks for the great atmosphere and birthday Sushi Bistro!
author: Frank M.

description:
Sushi Bistro not only has the freshest fish I've tasted in SF, they have a menu with an extensive array of any type of sushi you could imagine. Many times on my bus ride home from the FiDi, I find myself craving the scrumptiousness that is Sushi Bistro. They have something for everyone with plates of simple, delicious and fresh nigiri to more extravagant orders of Butterfish Blasters or, one of my favorites, their Hot Love baby lobster rolls. 

I think the only "key" is knowing what you're ordering: if you know you're more of a fresh fish kinda person, they have quite a few options in that arena. But if you go for the more sauced up, extra flavored dishes, check out the "Something Unique" column, and ask your waiter!
author: Brianne H.

description:
As my personal culinary history in SF becomes too epic and sprawling to store in my little brain, I'm increasingly grateful for the ability to pore over my old Yelp reviews.  For instance, I know that I've only ever given 5-star reviews to 5 sushi places:

Yum Yum & Maruya (which are really for simple, take-out lunch sushi)
Cha-Ya (which is vegetarian, so it's not like I was grading the fish quality)
Hama-Ko (admittedly awesome fish, but it's a mom-and-pop shop that's mostly about nigiri, no fancy rolls)
Sangha (which is, alas, closed)

As you can see, I've never given 5 stars to an all-out fancy-roll sushi dinner joint.  Until now.  Which I guess makes Sushi Bistro the best sushi in the city.  And funnily enough, I wound up here entirely by chance--no Yelp research involved.

Ok, so what makes it the best sushi in the city, you ask?  Suffice it to say that I tried 6 or 7 different rolls, any one of which could have been the star dish at a lesser restaurant.  Extremely creative flavorings (like the apple in the first crush roll), ridiculously fresh fish (like the spicy tuna on the red devil roll), generous portions, and reasonable prices considering the taste-bud tour de force you get (we were all quite satiated for a grand total of $24 per person).  Atmosphere is polished but intimate, not quite as trendy as Namu next door but still full of yuppie neighborhood couples who could probably be having kids by now but would rather spend their money on sushi.  And after sampling Sushi Bistro, I don't blame them.
author: Wes M.

description:
Tried "Sushi Bistro" tonight with a girl friend visiting from Seattle.

We were both a little overwhelmed by the menu (in a good way); we ended up ordering the "five wishes" and the "hawaiian breeze". The "five wishes" came as a little bit of a surprise; we hadn't expected a rainbow-roll-like nigiri wrapping of crab meat.. It was definitely filling and .. very crab-full, but neither of us would ever order it again.

The "hawaiian breeze" was really good! Loved the tuna / mango / macademia nut combination! Would like to try more creative rolls like this.

(If you're wondering, for two young women, one roll per person was perfect (~8 pieces per roll).)

The space itself was fine (nothing exceptional), but it was too loud. I feel like an old fogey when I call restaurants loud, but we hadn't seen one another for ~6 months and wanted to hear one another speak.

I hope to return to try more rolls like the hawaiian breeze!
author: Helen D.

description:
If i didn't have to pay, then i'd come again. 

Service could have been better. If you expect me to pay that much for the sushi, then I'm going to expect more from you (food and service).  Host was probably the one with the best customer service. He greeted, refilled the water and actually asked "how's the food" When walking out of the restaurant not so much as a thank you from any of the employees. In this economy, you're NOT going to try to get a return customer?! RIDIC

Food is awesome. I can understand the price for  food. Fresh fish, unique rolls, and clean presentations.

Maybe I didn't look hipster enough for them.
author: Connie M.

description: First I don't eat a lot of sushi, so I don't have a lot of experience, but it was by no means bad quality by we all agreed that it was a little expensive for what it was, how did I get there? Well, a bunch of my friends and I went to this place to celebrate my 21st birthday the only thing to criticise is that they got my friend and my orders messed up, but to be fair our order was almost the same exact one was spicy and one was not, I got the spicy one and my friend got the non-spicy one
author: Rachel N.

description: The poke salad is amazing here! The poke is incredibly fresh and flavorful. Their use of crunchy crispy onions (I think it's onions?), avocado, and dressing truly brings out the delicious flavor of the fish. It's so healthy too! We enjoyed the Red Devil roll but the Herime roll was kind of so-so. The service was so wonderful - there was never an empty plate on the table for more than a few seconds. The staff is definitely kind, thoughtful, and pleasant.
author: Jamie O.

description:
Yum. Awesome!

Sushi Bistro is a wonderful place to have dinner. I called ahead one hour ahead, and the nice lady who answered the phone, reserved me a table for two. 

Upon arrival, we were greeted very promptly and escorted to our table. The staff was quick to get us drinks and kept the water and tea coming throughout our meal. I was impresses my their great service. 

The food was wonderful. I had the "Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon $10.95 and comprised of: shrimp tempura, aioli, avocado & cucumber, topped with unagi and eel sauce.

I also had the lettuce wrap called "Equinox." It is $5.25 and consists of: shrimp tempura, unagi, avocado, sushi rice, spicy and eel sauce. I would go back just for this item. 

Lastly, I had a sliced, whole scallop that was fresh and melted in my mouth. It was served with sliced lemon.

Not on the menu is an item called "Dave's Special Roll." It is a sweet potato roll topped with Halibut. It was a real treat. The sweet potato is cooked and makes this roll seem like dessert.

I would come back everyday if I could.
author: Joyce H.

description:
I went back and tried a lot more of their rolls...
I think our favorite was african spider - albacore, softshell crab, with a spicy sauce
Hawaiian Breeze was also itneresting - mango, fuji apple, macadamia nut, cilantro pesto, and tuna
OOh and i like crouching tiger 
I also really liked the HOT LOVE - yum, lobster, crab, avocado served with a warm spicy sauce and warm. 

does anyone else think that one of the server dude's looks like the asian version of stephen from laguna beach? HAHAHA
author: Tim B.

description:
My favorite place for the non-traditional type of sushi. Have been there every now and then, and have witnessed it growing from a smaller/more modest restaurant to whatever it is now, I should now sing some good praises.

They have a full menu of rolls with exotic names (something to do with the in-laws, and something about nemo). Well the rolls are Americanized, I love them nevertheless. The fish is fresh and the ambience lively.

People there know how to build good will with customers. There was one time the waiter was very slow and when he finally came with our order, it was the wrong thing. So I complained, and the good thing was how well the waiter took the criticism. He apologized, quickly brought the right dish, and to finish off, we got some appetizer on the house. He somehow made me feel bad about complaining in the first place. Many restaurants can learn how to handle difficult situation from them.
author: vivian l.

description:
We had four items, two very good, two okay. I'd be willing to try it again.

Very good: Billy Jean Roll (holy cow it was yummy) and the Caterpillar (good version of a classic roll). 

Mostly good: magic mushroom appetizer (meh, I think you REALLY love mushroms to really appreciate it, texture was nice, but I'm not so much of a sweet and sour afficionado) and the  First Crush Roll (I liked the idea behind it but maybe I'm just not one for fruit on my sushi rolls?)
author: Audrey H.

description:
I've gone about 12 times since my first review (which was 5 stars) and every single time was exquisite.
I have tried most everything on the menu, and I have loved it all. I highy recommend the butterfish blasters, hot love, prawn pod and sashimi spirit.
The service is always incredible, and the sushi is innovative, fresh and perfectly flavored. 
I highly recommend Sushi Bistro, and I will continue to go here everytime I want a solid sushi meal.
author: megan s.

description:
I was trying to find a roll i had last time that was very good but i ordered the wrong one. Now, looking at the pics it was omega-3 i think.

What I ordered tonight:
butterfish sashimi( my absolute FAVORITE!!)
salmon crudo- I would skip this, it was alright but not my taste
aloha 101- pretty presentation but very bland
the new legend- solid
monster in law- simple but good
spicy tuna roll- solid
california roll- grosss.... they put wayy too much mayo in the imitation crab meat, this roll reminded me of costco sushi.. SO MUSHY

Overall, I would come back because I do like sushi bistro. There are many items on the menu I had in the past that was very good. What I ordered tonight though was quite disappointing.
author: A L.

description:
Officially one of my fave sushi place! 

Came here last Thursday and ordered different kind of sushi rolls such as: crouching tiger hidden dragon 
spicy crunchy 
volcano 
yellow tail basil 

All taste great! 

I'm pregnant right now so I can only order cooked sushi rolls. Can't wait to try their sashimi rolls.
author: cherry g.

description: Great sushi (quality, combinations) at a reasonable price. There's literally a sushi joint on every other corner in inner/outer Richmond, but the prices and quality here are spot on for us. The M&L roll is great, and their salmon nigiri is smoother than butter!
author: Carrie B.

description:
Great restaurant! We came here with my girlfriend and her brothers and everybody inhaled their food!

I like the location, right in the heart of inner Richmond with a few good stores right across from it. 

The only think i can suggest to them as well as other Asian style cuisines is simplifying the menu. One page of your best stuff that's all we ask for!

Other than that I'd definitely like to try out some of their other appetizers.
author: Jafar Amir Hanovic Ismailov M.

description:
Let me break it down.

I remember when Sushi Bistro really WAS a little bistro.  There were, like, six tables in that mug, one of them right up against the counter so that if you sat on the wall side, your right arm got a little wood burn by the end of the night after lifting up endless pieces of fabulous sushi.  My then paramour and I frequented the place often enough to feel like regulars.  

Then we moved.

Fast forward present day.  I'm back in the hood, and the joint's got new digs, new rolls, and a whole new vibe.  I still think that it's an amazing value for the fish that you get.  I'm all about both traditional sushi AND the new-fangled stuff.  But, hell no on the cheese on top of anything that's supposed to resemble sushi.  Homette don't play that.  

I saw tonight that they were Michelin recommended.  Nice.  Had the following, in rank order:

1. Monster in Laws
2. Yellowtail Belly nigiri
3.Sexy Scallop 
4. Butterfish Blasters
5. Tuna nigiri

It was all really good, but I have to agree with the other Yelper that the rice to fish ratio on the nigiri is rather ridiculous.  I mean, that's a big ass slice of fish to a half a teaspoon's worth of rice.  

That said, if I had a d**k, I'd have a rock on for SB.
author: Tamar D.

description:
Okay so, I wrote my previous review two years ago, BEFORE they moved to a bigger place, got onto the iPhone commercial, and opened a second location. First when they moved to a bigger place I was worried that the quality of the sushi would start seriously slacking. It actually didn't. The decor was much more appealing, and it was definitely more roomier which I appreciate. And the dim lightning makes for a great date spot. (Be careful of the sake intake when you're on a date... everything looks better when your drunk and in the dark). 

Anyways, then the iPhone commercial for the UrbanSpoon app came out, and when I saw it I was so excited because I've been supporting this place since 2006! WOW... what a change a famous commercial makes. TONS, and TONS of reservations pouring in, making it harder to maintain that intimate feeling between you, the sushi chef, or server. They are now far too busy to even stay at your table to take a sake shot with you.

Then, they opened the 2nd location. This is where I really noticed things to go downhill. Smaller portions, things I've had hundreds of times seemed lackluster and not the way I always remember. Something was a little off. Quality control went down, and the portion size DEFINITELY did, while the prices increased slightly. Although the flavors of most of the rolls are there... I don't know... its just not what it used to be. Before, I didn't mind paying $12 for a fantastic roll that was absolutely orgasmic and generous (portion wise) - but I left basically with the feeling like "my best friend got famous and now she doesn't remember who she really was, or who I am anymore..."

Does that make sense?

I still give it four stars instread of three for the flavor and uniqueness of the rolls, including some of the new ones and the daily specials on the menu. I will probably give it another go, hoping they will prove me wrong on all my observations.
author: Jacklyn S.

description:
It is one of my favorite sushi places in town! The food is great and lovely! It is a great place to have dinner or to go on a date! 
However, the service is not that great! They are a bit lousy and they don't pay enough attention to the customers. I wish they would bring hot tea along the water instead of the tea-bag!
author: Golazin R.

description: I love sushi bistro, I've gone here with out reservations and with reservations. The service is good, and the food is consistent and always very yummy. Only down side about this place is that they can get pretty pricey.
author: Raquel G.

description:
Absolutely fantastic. 

I think it's pretty obvious that different people go to sushi restaurants for different reasons: sashimi, nigiri, maki...well, I'm a "maki man" and Sushi Bistro is BY FAR my favorite sushi joint I've seen in SF so far. 

Wanting to try some of the creative sushi combinations that SB is known for, I started off with the "Caucasian Afro," which was a mix of tuna, guac, crispy onions...I realize that sounds strange, but it was unbelievable. 

The rolls I had were all amazing: the New Legend, New Wave Mahi Mahi and the Crunchy roll...sheer perfection. 

SB has everything that I want in sushi place: creative rolls, moderate prices, and not too long of a wait. 

I highly recommend that you check out Sushi Bistro if you're looking for something exciting and new.
author: Tom A.

description: I'm only giving it two stars because it states "Meh, I've experience better" which is true for me. The sushi wasn't that great and neither was the food. I ordered several rolls along with the udon noodles with steak meat and it didn't taste very fresh. The sushi was barely mediocre. I've had WAY better elsewhere in the city. The closest good thing about this restaurant was the service and presentation of the food.
author: Pudgy G.

description:
I was craving some sushi and stumbled upon this place on yelp. My first impression of this restaurant was" wow looks cool"
So, after I was seated they gave me some tea and some boiled peas that were lightly salted while I looked at the menu.
I ordered a pink dragon roll and a O2 roll. We wailed about 30 mins before it arrived and guess what?! They gave us the wrong order!! They gave us a Godzilla roll. That tasted soo plain! it was like literary eating plain rice! I personally had a bad experience here, don't recommend it.
author: Jack L.

description: If I had to say my favorite thing about this place, it would be the service. The waitress answered all of our questions and the wait staff was so efficient. Almost too efficient! You can definitely be in and out quick if need be. As for the sushi.. it was okay. My friend and I have been trying out all the sushi places in the area and this didn't match up against some of the other ones. A bit on the expensive side and nothing really stood out. Also I loved the decor of the restaurant but my friend and I could barely hear each other over all the noise! I guess it depends what you're looking for.
author: Casie S.

description:
The first few times I went to Sushi Bistro, I probably would have rated them 4 or 5 stars. They have a lot going for them. Close to home, very fresh fish, innovative rolls, really great staff. I can even overlook the loud thumpa-thumpa music that drove "The Brians D." so crazy. 

Unfortunately, the last time I went, the fish wasn't nearly as fresh as other times. One piece was so tough I had to spit it in my napkin. Maybe a fluke? Hopefully! Also, I am finding the rolls to be increasingly sauce-tastic. It is difficult to find a roll where you can actually taste the fish. The novelty is wearing off. Based on the 5 or 6 times I've been, the nigiri was amazing all but one time, so they still average "A OK" in my book.
author: Michelle D.

description:
"Big Head"

Let me preface this review by letting you know that I have eaten at Sushi Bistro many times and the food is excellent.

Sushi Bistro is a twist  of good Japanese stlye food and Reggae music.
I wish I could stop there with my review, but unfortunately good food should be followed with good service and that is not the case with Sushi Bistro.

Some of you out there who have been to Sushi Bistro before may disagree with me, but after reading the rest of this review (on service) below, you might change your opinion.

Last night (Monday, February 15th) I had a reservation for 2 @ 8:00 pm. Showed up on time to find that the only table they had available to seat me in was the one worst table in the whole restaurant. It's located in the walkway between the hosts counter and path to bar and other tables. It also catches the draft from the door whenever it is open.

I politely refused to sit there and agreed to wait for a better table.
15 minutes later a table became available, however the hostess was less than interested in seating me (the table was placed for a party of 4). I kindly asked to be seated there with the prompt reply that it was reserved for a party of 4.
Noticing the reservation list, I saw that the party of 4 had the same reservation time slot as I, 8:00 pm and they were 15 minutes late past their time. So I politely stated that fact with a second request to be seated. I was again denied seating at said table.

After a brief debate with the hostess's and a waiter, my companion and I left on our own accord.

This is not the first time I have had this experience. I would also like to point out that I never choose to eat at Sushi Bistro and only attempt to dine there when a request is made.

Sparing you the reader the longer full details of this experience, I have summarized the events I had the unfortunate time of dealing with.

Take note, Sushi Bistro = good food with sub par service (at least from all the times I've been there).

I'd recommend if you go with a party of 2, make a reservation for 3, wait to be seated and then if asked, say your friend couldn't make it.

It's a sad day when you have to trick a restaurant into seating you properly.
author: Mathew R.

description: Dropped in after a day at Academy of Sciences.   Good food excellent service. One of my chopsticks went flying . . . almost before it hit the floor the waiter zoomed a new pair onto the table.   We had a light meal of tempura and a couple rolls.  All very tasty. Interesting that brown rice sushi is offered. But as pointed out in another review, the sushi isn't over-burdened with rice. A good effort toward healthy food - easy to eat a plant-strong meal if you wish.   Service was just amazing.  A pleasure to eat here and to receive a modest bill at the end -- $38 for two of us, incl large hot sake.  One of the rolls took longer. . . twice the staff assured us it was on the way and apologized for the "slowness" which was not really slow at all.
author: Bill H.

description:
Great fusion sushi.
C2 roll was great along with the hawaiian rolls
the 2 seater tables are too damn small!
We were too cramped in our seats - and we are both skinny.
Sake was good too.
They too my menu away after i ordered 4 items, sorry for them, we would have ordered 4 more!
author: Pug P.

description: The rolls here are a real hit or miss. I personally love the hawaiian roll and monster in law but other then that didn't love the other rolls we ordered. I highly recommend the Ahi poke, its this huge bowl of very fresh ahi with all this other deliciousness in it.
author: Mariam H.

description:
I like sushi a lot and I'm not just talking about traditional sushi, Ergo I like Sushi Bistro.  The rolls are different, the menu has variety and they have an Omega 3 roll that I really enjoyed quite a bit last time.

I used to go here when I lived a couple blocks over and it was in its old space a few doors down.  It was nice then and smaller, not quite as trendy looking.  I liked that space more because it seemed less pretentious.  Not that its really pretentious but ever since it was in that Iphone commercial it seems a bit trendy.

I'll continue to go here when I know I'll be in the area, I'm a fan.
author: J. B.

description:
I guess I'm too old school for this place. A few too many things rubbed me the wrong way.

Granted, the quality of the food was very good. 

I don't like being charged for tea, and find it particularly offensive when the food is so expensive. ($6 hotate nigiri)

Like I said, I like old school sushi. I cringe when I see sundried tomatoes on a sushi menu. If you like the idea of "fushi" (fushion sushi), then come on down. There is a brown rice roll with spicy albacore, fuji apples, salmon, ginger and cilantro ponzu with your name on it. 

The service was prompt, but I also felt a bit rushed at the end of the meal. In most traditional Japanese-owned restaurants I feel relaxed and enjoy a peaceful meal at my own pace. 

In summation, if you don't mind spending $18 on a cup of tea, miso soup, seaweed salad, and 1 order of nigiri, then this is your spot. 

I'm iguana keep looking for old school sushi. thank you
author: Blue R.

description:
i tried really hard to like this place, but i thought it was just okay.  a friend of mines recommended this place and raves about it so it was time to check it out.  A+++ for superb customer service, they are quick to removing empty bowls or plates, refilling water, and are super nice.  i love how after we finish a roll, the next roll rolls in perfectly.  ;]  i mean the table were pretty small for a table for two, so we weren't bombarded with rolls after rolls.  

initially i came in thinking i was going to eat real japanese sushi but then realizing that the sushi rolls were more of an american fusion.  not hating, i thought what we ordered were yummy but not enough to satisfy my palette.  

started with sesame chicken, you can never go wrong with deep fried chicken.  lol  :]   
my favorite had to be sexy scallop, spicy white tuna, salmon, avocado and topped with spicy chopped scallop, tobiko and scallions.  very nicely presented.
omega-3, deep fried albacore, salmon, avocado and asparagus, topped with fresh albacore, salmon and tobiko, drizzled with spicy soy.  i thought this was ok, very heavy on the sauce.
watermelon-man, spicy tuna, mango, black sesame seed and 
macadamia nuts topped with avocado. was a disappointment to me.  i felt it lacked the mango i wanted to taste and overall it was sort of bland considering they were already drizzled with sauce. 

overall, i think i would give this place a second try.
author: mea f.

description: Came here with a party of 10....so I'm pretty sure we tried almost everything on the menu, especially the top rated or recommended ones we saw on yelp.  I couldn't really distinguish what was what...but I'd say 90% of the rolls we ordered were really great....plus it was given to us by a cute server.  Def a plus!  I'd call this a cute trendy sushi/bar/hang out place in the Inner Richmond (which is otherwise boring as hell lol)
author: Liz W.

description:
Superior.  One would imagine the temptation to skimp on the quality of fish must be overwhelming given the fairly elaborate presentation of [many of] their dishes, but so far I've yet to take an offending bite.  

One warning: my better half claims that taking her here has retroactively ruined other places' sushi for her, so that now only S.B. will satisfy the most severe sushi cravings.  So there... you were warned.

And yes, try, nay, savor the magic mushrooms.
author: Nathan G.

description:
I know this place is popular, but I've had better sushi elsewhere. Its definitely not an authentic japanese place. I've only had rolls:

C-2 : baby lobster, avocado and cucumber topped with shrimp tempura, drizzled with eel sauce. This is good, but there is mayo
Sexy Scallop: Again a lot of mayo

They're summer wrap is pretty good, but somtimes there is water left on the lettuce which dilutes the flavor.
author: Julia L.

description:
Fantastic!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! 

I took a couple of friends here for Sushi this past weekend because one of my coworkers spoke of the place so highly. Soooo happy that we tried it. Supper exotic rolls, a lot of variety and a molding of flavors mixed together into deliciousness. 

We started off with two appetizers, Hot Love and Magic Mushroom. The Hot Love was my absolute favorite dish out of everything we tried. It consisted of Baby lobster, avocado and crab meat rolled in snapper, baked with spicy sweet sauce. Hot Love melted in my mouth like butter.  My mouth is watering now that I think of it.  However, I can't discount the rest of the dishes as they were phenomenal as well.  The Magic Mushroom appetizer consisted of chopped salmon and yellowtail mixed with macadamia pesto topped on mushrooms, flash fried and drizzled with spicy sweet fish sauce. 

For our main course we shared the Crouching Tiger Hidden Dragon, and C-2. The Crouching Tiger Hidden Dragon roll consisted of Shrimp tempura, aioli, avocado & cucumber, topped with unagi and eel sauce, and the C-2 roll consisted of baby lobster, avocado and cucumber topped with shrimp tempura and drizzled with eel sauce. 

We finished everything. Not one piece of food was left on our plates. This was the highlight of our night. The next day we kept talking about how good Sushi Bistro was. 

Sushi Bistro was a big hit with one of my girlfriends as she refuses to eat raw fish. There were many baked roll options to choose from. 

We will be back with empty tummies!
author: Lenee F.

description: My girlfriend and I really like this place. The foods fresh and tastes great, they have a pretty good sake menu, and the atmosphere is really nice. Definitely a great place to consider taking someone out on a first date to have good food in a dimly lit intimate feeling location. My girlfriend loves the butterfish blasters, and I agree that theyre pretty great. Really though, all the rolls look good and every one weve tried has always been great.
author: Henry W.

description:
Hands down, Best Sashimi in SF. 

12 Piece for $16 is now my mainstay.  Would pay $50 for the same dish. 

Outstanding...
author: Adam X.

description:
Excellent vegetarian sushi -- some very innovative ideas. 

- Maui salad -- brilliant. 
- The shitaake mushroom roll is sushi-turned inside out. And it works well. 
- As does the fortune roll -- fortune cookie crumbles on an avocado seaweed roll. -- Crunchy on the outside, and creamy on the inside. 
- The tempura sushi is a sureshot winner. 
- Friends loved the tuscan sushi more than their ones with fish. 

And that cucumber-sesame complimentary opener they serve! Brilliant! 

All but 1 of the non-vegetarian sushi dishes were brilliant too, is what my friends told me. 

So yeah, I'll be back -- again & again here!
author: KS S.

description:
Went here for my friend's birthday the other day. This sushi place is definitely different from what I'm used to (cheap and convenient Yo's Sushi in Vallejo). A little pricey, and very unique.

Before ordering, they give you a dish of pickled cucumbers with sesame seeds, and I was so hungry that I ate the whole thing! The have a wide variety of beer, wine, and sake, which I love. I was a little intimidated from the menu items, so I played it safe and ordered the dragon roll (crab meat and avocado topped with eel). It was probably the priciest dragon roll I've ever had, but it was really good!

One star off because my friend had to wait really, really long for her dish. I'm definitely coming back and hopefully I won't get too intimidated and I'll try something new from their really creative menu.
author: Lisa D.

description: Disclaimer: I am not a big sushi fan.  I tolerate it mainly due to big group or birthday dinners.  However, I loved sushi bistro...their menu not only covered great sushi for the raw fish conneseur, but it had a great range of sushi-inspired dishes.  I was excited to try the different appetizers, lettuce wraps and salads that you normally don't see on a sushi menu.  I have to give them props for the creative names as well, "hot love" got a good laugh for sure.
author: Betsy C.

description:
OMG I love this place! This is my favorite/only non-authentic sushi place everrrr! Don't get turned off just because its not authentic Japanese. That's the point, their rolls are so unique and creative and different but they taste realllyyyy good. Two things I order whenever I come out there: Butterfish Blasters and C-2 (baby lobster). 

The place is pretty small but nice ambiance. Lots of parking if you know how to look. 

My goal this year: to try every single dish in their menu.  =)
author: Janina V.

description:
Yowzah! I'm sold.  
This place was amazing.  Very kind and helpful service.  
Wonderful menu selection.  I was super pleased with and will forever order "Five Wishes" and "Albacore Dream." They were phenomenal.  The fish was so buttery and smooth.  
Loved every bite and can't wait to go back!  My new favorite sushi place in San Francisco!
author: G W.

description:
First time for here for my husband & I...thanks to our friend "The Janman", who raved about their sushi.  So as hungry as we were and excited to try something new, we hesitated no more to make sure we get there before they closed at 10:30 pm.  

Apparently parking sucks in the area, but the food is well worth it.  We ordered the Aloha 101, Sexy Scallop (which is NOT named after our friend, even though he played the card to tell us they named a sushi after him), and The New Legend. We also had a side of their "Toro". Delicious!! 

There were still groups of people in there around 10pm on a Thursday night.  Service was on point / price just right.  But I agree with the last person that it does get kinda crowded and too close to your neighboring sushi lover. Love the reggae music they got going. We hope to make it out there again sometime soon.
author: Christina L.

description:
I am very picky about sushi - I like the typical rolls to be good, such as the Rainbow Roll, Hamachi Rolls, etc - But I love it when great sushi places can create new, different and delicious rolls. 
Sushi Bistro does just that. 
Not only are their rolls delicious, but their entrees and appetizers are as well, and they all have that creative kick to them.

Sushi Bistro gets 5 stars from me not only because of their food, but also because of their prices. Most sushi places with sushi as great as this charge you an arm and a leg. Here, it is affordable. I am a college student on a tight budget - Sushi Bistro is definitely where I splurge, but I am so glad it is priced where it is - Not too cheap, not too expensive.

The service (waiters and waitresses) aren't always the nicest people but it tends to be dark and busy in there. The food comes fast though, and I guess that is all that really matters.

My only complaint is that it tends to get a little cramped - Some of the tables are quite close together! Still a great place for a date though - Great drinks, variety of beers and wines, and overall a great ambiance.

Definitely, definitely try the Hawaiian Breeze roll - It has pesto and macadamia nuts on top. It. Is. DELICIOUS!
author: Briana C.

description:
Sushi Bistro is total crap. 

This place is for people who don't know what REAL sushi/sashimi should taste like. Sure, there are plenty of beautiful looking rolls here... but they all just taste the same in the end because there are so many different ingredients masking each others' flavors.

The first time I came here, my boyfriend and I ordered some rolls and their 10 piece nigiri... and it was AWFUL. The rice was cold, hard, and fell apart when you picked up a piece of sushi. The chefs didn't even season the underside of the fish with wasabi. I told the waiter and he nonchalantly said that people didn't like the wasabi there. What he meant was that "Americans" don't want the wasabi. However, "Americans" mix a ton of wasabi in soy sauce for sushi dunking, so why don't the chefs just make the nigiri properly? 
The 2nd time I went was only because my boyfriend had a gift certificate. We decided to give it another chance. I didn't even bother ordering anything other than nigiri (and I made sure to tell the waitress to have the chefs season it properly). The bf got a few of their rolls... which promptly fell apart the second he picked them up with chopsticks. I ate one of each type and was not impressed at all. I think the rolls are just a means to utilize the last bits of leftover fish they have available. Also, the waiters find it perfectly acceptable to grab items from your table while you're eating, so one of em knocked my food right off of my chopsticks with his hand. Gross.

If you want REAL sushi... god, I really hate to give away my current favorite spot... go to Okina on Arguello. The sushi chef/owner is a PRO. You pick your sushi up (yes, with your hands) directly from the bar. YUM! Forget the excessive amount of soy sauce and wasabi that you're used to, because it just covers up the natural taste of the fish. And Okina provides top rate seafood here- unlike the pathetic specimens Sushi Bistro offers.  Whenever I go to Okina, I just tell the chef to make me whatever he wants. It's always DEEEEEELICOUS!! He doesn't serve "fancy" rolls or certain types of fish because he knows what ingredients mix together badly or types of fish that cause indigestion.
author: Suzi G.

description: This is my go-to sushi spot. I've always had a good experience here. Everything is fresh.
author: David C.

description:
I am, by no means, a sushi connoisseur but I'd like to think I know whether food is very good (i.e., so full but you still want more) versus very bad (i.e., on an empty stomach, take a bite off of a dish and would rather starve than to take another bite).

Me and a group of 3 gals walked into this chic cave. Yes, I said cave. Cave, as in, inside it's dark...and then you walk into a reggae wonderland among a sushi atmosphere. Very interesting. While looking at the menu, eating my fish friends and chatting it up, I noticed myself bobbing my head to my homie Bob Marley.

So...a group of 4 gals shared 6 orders and we were stuffed. We paid $20 each (including tip) and I think that's a pretty good deal.

We ordered: 1. Crouching Tiger Hidden Dragon, 2. Nemo Found, 3. Spicy Crunchy, 4. Caterpillar, 5. Crunchy, and 6. First Cruch (Is there a misspelling on their online menu?). 

I'm too lazy to go into too much detail but apparently I am a big fan of the crunchy- I especially enjoyed the Crunchy and the Crouching Tiger Hidden Dragon. Definitely my faves.
author: Ileana H.

description:
I just remembered, I met up with some friends here last night after attending a fashion show event. After seeing skinny ass 6'2 models, I wasn't that keen on eating even though I've heard rave reviews about this place.  I was completely in "i'm never going to eat until i lose 20 lbs mode" and muttered that I'm just going to order a salad. 

My friend gave me a death stare and said, wth would you order a salad here! 

She was right, I ordered some rolls, the aoli sauce is excellent and I love how they add scallions in the sushis. Very creative indeed. I'm glad I ate the sushi and I learned that I have no will power to be skinny.

Excellent food, service, and overall casual trendy ambiance.
author: N K.

description:
Had dinner here and order takeout, and both times I have been pleased with the food they have. Their ahi tune poke is really really nice and they have a bunch of fun rolls with cute names. Very generous portions! 
The service is good and the atmosphere is very chill!
author: Marie-Claire R.

description: Sushi fusion pushed too far? Good presentation, good service, maybe just a little too far of a cry when you want authentic sushi.
author: Andrew J.

description:
A haiku about Sushi Bistro:

Fresh, edgy sushi
Mango, macademia
Flavor explosions!

Yum.
author: Kara A.

description: We had the worst experience in this place: we came in and asked how long we need to wait for a table. As they mentioned 20 mins, we put our name, parked the car and came back after 10 mins. After that point, everything was disastrous. Although we have a baby waiting to be fed, they made us wait almost 1 hr, giving tables to parties arriving after us. Every time we asked for a table, the response was "yeah, yeah, yeah". After we gave up and left the restaurant, the response of the host was "Sweet!". Well, done guys! You have a successful future ahead of you!!!
author: Murat S.

description: After dying to try this place for over a year, I finally made reservations for Friday night to go there with my boyfriend. The place did not meet our expectations and the reviews it has online. The rolls were tiny, dry, full of rice, and lacking any taste. We got 4 different rolls to try and there was no difference in taste between them. So definitely will not be coming back here again.
author: Karina A.

description:
A unique and modern spin on classic sushi roles.

We decided to venture beyond our usual sushi joints this week and found ourselves the patrons of Sushi Bistro located on the outskirts of Inner Richmond. The first thing that strikes you is that this is a place for young, but experienced, sushi eaters. The prices keep the college age riffraff  away while the more bombastic atmosphere is likely to turn off anyone in the 40+ crowd. But for those with a youthful attitude and some cash to spend, you could do a lot worse than Sushi Bistro.

I tried one of their specialty rolls, the African Spider, and the more classic Caterpillar Roll. Both were constructed with high grade ingredients and very flavorful. The caterpillar, tragically, lacked a certain level of cohesion and thus fell apart without careful chopstick action, but I had mastered the technique by the third attempt. I will say both rolls were HUGE, and because of the rich flavor, I can't recommend eating one roll on your own... it's just too much unless you really want a lot of one thing. Better to take a date and split a few rolls to vary the experience.

There was also an order of poke at the table, which I would describe as "deconstructed". I didn't try any myself, but those who did said while the tuna itself wasn't "the best", the dish when eaten as a whole was quite good. That seems to be a good way to describe a lot of what's going on at Sushi Bistro.

On a lark, Diner B and I tried their shooters, which for some reason do not appear on their online menu. If memory serves, it was a raw oyster, quail egg, some roe and a good helping of sake. Frankly, it was more than I could shoot all at once, which detracted from the overall experience. Can't say I would bother with the expense again.

Also, the miso soup was only so-so. But the point of the place, as I see it, isn't just about the food. It's about the atmosphere. So, if you aren't looking for the purist experience and are willing to spend a little more, this would be a great date place. Just be sure to order the rolls.
author: Sean K.

description:
So good.

I've been here a few times this past month.  My only minor complaint is that they have far too many fried rolls on the menu.  They're really good, but it seems like 75% of their rolls are either deep fried or lightly fried.

The ahi tuna poke special was TO DIE FOR.  The fish is really fresh, no matter what you're ordering.

Our server was very cool.  We sat at the bar and he was perfectly attentive and it was, overall a really nice dining experience -4.5 stars.
author: Lauren R.

description:
4 STARS?!?! You've got to be kidding.....

This place was awful. We ordered $120 worth of sushi that was soggy (i.e. too much water in the rice) and nasty. The quality of the fish was questionable and they used imitation crab meat on their CA rolls....ughhh...to make matters worse, they actually got stingy with their ginger. PAH LEEEEEZ! I've haven't been this disappointed in a sushi joint in a long while.
author: R K.

description:
I ate here two weeks ago and I still remember the experience fondly. This is a far cry from a traditional sushi experience I had recently (Ino cough cough). Sushi Bistro would have sushi purists cringing but for others like me, totally DELIGHTED! They don't claim to be authentic but the food they serve is FUN, Japanese fusion baby! It's also filling and beautifully presented. 

One of the things that really drew us in was their brown rice sushi option. Their menu has special brown rice sushi rolls but we found out quickly that ANY of the rolls can be made with brown rice! ROUND OF APPLAUSE please! :) We devoured:

AFRICAN SPIDER - Cajun flavored albacore, salmon, soft shell crab, sprouts, tobiko, avocado and spicy house sauce. I honestly didn't think the albacore was that Cajun tasting. It was rather mild but I didn't mind because I don't like spicy.

CROUCHING TIGER HIDDEN DRAGON - Shrimp tempura, aioli, avocado & cucumber, topped with unagi and eel sauce. The tempura was perfect, hot and crisp. Everything married well and the portion was big!

WAIKIKI - Mango and avocado topped with unagi, eel sauce and macadamia nuts. Sweet and savory, soft and crunchy! I love the textures and contrasting flavors of this roll. Who knew mango and nuts would be so tasty in sushi?

As we ate the rolls, we kept wondering if the brown rice was real brown rice. We thought the texture was too soft/tender but the color was consistent. It tasted great but was it the real thing? The waiter told us that they buy a special kind of brown rice from Japan especially for sushi. Well I guess they hella told me! I love brown rice sushi but it's not always done right. I'm so happy Sushi Bistro is considerate of people like me to use a different kind of brown rice. It really did help to achieve a better texture which results in better tasting sushi!

Ask and you shall receive.
author: Julia T.

description:
I live down the street but don't come here that often, I have another secret sushi lover.
But when I want something less authentic, I come here. They have great rolls. Super creative and great presentation by an excellent crew of sushi chefs. Loud music, crowded place, trendy, it's a great place to kick back at the end of a crazy week with friends. If you want to go on a Friday or Saturday night, make a reservation. Pretty sure they don't leave tables for walk-ins. Lame for being in the middle of a residential area.
author: Emily P.

description: My boyfriend and I always come here and when our friends ask us where we go to eat Sushi we always say Sushi Bistro. Since we are regulars we have tried many if not almost all of the rolls and we are never disappointed. Our favorites include: Hawaiian Breeze, Crunchy , Spider, C-2 and Red Devil :) Everything is always fresh, its loud, its fun, always a great time!
author: Lisa P.

description:
A and I were planning on going to Namu for dinner and arrived at 6:30 to an almost empty restaurant just to be told they were completely booked and wouldn't have any availability until 8:45. No way I was going to wait over 2 hours for dinner. I was hunggggry. So we headed next door to Sushi Bistro instead.

They didn't really have any available tables either, but they sat us at the bar - which was totally cool with us. We both ordered the green tea for drinks. As for food, we ordered the chirashi, African spider roll, Nemo Found roll, and the Five Wishes roll. The fish was fresh enough. I really really really liked the African Spider roll and the bartender told us they had actually won an award for that one. The other two were good too, just not as outstanding as the African Spider.

This is definitely not your typical sushi restaurant. I wouldn't call it authentic, but they are definitely very creative with their rolls, their decor is nice, and we had no problems with the service. It was kind of loud though. The music was loud so patrons were talking (and laughing) extra loud to compensate.

Come here for creative rolls, but not if you want truly authentic sushi.
author: Kris L.

description:
Ugh, love this place!!! 

Roll highlights:
- Butterfish Blasters
- Crouching Tiger Hidden Dragon
- African Spider

The regular sushi is fantastic as well and the cuts of fish are really generous. Try the salmon and yellowtail belly - omg.

Classic rolls are legit. The Spicy Tuna, Yellowtail Scallion and Crunchy rolls are delicious, cheap(er) and they give you at least 8 pieces. Amazing. The menu is chock full of creative rolls so there is something for everyone.

Service is super fast....almost too fast I wanna say. We blazed through our meal in 40 minutes! Lol. I hope they're not pre-making the rolls and then just cutting them to order. Hmmm. Oh well whatever, the end product is still pretty damn good.

There are two bars - sushi bar seating and bar bar seating (equipped with 2 flat screen TVs). Would recommend making a reservation ahead of time, especially on the weekend.
author: Yee-Shing W.

description: The restaurant is nice; Sashimi is OK; but the sushi sucks! I won't go back anymore.
author: Angie L.

description:
Wow, the first time I have been let down by fellow yelpers. 

The fish definitely did not seem fresh.  We order Toro and the pieces were huge.  Guess that should have been a sign, because good cuts of Toro are a lot more smaller.  Cannot think of any roll that stood out.  My friend from Japan suggested we start with a cup of Miso - he says from the taste of Miso, one can tell whether or not the sushi will be good. He thought the Miso was no good...and sure enough, neither was the sushi...
author: Michael W.

description:
My boyfriend took me here for my birthday recently. It's a cute little date spot, and they were playing some good music.

The seafood was fresh and good quality, but boyfriend and I both agreed that they are less authentic than we are used to. Another thing that bothered us: we ordered one of the rolls that was topped with spicy tuna (I can't remember the name), and it had no kick to it whatsoever. Very disappointing. I loved the Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon roll though. =)

Service here is excellent. Waiters are friendly and attentive, and they are happy to make recommendations if you can't decide what to order!
author: Leigh R.

description: Sushi Bistro is a great neighborhood sushi place, but worth driving to even if you don't live in the Inner Richmond. Their menu is a bit overwhelming by all the choices, but that's a good thing, and the fish is fresh. I recommend going if you're looking to change up from the traditional rolls and want some creativity when it comes to sushi. You'll absolutely find it at Sushi Bistro.
author: Katie M.

description:
This place is awesome. It's not overpriced, but not underpriced for the quality of sushi that you are getting. They recently upgraded to a new restaurant so it's really cool and trendy inside.

The best thing about sushi bistro is that it's not super well-known or uppity like Ozumo, but the quality and taste that you get is the same, if not better. Their nigiri/sashimi is excellent. Some of the best I've ever had and I've eaten a lot of sushi. Definitely get nigiri or sashimi if you go because they give you large cuts and they are all top quality and buttery and soft.

Make reservations cuz these guys can get filled up quickly on a busy night!
author: Yvonne C.

description:
Great food & service!

Food:  Sushi was delicious and unique!!  I loved that they don't use too much rice in their sushi.  Every bite was the perfect size!  Fave rolls- Monsters-in-law & Sexy Scallop.  Sashimi slices were really worth it, big thick slices and very fresh.  

Service:  Food came out really quickly & service was great!  The servers helped each other out w/ drinks, order taking, and serving the food.   If you needed something, you could ask any of them w/o feeling like you have to wait to address your own server.  

Will definitely be back!
author: Jena W.

description: Reluctant at first because I was greeted by a non Asian server and sushi chef. But I gave it a shot. What better way to judge a sushi joint than its sushi? Nigiri had good fish:rice ratio, and the fish was fresh and chilled at just the temp of my liking. Appetizers, such as the agedashi tofu was traditional and tasty as well. M&L roll was a burst of flavors, though a tad bit salty.
author: Katherine C.

description: Yeah, I love it. There is this ahi tuna salad with crunchy sweet potato strings on the top that is close to the greatest thing ever. We've decided to go here for dinner tonight and I thought, "Geez, I really need to write a Yelp review of that place." It's so good and pretty reasonable. They have very creative dishes. My dislikes are that it attracts a kind of Marina-ish crowd so it can get annoying and loud, but most of the time the vibe is cool. It's also kind of trendy and Williamsburg-ie for my taste, but not all amazing local SF restaurants can be funky hole-in-the-wall places.
author: Robynne W.

description:
i've been really disappointed with their sashimi lately, it just hasn't tasted very fresh the last few time i was there, and service was just ok.

but i still recommend this place for people who want to have veggie sushi options.  they have an extensive selection of rolls.
author: Josie M.

description:
Came here for a birthday dinner back in November!  We had a party of about 15.

Service: Mediocre. It was kind of slow and forgot to place an order for one of our rolls (but it was ok, because we were full anyways).  

Ordered:
New Wave Mahi-Mahi
Steamed Mahi-Mahi, crabmeat, avocado topped with Mango Salsa
I like variety so I shared 3 sushi rolls and a another dish with one other. The mango salsa did not sound too appetizing to me, but my friend wanted to order it. It was the best roll I had all night. The mango salsa did not over power the taste of the sushi, instead it enhanced it. So glad that we got this roll.

C-2 Roll
Baby Lobster, avocado and cucumber topped with shrimp tempura and drizzled with eel sauce
This was one of Jenny's favorite's roll. It was good, but I still thought the New Wave Mahi-Mahi roll was better.

Hamachi Kama
Ella doesn't eat raw fish, so she always orders something cooked. Actually, she always orders the hamachi kama, which is cooked yellowtail collar. Really good especially when dipped into the ponzu sauce. The price is reasonable here and they give a big portion. YUM!


Sexy Scallop Roll
Spicy white tuna, salmon, avocado topped with spicy chopped scallop, tobiko and scallions.
We had originally ordered this, but I think the waiter left it out, so I got to try a piece from Anita. After trying this roll I'm glad that I didn't order it because it wasn't as good as I thought it would be. I really like scallops and I thought having scallops in a roll would taste really good, but it didn't thrill my tastebuds too much.


The New Legend Roll
Shrimp tempura, spicy aioli, avocado topped with seared albacore, spicy garlic sauce and scallions
A roll that I suggested we order. I love seared albacore so I wanted this. The roll was pretty good, too bad it was just a tad bit spicy. You know me and spicy food. Not too fond. But overall this roll had a good variety of things, which I like.

Overall, I thought the rolls were pretty daym good. Unique and different! I will be back for more...One of the better Sushi Restaurants in San Francisco=]
author: Sarah F.

description:
We were in the Richmond neighborhood,and wanted a nice quick meal early in the evening. First parking spot and closest joint takes it. SUSHI BISTRO! Let's go!

The sushi is off the hook! Hand rolls and cut rolls, presentation, you name it! Unagi, baby! Excellent Text Book Tempura... light, crispy, but could be more generous.

Beef Teriyaki is piss poor... thin, tough... don't even think about it. Order the large bottle of Sapporo instead!

Very friendly service, and fast too. Small place, not designed for comfort, but practical. 

Good stuff! 
Everything's cool... 'cept for the Beef Teriyaki!
author: Rick V.

description:
Love this place and it's in my neighborhood!

For a long time I did not like Sushi.  I blame it having a bad initial experience where the fish tasted... fishy.  It took a long time to get over that initial reaction.  But finally some friends took me to a quality sushi restaurant and it made all the difference.  I love it  now, but only if it's high quality; I don't like medium high quality... it has to be high quality.

So without saying, Sushi Bistro is amazing.  My friend thinks it's the best in SF.  Not sure I can actually say that but it's at the top of the list for me.  Not only is the sushi great but they have other great dishes as well, not just your standard bento boxes/udon noodle soups.  Their salads and unique dish menus are stellar.  It's also a really quaint space.

The only downside, it's extremely loud in there.
author: Toni T.

description:
Sushi Bistro, you are my favorite.

A friend of mine promised me A-mazing sushi and I was skeptical because everyone always claims that they know the best sushi spot ever. But this was no lie. Oh. my. delicious.

Delicious sushi, inventive creations, decent pricing = HAPPINESS!

The restaurant is, as everyone else has mentioned, always packed! It's a great place to go with just a couple people or a big group. 

Items you must try: C-2 roll, sexy scallop roll, crouching tiger hidden dragon roll, butterfish blasters, double jeapardy... and everythign else!!!

Service is quick, friendly and great. The restaurant is run by a nice japanese lady and her son - at least that is whom I've met so far. I think they've opened up another location that is also doing quite well..

Would recommend this ANY day of the week. Definitely a must-try for sushi restaurants in SF!
author: Liz S.

description:
One of those rare moments where I'm in town on a weekend and I get to enjoy it w/some of my fav ppl. We decided upon sushi bistro!  It's located in a "dead" area of the inner richmond. but was worth it. 

I can't remember exactly what we had here, but it was delish. butterfish nigri was one of them and it was melty melty melty. Don't worry though, whatever you choose, it's going to be fabulous.
author: Lola D.

description:
Went here on a Sat evening.  Boy is this place happening!

Loved the ambiance, the crowds, and the food.

Ordered the

mother in law
sashimi 
 - fatty tuna was like butter in my mouth
 - hamachi
 -halibut
(ALL were excellent), and quite large peices too.

Another roll (forgot the name) with brown rice, which was topped off with some spicy/ponzu sauce.  DELISH!

Service was amazing, and excellent!

Bill came out to be about $80 for two, but with good sushi, I'd pay that any day!

Pleasant experience, and would come back.
author: Ricaa W.

description: God, I love this place. KInd of pricey, but totally worth it. The fish is always fresh and the rolls are super creative. I think I had the hot love, and well, I wanted to make sweet hot love to that roll.
author: Jennifer J.

description:
Took the BF here for his birthday this year.  Big disappointment.  
The fish was old/FISHY tasting, and the rolls were all super bland (except for the old fish taste)
The only thing here that was good was a tofu salad with mango, which was excellent.   But that's not enough to make us come back.  

Fresh Fish might do the trick...
author: Liz A.

description: This is a very Americanized Japanese restaurant. I was expecting a lot since the place appeared fancy and it looked like a full house with even more people waiting to be seated. We made reservations and were seated immediately. Service was very fast, maybe too fast even. We ordered, got our food, and paid the bill within an hour (possibly less). Quickest dinner I have ever had. The sushi was mediocre, nothing special. The charged me $1.50 for tea (free refills, but still). . REALLY?! It was alright but had a weird after taste. Lastly, the prices were a little over what I would pay for their food. I won't be coming back. . on to the next Japanese place!
author: Tiffany P.

description: I've been coming here since I moved to the city in 2008. It is my favorite sushi restaurant, period. The service is amazing, the food is fresh and high quality, the ambiance is perfect, and the price is unbeatable. I love the sashimi and sushi rolls but you HAVE TO TRY some of the regular menu items like the lettuce wraps (Equinox is SO good!!) and stuffed mushrooms. When I go, I always sit at the bar and enjoy a bottle of sake with my food. Spend at least an hour here and soak it allll in!
author: Chae P.

description:
I can't believe I haven't written a review for this place yet.  This is hands down my most favorite sushi spot in the city.  I usually come here if I have something to celebrate or if I want to just have a small get together with a couple of friends who know how to have a good time with sake and sushi.  My favorite appetizer is the Ahi Tower, try it if you love seared tuna with grilled asparagus and zucchini, my two most favorite vegetables!

I'm not sure what their house chardonnay is but I love it.  The ONLY downside to Sushi Bistro is the parking, it's a b!tch but it is so worth driving in circles for.  I believe Dave is the name of the waiter that I always get and he's so nice!  He's been there since the 1st day I fell in love with the place.  Service from everyone gets an A+ from me.  I also love that they moved to a bigger spot a few doors down so now they can accommodate bigger groups.  They really needed the new place 'cause it gets crazy packed.  Make reservations and get there early to find parking!
author: Ivy Z.

description:
Gawwwd, how I wish you could give half stars on yelp. This place should be only getting 3.5 stars.  Yes, yes, the food is outstanding, but service and timing are also factors in my book.  I don't even know what we ordered as I was with quite a large party and I'll eat anything, so I put the ordering up to someone else.

I was fashionably late and don't know how long the girls were waiting before I arrived.  The sushi came within five minutes after ordering it ... before the appetizers.  That was kind of weird.  The appetizers all came out separately too.  

Everything else was good. Food, splitting the check five ways, service, etc.  I definitely want to come back next time I'm out in the Richmond.
author: Jenny W.

description:
So i went here the other night. The atmosphere first of all...is nice, but i don't feel like it's really a sushi place. They were playing reggae for some reason the entire night. Seems a bit out of place if you ask me. The waiter was nice and helpful, but nothing over the top. 

As for the food. Well that was alright too. But if you're coming here for some Nigirizushi. Don't. The way they cut the fish is WAY oversized. and there is barely any rice. Might was well just call it sashimi instead and give me a bowl of rice if you're going to make it like that.

 I discovered Sushi Bistro from yelp of course, seeing all the good reviews i just had to try this place out! Sadly it did not turn out the way i imagine. 

75% of the reason i came here was for the tempura ice cream. Boy was that a let down... All in all this place is decent. A lot of people seem to like this place, but it just wasn't for me.
author: Terry S.

description: Butterfish rolls were delicious!  Excellent sashimi and we had the cold sake Demon Killer which complimented our meal.  Portions are on the smaller side but it makes up for it in quality of the sushi and sashimi.  Would come back!
author: Don C.

description:
This is a pretty good sushi place, and I have gone there several times this fall/winter.  The service is pretty quick and the layout works.  If you go, try the Hot Love as an appetizer.  It's delicious.  Their rolls are pretty unique, the Billie Jean is good and the Sashimi Spirit is great, to name a couple.  
It's a little bit pricey, but not horrific.  The waitstaff leaves a lot to be desired, however, and each and every time I have gone, the first and only smile my party and I get from the server is when they are delivering the check.  Kind of ruins the experience when a rude and very bored looking person is taking your order and delivering your food and leaving you feeling like you put them out in some way.  

Minus the servers, great place for sushi.  I would give 4 stars for everything but the servers.
author: Audrey W.

description: Wonderful salads and rolls priced between $10 and $15. I've been to Sushi Bistro a few times and have never found it overcrowded or had to wait long for my order. The service is immediate and professional. For the price, it is the best sushi in the neighborhood.
author: Nicole S.

description:
I'm very tempted to give this place a 5 star, but I think a couple more visits are needed before I do that.  After living here for almost a year, and continually saying I wanted to try this place (mainly after seeing it on the iPhone commercial and know its close by) my roommate put in a reservation for 6 of us.

We walked over, since parking is a mess in this area and were promptly seated.  This might have been because we were eating at 9pm, but I like not waiting!  Big plus!  The restaurant itself tries to go for like a hip, trendy and almost loungy feel which can be a good or bad thing, depending on your mood.  

Sat down and took a look at the menu.  So many crazy choices and interesting names.  I decided to try the Hot Love which consisted of baby lobster, crab meat and some other stuff baked?  Yum.  I didn't know what to expect from "Something Unique" but it definitely was.  There were two rolls on there so you can't really expect to get full off of it.  I tried some of my other roommates Magic Mushrooms which was also definitely tasty.  I'm a big mushroom fan though, so some people might not like it.  I also went with the Big Island.  It just sounded like a combination of all the right fishes that I like to eat.  Salmon, Tuna, Yellowtail and a few other things, how do they fit it all in a roll!?  No rice, and it was wrapped with a cucumber.  It was refreshing and delicious.  Not completely what I expected, but it was a nice surprise.

The dishes are a bit on the pricey side, so I wouldn't eat here all the time, but I'll be back for more one day (soon?)
author: Tom Y.

description:
Sushi Bistro... 

Damn good Sushi for decent prices. The mahi mahi roll and Dave's Legacy for the Win.

Definitely one of the better sushi places to go to and very affordable as well.  

Sushi Bistro, I will be back

4 Stars maybe a little ways towards 5
author: Jackson P.

description:
Sushi Bistro, you are my #2.  When trying new sushi places I'm definitely impressed my things I've never tried before, good or bad.  I hate only having the stand-bys. They have some really unique rolls, all of which are very good.  I'm pretty sure I had one with strawberries on it.  YUM!  Watermelon man was something I had definitely never tried before. They have a ton of things to choose from.  Its almost overwhelming, but the solve to this?  Bring some friends and order everything.

Really I just love that they use to have a sign in the window that said "sushi & ?"  I'm still not sure what thats supposed to mean, but it definitely makes the sushi taste better.
author: jessica b.

description:
Nice little place with good ambiance and great service.

My girlfriend and I ordered a few vegetarian items and tempora, and the waiter was thoughtful enough to check and see if we really wanted the vegetarian version instead, which of course we did.

Thoughtful service and excellent food will keep us coming back!

Good work guys.
author: Alex Y.

description:
A recent article about Sebo in SF Magazine mentioned when dealing with sashimi, "larger cuts signal a lack of understanding" for how sushi and sashimi is to be prepared.  I get that sense at Sushi Bistro.

While I do appreciate the generosity and thought behind humongous pieces of sashimi (literally 4 inches long and 3 inches wide), I cant help but scoff at it as well.  I didn't really enjoy biting the raw piece of fish numerous times, as the beauty of sashimi is taking it in one bite and letting the favors bloom on your tounge.

Aside from that, I'd say the experience was a solid three stars.  We started off with the butterfish blasters and the miso glazed sea bass.  The sea bass was tough, and had gone down in quality from the last time I had it.  The blasters were fishy and in general had a slop-like consistency, which prompted me to send them back.   However, the older woman server was rather abrupt and somewhat rude when she told me that they refuse to take the dish back.  Later, I spoke with another friendly server-David- about this and he explained to me the small-business mentality behind their refusal which I respect, and subsequently smoothed it over.  My suggestion is maybe the first woman shouldn't be dealing with customers, because her people skills definitely need improvement.  

The edamame was a bit overcooked and soggy.  We also had the albacore dream roll which was excellent, and my boyfriend enjoyed his tempura and sushi roll (forget the name) very much.  David took care of some mochi ice cream for us to make up for the blasters incident, which we both appreciated.

"This may work out here near USF, but this shit wouldn't fly downtown" - was how my boyfriend summed up our experience, and I have to agree.
author: Genevieve M.

description:
One of my favorite Sushi Places!!!

*Great Fresh Sushi & Sashimi
*Unique & Creative Non-Traditional Sushi Rolls
*Cozy & simple ambiance
*Clean
*Recommendation:
Poke Tuna, All their Sashimi especially Butterfish, New Legend Roll, Sashimi Spirit, & Stinky Salmon

Tip: Even with a reservation there's a wait, this place is always packed
       Parking is scarce in this area
author: Christina D.

description: My boyfriend dragged me here to eat dinner a few weeks ago and I am in love. There's always a wait but the food is worth it. We sat at the bar and the bartender is super friendly. Everyone should try the hot love roll. it is delish.
author: Joanna S.

description:
I've been waiting for so long to try Sushi Bistro after reading all the good reviews from Yelp.  Finally I went there last Saturday but it turned out a disappointment.......

We have ordered:
