Don't let the word Bistro scare you. This is Sushi the way sushi should be.... I think i know where i'm going to dinner tonight!! :)
author: James E.

description:
This restaurant serves up some tasty sushi. They have a little of everything to suit your needs. They offer old favorites - Caterpillar roll, Rainbow roll and California roll. They have funky new creations - Big Island (salmon, tuna, yellow tail), Nemo Found (salmon/unagi), and Crouching Tiger Hidden Dragon (shrimp tempura/eel). These rolls were innovative and the flavors were running crazy. I usually don't like to eat too much raw fish but I was wolfing these rolls down.
No wasabi or soy sauce necessary - the rolls were good all natural. I really enjoyed the having rolls with a glass of cold beer.

The restaurant is small and there is limited seating. But a small group of 4 were able to get a table without reservations before 7PM. The place quickly filled up for dinner after 7PM on a weeknight. The server was friendly and provided quick service. This is a good restaurant to be adventurous.
author: Candace F.

description:
So this is The Richmond?!?

In an effort to dine in uncharted territory, we had dinner here last night.  Luckily, we called ahead for a res as this place was packed.  We sat at the sushi bar which provided me with an excellent view to watch the sushi chef do his thing.

They have a lot of creative/inventive/uncommon rolls here which I really liked.  I particularly enjoyed the Black Weeds,  the Spicy Crunchy and the Albacore Dream.  However, the apple in the Hawaiian Breeze kept throwing me off.  But, all in all, this was some great sushi and it seems my first dinner experience in the Richmond will not be my last!!!!
author: Jeff P.

description:
One star off the bat for having a memorable logo.  I didn't think I've been the place before but once I saw the logo, I KNEW it wasn't my first visit.  But if you ask me when and with whom that first visit was, I would not be able to tell you.  

We had reservations for 6 at 8:30 but did not get seated until about 1/2 hour later and we were not late!  Not cool.

Jalapenos on sushi is ingenious.  Loved it.  However, I am usually all over the Hamachi Kama but it was a tad overcooked.

In any case, I want to give this place more than 3 stars but boo to the service and overcooked hamachi.  Everything else was fantabulous and I would def go back.
author: Yve T.

description:
ohmygodohmygodohmygod. This place was so good I found myself day dreaming about the rolls at work. **That was a first for me**. I really liked the Hawaiian Breeze, it was so fresh and light and tasty. Great ahi sashimi, very clean, fresh and cold.

We ordered about 6 different rolls for our group of 5, they came out quickly, each one with a unique flavor. All of them very good. I will definitely be back.

Small dining room, so get there early and/or make a reservation. Or do like we did, have your friend that lives a block away go 15 minutes before the rest of the group can get there and grab a table. Thanks Sara :)
author: Suzanne S.

description:
yes yes oh my god yes!

Everything is so good here.  The sashimi platter is not expensive and the chef cuts you fish the size of texas.  so fresh, too.  Try all their weird rolls, they are never too fusion that you wonder what you're eating.  There are many that are subtle, delicious, and unique.  My favorites: C2, Big Island.  Always order from the special fish menu.  they have ASAHI BLACK!  Their Poke has some unique sauce, and delicious salad.

Avoid their combo cooked platters.  Just eat the sushi.  Soon, you'll be in heaven.
author: Derek L.

description:
In every occasion that I've dined at this fine supplier of seafood crack, I never fail to overeat myself into an ironic obesity.  To be honest, I probably have enough mercury in me from this place to exude a radiant red glow if I'm walking in the sun.  

To put it simply:  Best Sushi Ever.  It will literally give you a one-two punch in flavor with every bite.  In fact, if Jesus were food, this just might be what he'd taste like.

To be clear, though, it's not a hole in the wall where an old asian couple will silently serve you the finest fish cut in thousand year old methods of sashimi mastery, I'd even call it fusion.  The rolls contain varieties of fried ingredients, tobasco sauces, different flavors of special sushi "mayoinase", and other satiations I can't even identify, I just sure as hell know they ain't from Japan.  

Not that I'm complaining, it's the very combinations of these unique flavors that define them.  Here's to you, 30 minutes of parking and 20 minutes of waiting for 10 pounds of eating. 

Cheers, Bistro, cheers.
author: D L.

description:
Do you ever go to a restaurant only to realize you've been TIVOing too many episodes of Top Chef? When I start saying things like, "i just love the combination of flavors- the texture and presentation really complete the meal" it's time to put down the remote control. 

But in all seriousness, this is EXACTLY how I felt about Sushi Bistro. I love that it's completely unassuming. You walk in expecting a mediocre sushi meal at best only to find out it's a hot bed of culinary creativity. 

Try the Watermelon-Man roll. You'll end up licking the sauce off the plate- true story. Not that I did that or anything- swear.
author: Marjorie P.

description: i tried this place just the other day it was nothing really special. this place is pretty hyped up like its the est sushi in the city. The portions are tiny. Even the take out sushi at costco comes bigger than the sushi rolls here. My favorite thing to order a sushi joints is hamachi kama but the one served here sucks. It was dry and that just killed it. Will i come back maybe not because there are plenty of other real good sushi joints in the city
author: Art N.

description:
This is the sushi place that I go to when I want have some contemporary Japanese unlike authentic traditional style.

Most of all, 

their AHI TUNA POKE SPECIAL blew me away!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

I would even come back just for that. It's worth to  try.
And you'll have a good time here.

Kanpa-i. :-)
author: Masa O.

description: As good as it gets, I am vegetarian and not a sushi person but I love the cucumber rolls.
author: Vibrant J.

description:
This is the BEST Sushi place in San Francisco.  People complain that it's out in Richmond, but believe me, you won't find anything better.  It's better than both Sushi Grooves, Blowfish, Zushi Puzzle - you name it.

The sushi chef(Sheen) is just awesome - he's personable, sparks conversation, and just takes his sushi and customers very seriously. 

My fiance and I have been going for over 4 years to Sushi Bistro so here are our highlights:

Yellow tail Basil (if you like unagi with a spicy kick, this is the best)
Big Island (this is incredible; he basically cuts a cucumber and then fills all types of sashimi in the middle)
Spicy Scallop

Even the basics are amazing - California Roll, Spicy Tuna.

Unlike other sushi places - they give more fish - not just carb it up with rice.  Sashimi is top notch too.

To add to the experience, they give you right when you walk in a light cucumber vinegar dish and then at the end they give you a little bit of the "ice cream of the day" - usually it's green tea, coconut, or mango.

If you're vegetarian(which make sushi difficult) - this place has tons of vegetarian options! so don't be scared!
author: Somrat N.

description: Best sushi EVER. PERIOD. END OF STORY.
author: Tony K.

description:
***FIRST OFF, THEY TAKE RESERVATIONS*** Trust me, you'll need it. Waiting outside in 40 degree weather ain't no joke! Lol

We were prompted to Sushi Bistro by the fabulous community of Yelpers! Boy, did they hit the nail on the head with this one. Although parking was a bizzatCh, and the wait was..yup..long but worth every grueling-mouthwatering-minute. Oh BUT while you wait for a table they have sake, on tap! =) Yeah, right? 

So we ordered a few rolls, hand rolls, sashimi, miso soup, sake, beer.. All I have to say is "BUTTER BLASTER: O-M-F-G. . . Dont play, bring me more. Now." lol.. While it is composed mainly of fish the explosive buttery sensation on many different levels..from the butter fish, crab meat, and the avocado..made it almost a guilty pleasure. Pure orgasmic elevation.

We also had the miso which you can skip..You aren't missing out on much. Trust me. 

The Big Island is something interesting to try. Its has salmon, tuna, yellowtail, tobiko, and snow crab meat which is all held together by a thinly sliced cucumber. Its such a nice, refreshing surprise to the normal seaweed wrapped roll. 

Yum,Yum,Yum. Come with good company and an empty tummy. 
 In the words of the Terminator, "I'll be back". Very soon. =) Enjoy!
author: Food Critic C.

description:
I usually opt for the Beef Teriyaki and Tempura dinner combination. The dinner combinations include salad (or steamed vegetables), soup, and rice. The sushi and sashimi are excellent. The sashimi pieces are large, when compared to other sushi restaurants. 

I consider the meals to be well priced. For example, the Beef Teriyaki and Tempura dinner combination is about $14. A 12 piece sashimi combination is about $17. I hope that they do not change the pricing. 

The restaurant is well decorated, and dimly lit. As for the staff, they have always been cordial and prompt.

This is my favorite sushi restaurant in all of San Francisco. 

However, parking is terribly scarce...
author: A B.

description:
This is the best sushi place on Earth. Less rice, more fish. Fresh fish, creative rolls, friendly staff, great service. This restaurant is a true sushi benchmark. We go there almost every week ever since they were open in the old location few doors down the street. It's been a few years and we keep coming back. With friends and family. We bring our out of town guests here and everyone is wowed by mind-blowing quality of this establishment.  Hell, we even take sushi non-eaters and convert them:) 

Once in a blue moon we venture out to try new sushi joint, just for giggles. Alas, all pale in comparison. Kudos to Sushi Bistro owners, chefs and staff for their professionalism. We love you guys.

Must haves: everything on their specials list  is super good. Even oysters are great. 

C2 roll - out of this world goodness.
Billie Jean - another roll for baby lobster fans
Big Island - you've never tried sushi this fresh;)

Both locations are great. Try it, you'll be blown away.
author: Andre D.

description: Not the place for traditional rolls and nigiri, but for fusion and richly designed rolls and dishes, this place will rock your world. I have to be careful not to get too many rich dishes as it is easy to leave feeling a little over indulged. The family that owns this place is a mom and son team who really are culinary/fusion creative geniuses. You will get things here that no one else could even try to replicate at a sushi restaurant.
author: Jordan P.

description:
This was very good sushi with amazing heaping portions.
Unfortunately after they recently moved to their nicer bigger spot, the food seems to have gone downhill.
Quality of the sushi is definitely not the same.  Now, it's big portions of mediocre stuff which isn't my thing.
author: Ric S.

description: Tasty dishes. A little over priced in my opinion. Dishes are somewhat small.
author: Alex L.

description:
My favorite restaurant in the city by far. This sushi gem which just relocated a couple doors down is a great restaurant to get the freshest and most unique rolls ever.  I go in and don't even need a menu anymore. Things use MUST try are: Butterfish Blaster, African Spider, Ahi Poke Speacial, Double Jeopardy. 

Once you get there you'll be greeted by David who when I first started going did everything by himself host, bus, and serve. Now he still helps everywhere but he has a few others to help. Make reservations when you go in because it is always crowed because the word is out. 

The rolls here are very satisfying because they come larger than normal and don't skip out on the good stuff from snow crab to the butterfish. And the sashimi is very generous sizes. Swing by and enjoy excellence.
author: Nathan H.

description:
worst sushi i have ever tasted, period!
not hating. simply telling you the truth by all means. 
presentation is all nice but where did the taste of it go?
overpriced garbage but very pleased with the service.
author: Taffy T.

description:
Sushi Bistro has a wide selection of fresh and creative sushi rolls.  It's a fun place to eat with a lively decor.  One of my favorite rolls is M&L Forever.  Their chicken teriyaki entree was good though I prefer to have their sushi. 

I give it an extra star because of the great service.  We received the wrong roll and the server gave us have the option to keep it, after we got the right roll.

Cons:  Parking is difficult and there's usually a wait on the weekends.
author: Jeannine L.

description: I came to this place for my cousins birthday, the food was good but and this is a big BUT. I ordered my self an order of Toro Nigiri along with other sushi, everything came except the Toro. After I decided to ask the waiter where is the nigiri i ordered and he replied with I already brought it. I was confused since I never received it, after which he said is was brought along with other nigiri that was ordered on the other end of the table. Now I might be going a little too far but when a person orders something at a restaurant aren't they supposed to bring it to me or someone sitting at the other end of the table?. I told the waiter to bring me another order since he F up and he raised his voice at me and became rude saying It's not my fault and you have to pay for it again. Honestly this place is good enough for me to have been a repeat customer for many years, but they chose not to stand behind their mistakes and to take care of a customer.
author: Vlad M.

description: Great sushi rolls and speedy service!  Nice ambiance.  My only complaint is that you can get pretty good sushi in SF for much cheaper, and sometimes I like a more authentic experience when I go for sushi.  Great for out of towners who want something ritzy and don't mind being spendy.  Students.... not so much
author: Rachael F.

description:
This used to be a favorite neighborhood jaunt of mine, but now I commute.  No sushi restaurant even comes close.  It's a great deal, the owners are friendly, and they can practically order for us.  They have some of the finest fish I've ever had.  

Ocean Trout Nigiri---YUM
49'er
shiro maguro w/shiso 
Albacore dream
spicy crunchy
miso black cod
...they have so many different rolls they surely have something for everyone.

It's small, unpretentious, and unassuming.  No obnoxious social scene.  It's almost like having sushi at a friend's house. 

Do it.
author: Erinn B.

description:
So I was drunk when I got here and may have to amend my review (more stars? less stars?) after I go back.  The seaweed salad was a large portion and I liked the different rolls. We had some sort of spicy yellotail roll, great flavor and the spicy girl which I think was tuna with this spicy sauce and mayonaisy miso sauce.

We did have a roll that was really greasy and had a weird aftertaste.  Unfortunatley I dont remember what it was callled...
author: b s.

description:
I LOVE this place for reasonably priced sushi and good quality fish.  They give you more fish than rice when it comes to nigiri.  They are very consitent in quality and service.

I only subtracted on star because I don't like that they serve shrimp chips with some of their appetizer dishes.  And their salmon skin on their salmon skin salad is undercooked and not crunchy.

EVERYTHING ELSE is pure DELIGHT!
author: Sweet Mother of Mary O.

description:
I hate sushi but this place is so good I don't even realize it.  They do a good job of making everyone happy, from the extreme raw fish eating, eel slurping, octopus gobbling sushi-pros  to the gringo tempura shrimp and cooked salmon people like me.  Either way, everything is delicious and again, they have great options for some tamer taste buds.

The only downside is trying to find a place to park and waiting for a table.
author: Brian N.

description:
Beautiful, fun sushi plates--but this place is a bit OVERRATED, and NOT for "traditional" sushi lovers. 

They're pretty experimental here... e.g. fuji apple or mango added to some of their rolls. The flavors were delicious, fun, and creative, but the dishes are pricy for what you get. I found myself having to order more and more food (I was still hungry after three dishes!)

And make a reservation if you can, because the seating is limited. Parking's difficult in the area, too.
author: J K.

description:
Ever since my roomate showed me here 2 months ago I have been a half dozen times. The rolls are creative, fun and of generous proportion and I have not had one I didnt care for.

I have not gone one time without ordering the poki, it is so delicious I would choose it as my #1 poki destination in san francisco. Also the fish is so darn fresh that you would be crazy not to get some sashimi.

It is always busy so be prepared to wait, but the co-owner/server/sake somalier Dave is happy to bring you an Asahi in the bottle while you stand and wait. Parking does stink, but hey its San Francisco, we're used to it.
author: Tom V.

description:
I've had my Yelp acct since Jan '07 and I've never commented on anything...cause there was never a place that just wowed or disgusted me in a way that I had to write about it...Until today...so bare with me in the length!  Be nice, it's my first review! 

A client recommended this place yesterday...as she was getting her hair shampooed...just raving about how good it was but I was still skeptical.  But as the day grew on, I realized that the name rang a bell  and I once read about how good this place was/is since I was craving GOOD sushi when I moved to CA...but come on?! Who doesn't say that it's the BEST sushi, sashimi, I've ever tasted? Blah blah blah etc...

Anyway, I decided to try it and was fortunate to beat the rush but parking was a pain in the a**!  If you don't like waiting...too bad...this place gets packed!  So if you're lucky, they'll be seats at the bar...if not, the wait is DEFINITELY worth it!  

Born and raised in HI, I'm used to having FRESH and delicious sushi and sashimi.  After last night, I won't have to pay for another over priced plane ticket just cause I miss sushi and sashimi!  Sushi Bistro reminds me of home.  Their dishes are unique and a little alarming...Some of the sushi combos, ie: fish with apple relish, etc intrigued me but also worried me as I tried to envision the taste...I definitely felt over whelmed on what to eat.  So I played it safe and ordered one dish at a time.  

Luckily, the wait help is super friendly and they didn't make me feel unwelcome for being so indecisive like some other restaurants do.  

My boyfriend and I started with a safe one...CROUCHING TIGER HIDDEN DRAGON.  As soon as it arrived, he inhaled 3...I was still getting my wasabi ready when I looked up and saw that he was almost through with the entire roll.  I had to actually tell him to slow down!  

The roll was so fresh that I swear, the shrimp and unagi was probably still alive when they were preparing it...not like the frozen shrimp or packaged eel...we definitely didn't waste any time order our next few rolls, SPICY CRUNCHY, RED DEVIL, and RAGIN' CAJUNS...and my comfort roll, the Philly. 

The fishes were all so fresh that it didn't even taste like fish!  I'm sure you've encountered smelly old fish...that smell sort of ok, looks great but taste like fish oil!!!  NOT HERE!  Also, they know how to cut fish!  I didn't have any chewy pieces...I hate it when places buy good fish and f**k it up cause their sushi chefs don't know how to slice fish.

Give it a try and just order away, cause I'm sure any rolls or sashimi from Sushi Bistro will blow your underwear off...if you're wearing any.

BTW..it was 4 out of 5 stars cause I wish they gave more for the price...but it was still worth every penny.
author: sonja t.

description:
My first Yelp!
And as I went through my mental rolodex to think who to add, SB came to the top of my list 'cause they're on top of their game!  Such a tucked away little find in a back SF neighborhood, with epic restaurants all around, but this stands out for it's contemporary downtempo tunes, hip young staff, and of course the phenomenal grind!  Don't miss the lettuce wraps : inventive and bargain priced; and the rolls are all delicious and fresh!  Enjoy!
author: Will T.

description:
HANDS DOWN!  Best sushi in the city.  Always fresh, always unique and never overpacked with unnecessary ingredients or too much rice (which just fills you up..blah)!  Great sake selection and awesome atmosphere!

It's a small place...so I recommend calling in for a reservation (especially if there is more than 2 in your party)
author: Farran T.

description:
It's very hard to imagine a place like this can exist in the Richmond District in San Francisco.  I am amazed that a resaturant like this can make it here.  This restaurant looks like it belongs in either the Marina or in the trendy part of the mission district.  

If you are going to go all out and be different, then why not change the way you eat Japanese food.  I have been taught to eat sushi a certain way.  You take the sushi and place the whole piece in your mouth.  With these nigiris or sashimis...............it is very difficult to put the whole thing in your mouth unless you are a working girl.  j/k.  These pieces are ginormous.  Size really matter.....which really makes this place stand out.  If you are going to be paying this kinda money...........why not give the consumers a bigger slice.  I have been to restaurants where the slices are huge but the quality of the sushi is terrible.  I thought I would feel the same way about this place but I was absolutely wrong.  The servers were prompt, the water was always refilled, the pickles and gingers were always replaced, the wait was short, the food was great.........it really deserves a 5 star rating.  

My friend Dom recommended me this place and this is honestly the first time he has ever .........and I mean ever.....taken me to a restaurant that was fantastic.  So............I will have to post his pic on my profile to allow you guys to see how great this guy is. 

Keep it up Sushi Bistro!!! DOM d.........Thanks
author: jason g.

description:
Great sushi spot with an appealing menu.  I'm more of a roll guy but I enjoyed the sashimi and nigiri more.  Generous portions of the hamachi belly and albacore belly were a pleasant surprise and it was fresh.  The rolls were super creative but didn't live up to the hype.  Only reason I didn't give it five stars.  Atmosphere and decor were superb.  A solid place for both a date or large group.  The staff was also very good.  Friendly, attentive, down-to-earth.

But the surprising and almost best part was the bill.  We went off on Valentine's Day, ordering tons of sake, rolls, sashimi, and nigiri and the bill for two was only $97.
author: boner time j.

description: Holy moly guacamole. This is the best not-really-japanese-not-really-japanese-i-really-think-so (get it?) sushi EVER. Meaning, one roll has salsa, one has basil and tomato sauce, one has cilantro pesto, one has baked lobster, and there is something called a caucasian afro. It's like a guilty pleasure, and I just cannot resist. Please go try it. And get the double jeopardy and the shrimp tempura lettuce wrap.
author: Marie Y.

description:
About a year ago, my neighbor took me to dinner at the Sushi Bistro.  I was blown away by the artistic artistry of the menu, along with the phenomenal flavor of the dishes.  Their sushi combinations are unique and stunning in presentation, delish to devour.  

It's a bit tight as far as restaurants go, but which restaurants here in the City aren't?  As loud and busy as Blowfish Sushi sans anime, it's a great social dining experience.   I can't WAIT to take my boyfriend!!!
author: Lani P.

description:
First Yelp review! You made me do it !!

"I'll be right with you" was what she should've said instead of ignoring us for 5 minutes. Hello, I'm only standing right in front of you. 

The miso soup didn't have enough taste. How do you mess that up? It's miso paste and hot water.  I make better miso soup from the box of paste I buy from the supermarkets.  My friend thought the same, but we didn't mind.

Not sure how the food tasted because I basically swallowed my meal in 3 minutes.  Why? Because I wanted 30 minutes for my food, and they gave me my order 15 minutes after all three of my friends got theirs.  They were practically done eating by the time I got mine..  "Sorry for the wait" was what they should've said.  I'm not asking them to kiss my feet, but I just wanted them to acknowledge their mistake.  Then he handed me the plate. Oh, I mistakenly thought he was the waiter and thought his job was to put food on my table, not hand me the huge plate of food that I waited 15 minutes for while staring at my friends eat.  Oh and the girls next to me who came in 10 minutes after me had food on their table.  But but but.. I'm starving over here. They don't look that hungry. =(

"Your sushi?" No sir, not ours.  He repeated the sushi name.  No, it's out ours.  He repeated the sushi name. No, I ordered the HAWAIIAN BREEZE. "Ok." Then another guy walks out and asks me the same question..... But I just told the other guy three times that it wasn't mine...

Eh, I don't know.  I've never in my life waited 30 minutes for sushi or a dinner combination box before, and I've been to my fair share of sushi houses. 
Food wasn't that great.  Sushi wasn't that great. The hostess was nice, but I can't eat her.  I didn't mind being ignore for a bit when I came in.  I didn't find the tasteless miso soup. I didn't mind that my meal took so long to come. I didn't mind that my meal came 15 minutes after all my friends' orders came.  I didn't mind the guy handing me the huge plate of food instead of placing it on the table I didn't mind swallowing my meal in 5 minutes (though my tummy might've). I didn't mind them forgetting my sushi and insisting on giving me the wrong one.  I didn't mind it happened once more again after it just happened. BUT I did mind that they did not once apologize for any of this.  A simple sorry would've changed my frustration.  "Sorry for the wait."

Would I come back? I don't think my wallet would want me paying for this type of service or food.
author: J H.

description: Food was awesome! Presentation was magnificent! I shall be back for more!
author: Michelle T.

description: I was getting tired of sushi but after coming here, I'm excited about sushi again. They had a lot of different types of specialty rolls that tasted great! Parking was terrible, we had to circle around forever. Wait wasn't bad though. Only about 5 mins on a Sat night for the bar.
author: Tiff W.

description: Was the sushi as "authentic" as can be? Nahhh, but the rolls tasted good and the service is awesome! Things ordered: Ahi tuna poke (the fish is fresh, plump, and tasty and the salad and fried thingies that the tuna sits on is yum), hamachi kama (very meaty and tender) "Crouching Tiger Hidden Dragon" roll (basic ingredients but I'm a sucker for unagi, avocado and shrimp tempura *shrug*... pretty much a dragon roll) and "Monster In-Laws" roll (the fresh sliced jalapenos on top were a nice touch, much more "ZING!" than the pickled jalapenos I was expecting to see). Server was incredibly attentive, dirty dishes were cleared IMMEDIATELY (I almost didn't notice that they were being taken away), and my water was refilled at least 3-4 times, which in my book is worthy of 5 stars for the OVERALL EXPERIENCE. Kinda pricey, but I leave satisfied every time I stop in here. My only true gripe is that you may have to circle the blocks a few times to find parking, but other than that I really can't complain and I can see myself being a regular at this cute stylish little joint. If you REAAAALLY want "authentic" Japanese food this place probably isn't for you, but that's cool because it just means a shorter wait to get a table for me :)
author: Stephanie M.

description: tasty, but pricey.  Original ideas for sushi that i've never had before, and most of it was pretty good, although i didn't enjoy the 'omega 3' roll.  Service was very attentive, almost too much so.  The instant a plate was finished it was whisked away.  Amanda felt like they were constantly hovering.  Still, some of the best fish I've had in the area so far.
author: Phil J.

description:
Sushi Bistro is my favorite sushi restaurant!

The atmosphere is very serene and romantic. The place itself is pretty small considering it's always busy. However, the service is fast and friendly! 

The food is amazing. I love how they have a variety of sushi, including rolls that have fruit in them (very original in my opinion). I love how this place is close to my apartment and school and the prices are very reasonable.

TRY THIS PLACE OUT, asap. I highly recommend it.
author: Hillary M.

description:
I'm giving Sushi Bistro 3.5 stars, so I guess I'll round it up. 

The Pros:
The fish is fresh, the slices are generous, the rice is pretty good, friendly service, good selection of seasonal fish, and the sake list is not bad.
The Cons:
Almost everything from the kitchen is not good.  Age- Dashi Tofu (No flakes), Miso- glazed Sea Bass (Dried), and Grilled Hamachi Kama (Taste like they fried it) are some of the worst things on the menu.

I guess if you are into special rolls and spicy sauce then this is place is totally for you. I like the sushi selection and sake selection there, but the kitchen food needs to be better if I was go be a regular.
author: Mojo L.

description: The rolls are really good but it is expensive. I guess we could have ordered less expensive rolls. I think we got the C-2, African Spider, and Billie Jean. The rolls aren't too rice-heavy so you receive a good helping of fish, which is great.
author: m t.

description: They are very creative in their rolls but the fishes are not that fresh. I think the most important thing for Japanese food is freshness so I give them a 2 stars. I will not go again.
author: Gina L.

description:
I have lived only two blocks from this place for the last year and a half and can't believe what I have been missing this whole time. It is incredible. The fish is fresh. The chef Steve is a very dedicated person. We were seated at the bar and had the pleasure of watching the master at work. Everything we ordered was excellent. The service was great even though it was packed and a Saturday night. 
I have to agree with Sonia C. about the baby lobster rolls. They are great!!!!!!!!

This will easily become my weekly destination as long as live in s.f.
author: mekuria g.

description:
This place is horrible, never ever go there..... OK I'm a big fat liar, that was just a ploy to make it easier for me to get a table!  If you do not make a reservation you will wait a while for a table.  And since there isn't much room to wait inside you might end up outside in the cold waiting for an hour.  You have been warned!
This is my favorite sushi place!  Very friendly staff, quick service, fresh fresh fish, and a fantastic deal   I always get the sashimi bowl or platter and I've been very satisfied every time.  The fish is very fresh and yummy.   There rolls are very unique and tasty.
author: Rebecca T.

description:
On a cold fall night some friends and I went to Sushi Bistro to change things up a bit (we have a handful of sushi restaurants that we frequently visit).  We were very excited to experience a mouth-full of flavor in every roll we ordered.  Although my chicken teriyaki plate didn't live up to the standard of their sushi.  The chick was over cooked.  It had a sprinkling of pepper on it and a drizzling of teriyaki sauce.  Neither of which could remedy the chicken jerky.  

Moral of the story, go for the sushi and pass on the entrees.  

PS: Sushi Bistro offers hand rolls or sliced rolls, the hand rolls are very cheap but quite difficult to eat, where as the slicked rolls have a premium price but they are much easier to woof down)
author: Jonathan G.

description:
I like their sushi.  The rolls are not ginormous like the one's at Joy's Sushi, but I like their unique flavors.

I ordered the hidden dragon, crouching tiger, Omega 3, Iron Punch and a 49ner roll. Very, very good.

I like the atmosphere and the service is good. The people there are nice and friendly.  Only bad thing about this place is the parking. Overall, great place to get a bite.
author: A L.

description:
This place is just awesome. 
Absolutely great food, small fun place with good tunes playing and some nice scenery. 
Very unique menu with some very unique sake's to go with it.  
Good times, nice place and I will be back. 

Its small so be prepared to wait a bit.
author: Tim K.

description:
This is the best sushi I've found in the city so far. I've eaten there 3 times and have been extremely satisfied every time. The first time was for my birthday and we found the place from yelp. Now I'm returning the favor for having such a great birthday night.

I've had probably half of the signature gourmet sushi rolls which seem very creative combining ingredients I never would have thought went well together. Mango with sushi is amazing! That was the Hawaiian Breeze signature roll. 

Every time I've gotten sashimi, it was the freshest fish I've ever had and the largest portions I've ever seen--well I'm from the mountains of North Carolina originally so I'm not use to fresh fish...but this was amazing! I tried butterfish for the first time last time and it was delicious! I'm always a sucker for the Caterpillar, Dragon, Rainbow, Philadelphia classic rolls too. This is now my sushi place I will go to regularly. thanks!
author: Caroline F.

description:
I came here last weekend with my boyfriend for dinner before prom and the food was GOOOOOD. We're usually really picky about sushi places but we came across this on Yelp and decided to try it out. We ordered 3 things and some sorta of green tea. The green tea wasn't all that great. My boyfriend added about 4 packets of sugar for it to have some taste. 
However, the Hot Love was delicious. Our favorite dish for the night. It came with only 2 pieces but it was worth it. The African spider and M&L Forever weren't that bad either.
author: Michelle F.

description:
I love this place.  I lived in Tokyo for over a year, and while this is not authentic Japanese food, Sushi Bistro puts their own twist on how to make great  American Sushi.   The specialty rolls in lettuce cups are amazing, you'll have sauce all over your face by the time you finish mauling it.   The most important thing in a great Japanese restaurant is having fresh fish, and Sushi Bistro does not disappoint.

Yes the place is crowded, but that's b/c it's so great.  Cool scene as well.
author: Dave L.

description:
Oh Sushi B! What delicious Toro you have.

Admittedly, I'm NOT Japanese, nor have I ever been to Japan, but I know what I like, and I like the sushi at Sushi Bistro. Especially the Watermelon Man roll.

Do yourself a favor and get there early or make a reservation. The place is small and it gets packed even during the week.
author: Dan W.

description: Came here yesterday with my boyfriend for the first time . We had the toro nigiri , yellowtail belly nigiri , and king salmon nigiri which were both very fresh and yummy . The sashimi on the rice was nice and long unlike some cheap places that try to rip you off . The ankimo was alright , but not creamy enough for me . The miso soup was alright . The Y.T. Jalapeno was good ... the sashimi was cut kind of thick ... very juicy and yummy . The nemo found roll was alright but the sauce got kind of tiring . The spicy crunchy roll also tasted alright . I expected the waikiki to taste kind of disgusting but it didn't ! It actually wasn't that bad... in fact , it tasted kind of interesting with the mango . Kinda pricey though ... the bill came up to be around $88 .
author: Eileen L.

description:
damn fresh.  and great fish to rice ratio on the nigiri.   the rolls were good,  but all the reading you need to do to figure out what's in them can get quite frustrating, especially when you're hungry.   so can ordering them by their ridiculous names- must i utter  rootie tootie fresh and fruity, or whatever it was that we got?  uni was TO DIE FOR.  I'll be going back just for that. 

the loud drunk patrons throwing back sake bombs to our left and right was also death inspiring, but not in a good way. and eager diners staring you down while they're waiting for a table was no fun.  And a $15 corkage fee was really no picnic either. But i'm going back for their albacore, kanpachi, and especially their uni.  like tomorrow.  cause they take AMEX too.  but next time i cab it, cause there's no parking anywhere... which makes me very happy they'll be opening a second location on 24th. can't wait.
author: Nikki F.

description: I forgot how ginormous the pieces of Nigiri are at this place! You get these monster sized slabs but with a teeny mound of rice. I really wish they would make the rice portion equal to the giant slab of melt in your mouth fish. The amount of food you get for the price is really awesome, when compared to other places. They moved their location down a few doors from their other location and I do like the slightly larger space and the updated decor. Parking always sucks here so be prepared to drive in circles for a while.
author: Lisa J.

description:
My fiancé and I LOVE this place ... it is our favorite sushi restaurant, not only in San Francisco, but in the country!

I have lived in sushi laden Malibu & trendy Las Vegas .. and have traveled, ahem ate my way through, Asia .. and Sushi Bistro cannot be missed!
author: Bridget W.

description:
This place was well worth the drive and I suggest reservations!! 

Rarely do I find a sushi place that doesn't offer up just 6 or 7 signature rolls and then sticks to the usuals: raider roll, niner roll, spider roll, rock n roll etc. Sushi Bistro had over 30 unique rolls that all sounded amazing.

Do not miss the butterfish blasters, this changed my life and led to chopstick sword fights over the last two. By far one of the best pieces of fish and sushi i've had, EVER! 

The only reason one star was knocked off is we got ballsy and tried the yellowtail basil roll, thinking it might be a fun twist. Unfortunately, the fish looked more like chopped meat and tasted very fishy. We had one each and we both found it inedible. 

A must try for any fish foodie
author: Lizzie S.

description:
30 min wait on a packed thurs nite, not bad.

the sexy scallop roll was almost flavorless.
the monster-in-law was good.  i am a big fan of ponzu sauce, but perhaps the jalapeno was a bit too much.  basically dip a jalapeno in ponzu, and there u go.  smaller and less pepper woulda been better.
the waikiki (unagi) roll was ok.  i love unagi, but tonite it was very crumbly, quickly dissolves in ur mouth.

the rolls were on the soft and mushy side, imo...

salmon sashimi was different.  each piece was iphone-size, no joke.
beautiful to look at , but perhaps too buttery, as it left a slimy aftertaste.

edamame was overcooked.

now i dunno if the bartender was new to the job, and looked a little peeved that we didnt want drinks.  he seemed bored, didnt know wat to do at times.  often, u'd get the feeling he was staring at ur plates, waiting for the last piece to be taken, then quickly take the plate away.  we're at the bar watching tv, and we can sense he's trying to make eye contact.  just an ackward bar scenario.  o_0
author: Ethan L.

description: Are you kidding? This is one of the most highly rated sushi places in the city? Their rolls were so gross I swear I will not go back, ever again. Way too much mayonnaise, way too overpriced, and way too much of a disappointment. I've only been once, so please take this review with a grain of salt, but I definitely did not enjoy the food.
author: Michelle G.

description:
I'm not an expert or a foodie, but I do know that sushi rolls should not taste like they are filled with chicken of the sea. Not everything at SB was a disaster, but I have no idea why with at least 4 other sushi places within 2 blocks on balboa, this one manages to stay in business and was actually busy at 9 on a Thursday. The Other perplexing thing is how in the world this place boasts Michelin and yelp recommendations. Citysearch I get- they're clearly paying to be highly rated, but really yelpers- I expect better recommendations or was I just here on an off night? 
So as other reviewers note, the prices are reasonable- for fresh and delicious sushi, which sadly this was not. We had four rolls and all of them tasted the same- like tuna fish - even the ones with no tuna. Seriously, I've had grocery store take out that was better quality. 
They only had 2 brands of unfiltered sake, but the aladdin was good and came in a cute little pink bottle. 
Miso was bland. Complemetary cucumber salad was tasty. 
Sashimi and nigiri were ok, we had scallops, naguro, hamachi, and one other recommended by one of the 5 or so servers that we waited for- oops I mean waited on us. The table was not bussed to clear old plates to make room for fresh ones and we waited 20 minutes to get our check and sign our tabs. I would have given SB one star, but I figure a place this bad deserves some credit for not making anyone physically ill.
author: Meghan O.

description: I used to love this place but don't go anymore.  It is a good value and the pieces are huge, but I think they freeze the fish as it is always mushy.
author: J D.

description: By far best sushi I've had in town. It's reasonably priced and the rolls are larger than most places I've gone. Definitely some interesting flavors, which is what I like. First Crush, Red Devil, and Spicey Crunchy are my favorites. It's for sure my go-to spot for sushi in town.
author: Keegan M.

description:
"Sushi" says I.  "Kabuto" says he.  "No" says I.  "Sushi Bistro" says I.
Nothing like getting the last word.

In this contemporary, hipsterish, darkened, lounge-like restaurant, you can expect to find.... How shall I put it? Cutting-edge, trendy, Haute Couture sushi? Or as Rayfil W. puts it, "neo-sushi". I wasn't expecting this type of sushi after a few long days of being locked up in hotel conference rooms for a conference. I was looking for comfort sushi. 

The names of the sushi are original, some movie titles like "Finding Nemo", "Crouching Tiger Hidden Dragon" which came as a long roll aligned like fence posts on a white oblong platter. The inside shrimp was crispy and underneath the roll was a tasty sauce, all for $10.95. The Yellowtail Basil Roll required acclimation. At first bite, I thought I was eating a sushi roll braised in Chinese black bean sauce (where's the spareribs or 
clams?). You couldn't taste the basil but the garlic flavor was prevalent. 
At a reasonable $7.95, I'm not sure I'd reorder. It had the same tasting sauce on the bottom as the Crouching Tiger roll with a swirl of chili sauce for kick. 
The spider roll ($7.95) was good, nothing memorable. The salmon skin hand roll ($3.75) came with lots of salmon skin but hubby agreed with me that this was bland as well as the Hamachi nigiri ($8.50/4) The Hamachi was too cold and lacked flavor over the unseasoned rice. We liked the unagi nigiri ($3.95/2). I saw other diners with either warm or cold sake and beer but was happy with my green tea. Lots of "reservation" tagged tables and this was only at 6:30 PM. I had called earlier and the reservationist told me they were not accepting reservations but there was no wait for walk-ins. Staff was courteous and cleared our table as soon as we completed a dish. 

There is a very small sushi bar in the rear of the restaurant and a long bar adjacent to the small dining tables which fit 4 comfortably but much more difficult for larger parties. If you're feeling adventurous and looking for unconventional sushi, I'd come here. I'd be willing to give it another try but might avoid the novelty dishes because of the incongruous taste.
Sometimes it doesn't pay to get the last word.     Word.
author: Ry T.

description: This is THE BEST sushi place!  I can't stay away from the fresh fishy goodness. Their inventive rolls (the mont blanc is my favorite), great service, and rockin' reggae music makes me go back at least twice a week. Just wish this place had a full bar.
author: Julie P.

description: I always compare sushi to Kane Sushi in Danville and this place is the first on their level. I loved it!! My friend has told me about Sushi Bistro for a while now and yesterday we finally tried it. We got the C-2 roll, spicy tuna and 12 piece sashimi. All of them were amazing, delicious, and perfect! The fish was really fresh and I just can't wait to come back here. Service was great too. The only thing i didn't like was that they charged for tea, but that doesn't stop this place from getting 5 stars.
author: Tamara V.

description:
fantastic, fresh, original cuisine !! 
we arrived around 545p on a Saturday evening, soon after their opening. the restaurant was already close to full with several large parties + smaller groups. there is also a back room we noticed that was not yet filled. 

decor is sleek, but not pretentious. dimly lit. loved the reggae playing over the sound system.  great environment to start a great culinary experience. 

we ordered the following-
-aloha 101- fantastic. tuna, even flash fried, was incredibly butter soft and fresh. sauce was delicious. my husband soaped the final piece in every last drop of sauce.  

-philadelphia hand roll- pretty basic roll, but salmon was delectable. great basic that melted in your mouth

-yellow tail basil- hmm where to start.... so savory! sooo good! the flash frying offered the perfect amount of texture and the chili and eel sauce was a great twist. very unique + satisfying

-first crush- yuuuum! refreshing + satisfying.... yet leaves you wanting more!  the apple was a refreshing edge and went well with the spicy albacore and salmon. the cilantro ponzu sauce was an inventive addition. the combination as well executed. 

-house sake, hot- very good for a house sake. 

service was great. the server was very knowledgeable and attentive to my several food allergies. passing servers routinely picked up any empty plates, dirtied napkins, and straw wrappers.  

we will def be returning soon.
author: Dkj R.

description: This place is good! Was kinda crowded too but I guess that what happens when the food is good.  I love their sashimi walu
author: Rose E.

description: The sushi here is really good, puts Yoshi's in Oakland to shame.  Wait, anything puts Yoshi's sushi to shame.  A better comment is, this is one of my favorite places in SF for Sushi.  The mix of flavors makes for a "flavor explosion!"  The service has always been very good.  My only complaint is the single bathroom.  I would complain about parking, but it is SF.  SF and parking do not belong in the same sentence!
author: Rob J.

description: My favorite sushi!!!  They have very unique rolls, that you won't find in other sushi places. Anything you order here, is Delicious. Simply the best!!!
author: Alisa G.

description:
Sushi Bistro is one of my boyfriend and I's staple restaurants. Tho owners are incredibly sweet and usually its not too much of a wait. This is an awesome place to take people because it has a small neighborhood vibe, and they always give you green tea ice cream for dessert. The Big Island roll is a must, salmon, tuna etc wrapped in cucumber. Its refreshing and always amazing. The sashimi and nigiri is always fresh, but stay away from the scallops, they're just not very good.
The dining room is always a bit drafty, but other than that a good experience.
author: Taler C.

description:
Sushi Bistro has been a house favorite with me and my two roomies for well over two years now.  We're lucky enough to live within two blocks so we find ourselves walking over at least once a week.  

Sushi Bistro's food is great across the board - from really innovative rolls to top of the line, fresh sashimi.  The tastes are great, the cuts are generous and prices are fair.  There's always a board featuring some highlighted in-season fish to special feature rolls in addition to the deep menu.  There are lots of great sakes to pick from too.

The staff is great and definitely make you feel like home.  I take all my  sushi-loving friends to Sushi Bistro!
author: Mark F.

description: Sushi Bistro has some of the most unique rolls I have ever tasted. The rolls are also incredibly fresh and the presentation is given quite a bit of attention. We ordered the Stinky Salmon, Hot Love, and the Watermelon Man. I never had anything like them before, and they were all delicious. The Stinky Salmon was slightly too watery for me, but the garlic sauce and the onions on top made for an interesting flavor.  Loved the Watermelon Man, the amount of avocado on top was perfect. Hot Love was also amazing, but I wish that it came in roll form instead of two fat blobs....it was rather difficult to eat, even with the spoon they gave us. But nevertheless, it was mighty tasty. It also has a little swanky vibe, even though I wasn't digging on the reggae they were playing. But if you're interested in some unusual rolls, definitely give Sushi Bistro a shot.
author: Katie S.

description: I'm from LA., I discovered this place here on yelp and had to try it.  Was not let down!  This place is awesome!  Try Nemo Found and Watermelon man.  My gf loves this place too!
author: Michael N.

description: Even though parking is a hassle and it's usually crowded it's well worth the effort. Making a reservations is the way to go. If you're driving make sure you plan for extra time to look for parking.
author: Isabel M.

description: Sushi Bistro has good sushi in a modern atmosphere.  Visiting SF from Phoenix over the weekend, I ate here with friends who are regulars.  The nigiri pieces were huge and the fish tasted very fresh.  My two favorites: the baby lobster hand rolls and red snapper nigiri.  Three stars for mixing up a bunch of our orders and for asking us to leave immediately after paying our tab so that others could have our seat.  I wanted to finish my water, but it was quickly bussed away.
author: Hamid J.

description: Fun rolls!  My friend and I had the Mont Blanc roll, which was delicious, and the Waikiki roll.  The rice was mushy in both, though.
author: Jen X.

description: Ok it's a pretty fun atmosphere for sushi. Perhaps the lighting is a touch too dark but they do play great music and the place has a lot of good energy. I've gone there a few times and service overall is pretty good but sometimes can be a little spotty. I think the food is fairly creative and generally very tasty and fresh. A tad more expensive than I would have liked. I think menu perhaps has too many choices and could be simplified a touch. Overall it really is a great place.
author: Douglas C.

description:
Hands down my all time favorite Sushi place ever. We moved to the Inner Richmond almost 6 years ago and just tried this place after passing by (before they moved to their new location). We were unaware of the excellent ratings and amazing Sushi. Now we're regulars who are remembered and given stellar treatment every time we go. 

I find their fish to be so fresh with very generous portions. We always switch up what we order but a few of our staples are tuna poke salad, the spring lettuce wrap, the African spider roll, and the New Legend. I could describe them all and tell you how truly wonderful they are but I think you should really go and just try it. Their new location is much bigger and more comfortable for me. You can make reservation (even an hour or two before you go) so that you don't have to stand in the long lines on Friday or Saturday.

I love a place that remembers me but I never expect them to remember my drink order. Sushi Bistro always remembers what we like to drink and immediately tells us of their specials that they know we prefer. I feel so welcome there. Granted, I felt welcome before we were regulars too...always friendly and fast service.

I still go to other Sushi places when I'm in another neighborhood or state but nothing compares to Sushi Bistro! Really, try it and you'll find out first hand what I'm talking about.
author: Stacey B.

description:
Very good, delicious sushi and appetizers. Interesting rolls (in a good way), plenty of variety, fresh fish.

Gets very crowded and loud on Friday and Saturday night. Definitely expect to wait about 20 minutes.

I will certainly be back!
author: Yelena K.

description: One of my favorite sushi places in the city - plenty of unique rolls, and  several veggie roll options. Plus, I like the cucumber salad they offer while you wait for your food to arrive. My young nephew tried sushi for the first time in his life here last week and loved it - that speaks a lot for the place!
author: Shweta V.

description:
I really dug this place when it first opened, but haven't been back in some time.  It just got a little convoluted.  I think it's trying to be too many different things at once.  

That being said, the hamachi's great, as is the kirin on tap.
author: Nathan Z.

description:
I almost hate to rate this place because I don't want more people to find out about it...on the other hand, it is was so good I just can't help myself.
This is a diamond in the rough.  A real "San Francisco" unique and charming atmosphere and excellent Sushi.  They had a really wide selection of unusual rolls and the prices were reasonable.  I'm glad i found Sushi Bistro, my new favorite casual sushi place.
author: Lynn S.

description:
The BEST sushi in San Francisco!! 

I frequent this place and am in love. The menu is huge and everything I have eaten has been fantastic. The "Hot Love", Wow, it is one of the best things I have ever put in my mouth. A must try!

Dave, the super hot owner is awesome. Reggae music is always playing. All of these things make for a great night!
author: Miss R.

description:
Bomb-level loud, and you never know who your server is (the staff always seems to be trying to rush you out a little bit.

But the "Hot Love"...hot-damn.
author: Tonya M.

description: I always make reservations for this place as it can get full fast! The only bad thing I can think of is it's really loud when it's crowded (like clubbing, you have to talk louder in order for the person sitting across to hear you) The "Ahi Tuna Poke Special" is really addicting and tasty. They offer unique rolls and the fish is always fresh!
author: Taiga M.

description:
I really like this place.  The unique rolls they have keep me coming back, and the gen mai cha tea is fantastic.

Parking can be iffy sometimes, but it's no big deal when you're craving something different.

Wait time also varies, and this place can definitely get loud.  It's a pretty neat place, and I'd recommend it to anyone to try this place out at least once.
author: B F.

description: Like they need another glowing review- but here goes....We've been paying homage to this sushi mecca for the last 3 years. Why it's better than most is they are very creative with their sushi offering (i mean how many california and caterpillar rolls can one eat!?).  Big fans of the monster in law, butter fish blasters, and drunken halibut. Dave- the owner- always makes you feel extra welcome, and you can feel that passion for fun and delicious food permeate everything. We even like to bring out of town NY'ers to our neighborhood joint, and it never fails to impress. Now they get a chuckle on the Iphone app ad, because they say- hey- we know that place! While I'm happy for sushi bistro to gain this notoriety, I hope they can maintain that cool local sushi vibe and Lil gem quality that makes it one of our top go to's!
author: Amber O.

description: Beware! I got so sick last night after eating here. I have the ahi poky salad, the drunken halibut appetizer, the softshell crab roll and some hamachi sashimi.
author: Nancy G.

description:
My brother and I originally wanted to go to Namu but after being told that we would be waiting for over an hour we decided to venture next door. The only thing that has kept me from SB is that I prefer a traditional approach to sushi. None the less, I decided to give it a shot. Very glad I did! 
The fish portions here are huge, you really get what you are paying for! We tried the Winter and Solstice lettuce wraps, which were recommended by our waitress. Right then and there I knew SB was about to change my preconceived notions about them. Next, we tried a variety of rolls (Monster, Watermelon Man, Big- something) as well as a sashimi platter. I enjoyed them all equally.
Service was attentive and fast, and it didn't hurt that our server was hot.
All in all, do not come here with expectations of traditional rolls, SB is VERY different but worth the try!
author: MARK J.

description: Sushi B is crackin'.  Make no doubt about it, it's loud and it's happening.  If that ain't your thing, go next door which, seems to be the polar opposite.  If you are looking for traditional, this also isn't the spot for you.  Not to hate on tradition (there is something to be said about simplicity) or intimate (huge fan...huge) but some days I just got to throw caution to the wind and trip my senses.  This place does just that.  They got some crazy inventive maki rolls that are straight bangin'.  The clincher (drum roll please) they offer brown rice sushi.  Yes, I know you hard core sushi zealots are gasping as I use to feel the same way (disliked for real).  But when it's done right, which sadly isn't often, it's quite tasty.  Sushi B got it down though.  It's a good thing too otherwise I would inhale a half a dozen of them rolls (I really can) and be hungry a few hours later (I really would).  Thanks Sushi B, I think I'm going to have to lift some of your creations (Hawaiian breeze, Mont Blanc, Butterfish blasters) and get my roll on...at home...on intimate status!
author: Stephanie E.

description:
Went to Sushi Bistro this evening and it was terrible. The fish was not fresh and we were some of the first customers in the restaurant when it opened.I have gone to this restaurant about 5 times and it continues to disappoint and get progressively worse each time I have gone. The nigiri and rolls were just not that fresh and when I informed the bartender-Skip he just shrugged it off. This place is rated 4 stars because you do not see a sophisticated eater dining at this restaurant you see hipsters and their usual non distinguished taste for the mediocre. The food was so bad that we would never recommend this place to anyone or ever return here to dine ever again. The fish left a bad taste in our mouths and the food overall was rated a 1. The service was OK but they have a little bit of nonchalance about them and do not provide any special service. This is a restaurant that continually declines from a food perspective and is nothing special. 

If you are a sushi person and have really had great Sushi in Japan, Hawaii and other cities in the US and abroad this place would be rated no more than a two for the freshness of the fish and overall no more than a 2 for the sushi overall. I have to imagine that any people rating this restaurant a 4 or a 5 have not had really good sushi and the mediocrity of this restaurant suits them fine. 

Another issue is this restaurant is located in an area where the parking can be very difficult and I would not take a cab or public transportation to visit this restaurant. because it is really nothing special.
author: Ricky R.

description: I looooove the remodel.  Menu seems bigger -- everything on it was great: volcano + crunchy rolls, chicken teriyaki, etc. etc.  My new favorite sushi restaurant.
author: Tim G.

description: I like sushi, but have never LOVED it, until Sushi Bistro.  The menu is one of the best I've seen in the bay area.  The lettuce wraps are amazing...fish ones of course!  The rolls, namely the "C-2" was made with such attention...each part the lobster, the shrimp tempura was in perfect scale and the textures of each married well especially with the drizzle (not globed on) of eel sauce.  Went after a long day (arrived around 10pm) and the service was so kind, and the place was happily buzzing along...which truly lifted my spirits
author: Mai G.

description: Really great sushi! i'll be back
author: Janine D.

description: This was such a yummy place!! Went here tonight and loved it! Great service, great food, and great decor. Not too cheap but worth it if you love sushi. I tried their cali roll, which was yum, their Hawaiian Breeze, Tempura, M&L forever, Spicy Crunchy, and the Spider. Filling and so good!! Must try people. Definitely going back. Very nice servers too.
author: Jacqueline C.

description: Went back because I forgot I'd been here before.  The Red Devil roll was really good.  the Tuna Poke was pretty good too.  A lot of tuna, good salad dressing.  But the other rolls, the M&R Forever and some random other roll tasted so bad.  I think they use their old sushi grade fish that doesn't sell, cook it, and stuff it into rolls.  It tastes fishy, dry, and overall heavy which are not things I look for in sushi.
author: A S.

description: My favorite japanese restaurant in the city: cheap and yet delicate. Try their signature dish, they always surprised me. Good atmosphere, nice music, only flaw: the waiting line on any day of the week... but it's worth waiting!!
author: Alice G.

description:
wow, what happened to this place?   back in the day i was coming here anywhere from 2-4 times a week...it was a great small, friendly neighborhood gem that served fun rolls and good sushi.  the owner used to be our waitress (at least i think she was the owner) and i was able to carry on a normal conversation during the meal.  i would have definitely given them four stars easy.  now i'm afraid things are quite different.

tonight was my first time at this new expanded location and i'm guessing they made this drastic change to perhaps compete with namu next door which is more trendy.  the restaurant had their reggae/ska dance tracks on full blast and it was so loud that our waitress missed a couple of our orders....when i asked for them again, she definitely just thought they were new orders instead of missing them the first time around.  

the rolls that i got used to be served hot because it had tempura shrimp or baked scallops on them and tonight they came out luke warm and limp -- not appetizing.

i left here feeling sad and really missing the old sushi bistro, especially since i haven't been in awhile.  i guess this is what can easily happen when a restaurant expands and gets popular...some times change isn't always for the best.
author: ML ..

description: I have been coming to Sushi Bistro for about 5 years, when they were in their much smaller space a couple doors down. Since my first visit I have been coming back for more. By far, Sushi Bistro is my favorite sushi restaurant. The lobster salad is to die for and I order it almost every time I come. Their rolls are inventive and edgy, but always taste fabulous. Their fish is always very fresh and tasty and the service is unbeatable. Most of the servers have been there since the opening or soon thereafter and always remember the regulars when they come in. Scoot out to the inner richmond one evening for sushi, and I'll assure you, you won't be disappointed.
author: Rebecca D.

description: i am a sucker for "special" rolls. i know friggin sushi snobs stay away from the creative stuff to honor the traditional sushi and allow the fresh fish to shine but i say eff that! any roll with mango in it also has my name written all over it! any roll with some sort of garlic aioli has got me also. i got to try a bunch of rolls and each one was inventive. it was really hard choosing which rolls to get but you probably can't go wrong getting any of them.
author: Regina C.

description: Purely on the quality of the fish on a Monday night, this place is up there in the pantheon of SF sushi. Look for the Butterfish in its many incarnations on the menu as well as the sashimi salad. The menu is deep and entertaining and the sake list reliable. If it's packed, look next door to Namu as a healthy second choice. This has quickly become my favorite block in the Richmond.
author: Phil M.

description:
Incredibly extensive menu of varied selections with clever names. 

The menu's so long, it can be daunting at first, but I have a simple rule for these kinds of situations: Go with the dish with the longest description! Odds are, even if you knew how to make the dish in question yourself (and had the time and patience to do so), you wouldn't have all those ingredients on hand at the same time! Also, in this instance, go with your gut reaction. Otherwise, you'll spend a half-hour lost in the menu.

The three of us got there at 6:30 p.m., just before the tiny space filled up. Very fast service; they slammed out one sushi dish after another. We ordered four dishes in total. All great. An average of eight pieces per order. Total bill per person, with tip, $21.00. Highly reasonable. Highly recommended.

(Some of the dishes were ordered were Billie Jean, Five Wishes and Yellowtail Basil.)

Good, fast, affordable, quality place to go to before a show at the nearby Red Poppy Art House or Brava Theater.
author: Paula M.

description:
My new favorite sushi place in San Francisco. Bumped Okoze to my number two spot.

Bistro's fish is beautiful. The host/hostess and waitresses were perfect - real friendly but not obnoxious. We told the waitress what we were in the mood for and she picked a perfect appetizer and three of the best rolls I've ever had. 

Great clean atmosphere and very fairly priced. Only setback is that the two glasses of wine we had were sub-par. Avoid the Pinot and the Chardonnay. I actually ended up mixing my Pinot with a glass of ginger ale so I could drink it faster and move on to beer, which was delicious as always.
author: Nick W.

description:
First of all, I don't trust any Asian restaurant that has no Asian customers sitting in it.  HUGE clue there.  About 15 YUPPIES sat in the place talking about how great it was... very weird.  

We ordered our food and was pretty excited about the menu.  I mean, it seemed fairly creative with their dishes and I'm always interested to try something new.  

So I ordered the Big Island roll and unagi nigiri.  The roll was the most expensive one at $13.50-ish so I was looking forward to being amazed.  What a disappointment.  It came with 2 or 3 types of fish and were tasteless and the crab was IMITATION!  Do NOT charge me $13.50 for f-ing imitation meat.  If I want imitation meat, I'll go to Safeway a few blocks away and pick up some tofurkey.  And the roll had no seaweed whatsoever!  Instead it was a huge log wrapped in cucumber.  WTF?!  So they expect me to shove that huge log slice into my petite mouth and chomp down on big chunks of cucumber to get to some tasteless sashimi and fake crabmeat?  No.  Then I figured, well, at least my unagi will be cool.  I mean, you can't mess up unagi nigiri.  I was wrong.  So wrong.  They gave me two pieces of very pretty unagi nigiri that was drowned in sauce.  It could have been styrofoam nigiri and would have tasted the same under all that sauce.  

Good things about it: we had decent service and the decor is contemporary and clean.  Bad things about it: Everything else.  

Before we left, the place was crowded with Marina-types slumming it.  I'll never go back.
author: Imelda M.

description: Definitely the best sushi and sashimi restaurant in San Francisco!  Having lived, studied, worked, and traveled throughout Japan, I know what is good and authentic Japanese food.  I have tried many Japanese restaurants in the Bay Area and have not yet found one that is as good as Sushi Bistro for the freshness and tastiness of its fish!  My husband likes to try the more "creative and non-traditional" dishes like African Spider for which the chef owner had won a prize in a competition about 2 years ago.  I always like the more simple and "traditional" deluxe sashimi plate or some other special sushi/sashimi of the day that is written on the board behind the sushi counter.  The price is very reasonable (maybe we can even say it is cheap) for the quality that you get.
author: Annie L.

description: Why is it that all the narcissistic Chinese people who know nothing about what's good or not are all writing reviews on Yelp. Clean up Chinatown first, it's the most filthy place in San Francisco, the restaurants all all very dirty
author: Curtis A.

description: New Mahi Mahi; Spicy Crunchy... just plain wow.
author: Michelle C.

description:
I used to LOVE Sushi Bistro, but the last two time I've gone it's not been good and I don't think I'll go back.  First of all, the last two times I've gone, we've found hair in the food.  It must happen a lot because when we told our server, they were like, "Um, OK, whatever."  And last night (granted it was a Friday but it was only 7:30!) the service was scattered and chaotic.  It took a long time for them to take our order, then they kept bringing the wrong food to our table.  For example, the server came and dropped a roll on our table, me and my co-diners don't know what it is, we're asking eachother who ordered it, no one knows, we leave it there.  The server comes back to bring out one of our appetizers, we ask what the roll is, he tells us, and then he goes, "oh, you didn't order that."  And he just takes it and puts it on the table that did order it!  My tea mug wasn't re-filled and I wasn't offered water.  My tofu salad was soggy and over-dressed.  The "seared" tuna in my lettuce wrap, which is usually one of my most favorite things in the world, was overcooked to the point of dryness and blandness.  What happened to this place?  It was a terrible dining experience.  

And, as if that all weren't enough, they didn't give us our complimentary ice cream at the end of the meal.
author: Jackie D.

description: I've eaten at almost every sushi restaurant in the city and this is by far the best one with good prices. The service is great and the food is fabulous. In my opinion it is one of San Francisco's secret best spots that is not going to be a secret much longer. Sushi Bistro is about to become one of SF's hot spots with a new location opening up in the Mission, so go now while the wait is tolerable because the sushi is definitely worth trying!!
author: Blane K.

description: This place is my new addiction. I always end up ordering too much food, but I always end up eating all because it's that good. The staff is great, the interior is awesome, and of course the food is fantastic.
author: luis a.

description: Fun atmosphere, delicious sushi, fantastic combos - all in all, great sushi!  Not super authentic but for more creative combinations, look no further.
author: Jessica S.

description:
soooo efffin' good!! unbelievable rolls crafted with amazing precision. each piece was tightly packed with piping hot goodies. the crunchy stuff on the crunch roll was somehow fused onto the rice, wow! service was great too. we were seated promptly, food came out fast, and my water was always filled. 

5 star rolls- african spider, crouching tiger hidden dragon, crunchy, and butterfish blasters
author: B Y.

description: This place has great Nigiri and a vary friendly chef. That is a deadly combination for a delicious sushi destination.  They are very generous with their cuts and happy to discuss the the origins/history of different fish.  I think they have some weird rolls too if you're into that stuff.
author: adam b.

description:
Despite many great reviews from other people, we were very disappointed in the quality of the food. We tried a number of their signature sushi rolls, but the food was nothing special at all. The taste was bland and sushi rolls had too much cream cheese. The amount of cream cheese was way too much compared to the size of the rolls. Some rolls had too much hot sauce on top that it completely over-powered the whole dish. After the night, all I can remember from the meal was cream cheese and hot sauce.

I have had better sushi else where for the prices Sushi Bistro charged. It was very disappointing that such a famous sushi spot would offer such taste lacking sushi. I don't think we will ever return.
author: Raymond L.

description: Finally got around to trying this place for my gf's birthday.  The wait was a little long (30-45m) but the waiters are flying around as fast as they can so it's just a popular place.  I know that this place moved recently and I can't comment on how it was before but where it is now has a very hip contemporary vibe and the music is definitely present though not so loud that it's hard to hold a conversation.  We first tried the Sexy Scallop which was my personal favorite.  I liked that I could taste each component of the dish and everything went together really nicely.  Next, we had the Spicy Crunchy which was ok aside from the fact that the roll kept falling apart.  Last we had the Stinky Salmon which had a very distinct Chinese flavor to it and the onions on top of it were real good.  If you guys like this place, a similar place to try in LA area is California Roll Factory on Santa Monica Blvd.
author: Derrick C.

description: My friend Jason introduced me to this place and its definitely my new favorite Japanese restaurant. Fish is incredibly fresh and really unique roll combinations. Its too bad its far out of the city so it doesnt get as much traffic as it deserves. Try the spicy yellowtail roll with fresh basil and spicy sauce. also the baby lobster roll is awesome.
author: Sonia C.

description: Holly Tuna the portions are huge. I don't know if they have to use up all of their fish each day or they are just really generous, i don't really care. the quality is very good and the presentation is great. the sashimi is awesome as well as all of the rolls. It's very small so if you don't call and get a reservation you will be standing in the middle of the dining room waiting which is a little awkward. parking is a bitch but shouldn't discourage you from going, or maybe it should and then i could find some.
author: Stephen K.

description: What makes a perfect night? Eating mouth-watering butterfish sushi to relaxing reggae. Before this place, never have I seen the two in combination. The food is delissshhh! Each time we order the exact same thing: sashimi spirit, hawaiian breeze, a mont blanc, and a new roll of our choice. My friends and I are tiny asian women, yet everytime we go here, we manage to eat 5 times more than our digestive systems can allow. Still...well worth it! I was hoping this place would remain our tiny, neighborhood sushi hole-in-the-wall, but the iPhone Urban Spoon commercial has made this restaurant ridiculously crowded....but if you make a reservation, you'll be fine!
author: Melissa S.

description: This place is one of the best sushi places ever! It's fresh, the food comes out quickly and service is always prompt. It is reasonably priced also My mouth is watering just thinking about the place- enough said.
author: Alison W.

description: Whooo! As good as it gets!- is right. I won't go anywhere else, because every time I do-I just say to myself- it's not Sushi Bistro. Also, they play reggae music all the time, which I don't get tired of. My favorites include-double jeopardy, watermelon man, african spider, Hawaiian breeze,  and the list goes on.
author: Kristene A.

description: Oh yeah. Sushi Bistro still is my favorite japanese and sushi restaurant. The ahi tuna poke salad is still a given every time I go there. They also added a few new rolls, like the butterfish blasters, which have no rice, but super tasty. Speaking of no rice, the sashimi plate was covered in generously huge pieces of fish, I couldn't even finish it all! If you can't let go of your rice, Sushi Bistro also now hosts a few new brown rice rolls, which is a healthy touch. I love me some Sushi Bistro...still.
author: Jan Z.

description:
I'm finding it hard not to gush about this place. Great food, great atmosphere, kind and attentive staff, it really has it all. I was introduced to this place on a date with a sous chef, he asked me where I wanted to go, and I suggested he decide since food was his thing...his response was "well then we're going to Sushi Bistro on Balboa." 

That was my introduction to the old location, which was charming and kitschy, the new location has a hipper vibe, and has great atmosphere. Thankfully the food is the same, AWESOME!!! 

This last visit, one of the friends I went with had a recent bad sushi experience, so we suggested we go to Sushi Bistro to help her get over it, her response was "well this place certainly wiped that horror out of my head, this is great."  We also had dietary restrictions at the table and the staff could not have been more helpful, making suggestions and pointing us to safe choices on the menu. 

Everything was yummy! Worth the trek to the Inner Richmond!!
author: Kate M.

description:
loved the grilled butterfish salad.  the dressing was perfect!

the african spider roll was alright, but i wouldn't order it again

the sashimi spirit roll was really good, and i loved how tender the roll was and easy to bite into because of the thin soy paper wrap

sushi bistro has very unique options with a tropical influence.  i'm also a huge fan of butterfish so i was ecstatic that sushi bistro uses it in many dishes.
author: Jen Y.

description:
I have 2 things to say to you - Butterfish and Spicy Girl.

Sushi Bistro is a little pricier than, say, Ichiraku, but the quality makes it worth it.  They have appetizers that are as delicious as the they are unique with names such as Mr. Brown, Spicy Girl, and Hot love. 
The sushi rolls are not the same o' - same o' you get at most common sushi places, which I have to admit, is hard thing for me to get over. I was very disappointed they had nothing resembling a Cherry Blossom roll. But I just had to relax and come down of my snooty pedestal and try something new. I was not disappointed.
It is small inside, and we often have to wait for a table, especially if you want one that is not right by the door where the cold air blows in every time someone enters. We went there tonight and ordered one Spicy Girl, 6 piece Butterfish, and 3 rolls and walked out of there at $22 a piece for 3 of us, so not a bad deal all told. 
Sushi Bistro has become a favorite place for me and my girls to go for girl time and bitchfesting and Butterfish feasting. Mmmm, Butterfish.
author: Miss Kae O.

description: This place truly has the biggest, freshest cuts of seafood in town. I mean, be prepared for overloaded nigiri and sushi roles. They also usually have butterfish, which is one of my personal favorites. They've recently started taking reservations here, but it almost doesn't help you to make them as walk-ins are really common. That's the only downside is that you should be prepared to wait and once you're seated, to have people crowded over you waiting to be seated. But, it's worth it in the end.
