description: Great rolls!  Tons of amazing fusion and crazy spicy and delicious rolls!
author: Chard M.

description: Excellent sushi rolls, and the sashimi was pretty good as well.  The roll that I got, Big Island roll, soooo fresh and yummy.  I get it every time I go.  One of the better, if not the best one that I've tried in this area so far.  If you plan to go, probably best to make reservations.
author: Tiffany H.

description: This is my new sushi favourite.  Great fresh fish at a halfway decent price.  Very interesting rolls too.  Only drawback is the lack of parking in this neighbourhood but that's hardly their fault.  This is one place that I have to try everything on the menu.
author: Chris C.

description: Over the top delicious.  Best sushi I have had in a long long time.  The rolls are creative, fresh and well priced.  And thank god for the loud reggae tunes being played during my sushi eating bliss.  The entire experience was perfection.  I'm already planning my next trip back.
author: Piper B.

description: Parking is horrible.  The sushi makes up for it.  I recommend the sashimi bowl as well as the following rolls: stinky salmon and the sexy scallop.  The rolls are pretty true to their names.  The stinky salmon has onions and garlic.  Some people say ew to that.  I say Right On!
author: La A.

description: Love this place! Great sushi, reggae music, saki.. Everyone that works here is super attentive. Call ahead for a reservation so you aren't stuck waiting at the door!
author: Chrissy L.

description: Really fresh, plenty of unique rolls you won't find anywhere else, hip decor and atmosphere, good service.  Definitely check out the fried oysters.  They also have a fried ice cream dessert in the shape of sushi rolls.
author: Diana C.

description: Really big fish. That's the first thing that came to mind when I ordered their sushi. The cut of the fish is really huge, and the amount of rice under that fish is just the right amount; not like those other places where they try to stuff you with rice and put a little piece of fish on top. The yellowtail simply melts in your mouth like butter. The service is great. I would definitely go there again next time I'm in San Fran.
author: Jun W.

description: SUSHI BISTRO!!!!  From the looks of the place you'd think that it's incredibly busy, however think about how many tables are provided in the restaurant and how long each table stays for. YES, the food may be semi-good and fresh (by request) however parking is a BITCH!! Depends on how much time you have to go around searching for parking. It's a cute place, good to try once, maybe if I'm in the neighborhood again I'd eat there one more time, but not on my list of favs. It's a fusion... so you get a little more of a fancier dish, not the original authentic Japanese sushi.
author: Joanna N.

description:
We went there for the first time last night on a couple of recs and boy were we disappointed.  Most of the sushi was mediocre at best.  The yellowtail sashimi were huge slabs, but not very fresh nor tender.  I didn't finish the 4 sashimi I ordered if that says anything.

We ordered two salmon skin handrolls which are very normal ans straightforward dishes.  When they arrived there was jobs of tough, gelatenous salmon skin inside.  It's supposed to be crispy!  We sent it back and they had no problems taking it back.  The Ikura was acceptable, but not remarkable.

The only good food I had was a baby lobster handroll.  It was quite tasty with the lobster in a mayo based sauce.

The only upsides was that it wasn't too expensive and that the service as fast (almost too fast).

We are never going back.  There's too many better places.
author: Joseph F.

description: YUM!!! We have a favorite sushi restaurant, but it's an hour away in Pleasanton. We've heard there are fantastic sushi restaurants in San Francisco, but have only found really good ones...Sushi Bistro was fantastic. They have a very interesting and diverse menu, but everything I tried was fantastic. I will absolutely be going back!!!
author: Princess D.

description:
Excellent fresh fish.  The nigiri portions are unusually large and the fish is very high quality.  I also recommend starting out with the poke salad.

I can't wait to check out their new Mission location.
author: sarah c.

description: The food was great, fresh, and the presentation was awesome.  The VERY thing that made me dislike the place was the service.  I don't know if any of the other reviewers felt it , but I felt rushed when dining there.  I had a good sized group, but felt like they were trying to rush us out to PROCESS the next group.  My friends felt the same way.  They had the bill in front of me before the meal was well over.  We liked the food but $#!74 service.
author: Jesse O.

description: Fun place and super fresh fish. The service is quick and friendly, ambiance is comfortable but can get a bit loud. Love the variety of choices and all are delicious. The YT Jalapeno is great to start with, thin and simple pieces of yellow tail. The Lettuce Wraps are amazing and, especially the Fall and Equinox, scrumptious! Can get pricey, so it is usually a treat for me. Very hard to do since it is in my hood.
author: Lissi A.

description:
My friend introduced me to Sushi Bistro and I must say, I was not disappointed. Initially, when I first walked in, I felt as though I was in a bar/lounge due to it's internal setting and LOUD music. As I got more acquainted with the place, I realized that it was all intentional after I saw the menu (no entrees) and no sushi bar. We ordered a few rolls and I definitely would recommend "The New Legend Roll." They definitely had a unique line of specialty rolls and it seemed as though it was fused with a Japanese and Western culture.

As for the cons, I would absolutely advise them to lower down the music a tad bit. I completely understand it's a so called "chill" place to hang out for drinks and snacks, but it wouldn't be chill if a person practically had to yell to get his/her message across. Secondly, they need to slice the nigiri sushi thinner. I ordered the Super White Tuna and it was so thick and huge that I felt somewhat uneasy eating it. 

Aside from that, I definitely enjoyed my visit there.
author: Chris F.

description: The very best neo-American sushi I have ever tasted, period.  As a New York transplant, I have taken almost every visitor that has come through SF to Sushi Bistro, or Sushi Binge-o as me and my friends have started calling it.  Once it hits your lips it tastes so good.  I'm almost mad that SB has made it on Apple/i-Phone commercials here...it's going to explode more than it already has!
author: Ashley H.

description: I had the Hawaiian Breeze (mango, avocado, fuji apple, topped w/ tuna macadamia nut, and drizzled w/ cilantro pesto.) it was delicious. Great sushi and music! I will definitely be back! Thanks SB
author: Josie C.

description: Sushi Bistro is a tiny little gem. The food is so fresh, not to mention extremely innovative! There's a dish that is served with a side of tortilla chips, as my friend Diane noted at our dinner the other night. It's a great small place, about the size of my old studio apartment.
author: Kristen O.

description:
I gotta say, I was disappointed after all the great reviews I read. 

Service was really bad. It took over 15 minutes to get menus, at least another 15 to place an order (and then only b/c we told someone we were ready). The waitress wouldn't even look at us when taking an order; I think she was in a perpetual state of pissed-offedness. 

Our first dish was hamachi kama and was way way overcooked  and tough -- *burnt* on one side. Everything else was fine. They do give pretty big pieces of fish, so that was a saving grace.

No plans to go back.
author: John P.

description: I thought Sushi Bistro was pretty good. The salad they served at the beginning was very tangy and flavorful. My problem with the restaurant was that the menu is waaay too large.. It's hard to choose from a selection that wide. Also, many of the rolls just have too many flavors. We made the mistake of ordering too many rolls with some sort of sauce or mayo. Well next time we are going to try Tekka Sushi, which we saw on our way out. It seems to serve very simple sushi.
author: O K.

description: Sushi Bistro is really good, I mean it isn't THE best in town but regardless of comparisons they have some delicious stuff, and it isn't too seriously overpriced. Personally I would pick some other sushi places in The Richmond if I was debating it beforehand, but I like eating here just fine (as long as it isn't crowded.) The two times I've been here I was satisfied and enjoyed it (I think I had a really tasty spider roll.) Not a bad choice if you decide to stop by.
author: Aaron J.

description: Simply the best, better than all the rest.  I say that based solely on the excellence of the sushi.  The place is damn small, but what's the most important thing?  The SUSHI.
author: Adam B.

description:
when people write super pornographic descriptions of sushi texture, it has always grossed me out. but the fish at sushi bistro is so good, i could almost be moved to describe it that way.

the portions are generous -- we ordered the ahi poke appetizer, and what normally comes in a trussed up martini glass at other restaurants covered nearly the entire plate at sushi bistro.

all of our nigiri and sashimi was killer, i'm getting teary-eyed thinking of the butterfish and uni. also, i highly highly recommend the black weeds roll -- seaweed salad, ahi, albacore, and black pepper.

service can be a little bit absentminded, but with the bad reggae in the background i found myself bopping my head along complacently in a beautiful sushi/beer coma by the end of the night.
author: Sophie S.

description: GREAT FISH.  Unique sushi roll choices.  Only downside is no sake cocktails and difficult to park.
author: T N.

description: I'm a man of few words when it comes to places that give very little food for such an expensive price. The quality of food wasn't that great. Sake is good variety here but not the bed. Rolls fell apart. I was unhappy.
author: Jason C. J.

description: Love this place.  It's usually busy so we always make advance reservations.  Quality sushi at reasonable prices.  Try the unfiltered sake, such a good compliment with your meal.  The staff is friendly and the space is so unpretentious.
author: Blu n.

description:
In search of a Sushi Bar open on Monday evenings, I came across the reviews for Sushi Bistro.  I usually lean more toward the traditional when it comes to Sushi, but decided to try it out.  We got there just in time at 7pm.  The place was packed by 8pm.  The music did take a little getting used to, and we did have to raise our voices by an octave to hear each other, but the fish was very fresh, and had the buttery rich taste and texture we seek.  We ordered waaaay too much!  Beginning with the Soft Shell crab appetizer and the Butterfish salad.  The crab is served with a Ponzu sauce and was very good.  The Butterfish salad comes dressed in a light citrus dressing, and is sprinkled with mango, corn and some other vegetables.  We shared the salad that had a really tasty dressing (don't bother asking, we tried....there is taste that we know, but were unable to identify.  The miso soup is NOT salty and has a nice rich broth.  Yes, we are beginning to get full, and the 12pc Sashimi plate hasn't even come out yet. We decided to go with the 'Watermelon Man' & 'First Crunch' rolls.  Both had very distinct tastes that were balanced with the fish perfectly, complimenting, without over-whelming.  I love some of the names of the rolls, and more importantly the novel combinations of ingredients.
Just when we thought we couldn't possibly eat another thing, we're asked if we want green tea ice cream.  We ate it like the gluttons we are, and found it to be refreshing.  We would come back and sit at a table, as it looks a little more comfortable.
author: Arlene C.

description: Being a vegetarian makes it kinda difficult to find a good sushi place. There's usually only one roll I can get and it's rarely good, so I'm always looking for good udon noodles or veggie tempura. Well let me just say that I think I have a new favorite restaurant. Not only do they have a variety of veggie rolls, but they're also awesome! And their udon soup was fantastic! I highly recommend this place.
author: Joy T.

description:
*drools*

thinking about this place makes me extremely hungry. great food and great services, what else could you ask for in a restaurant? 

mmmmm.... 

yummmm....

*drools some more*
author: Wednesday M.

description: food was good, I like the sliced cucumbers with sesame in vinegar they start you of with.
author: John E.

description: TASTIEST SUSHI!!! Great atmosphere. Definitely try the Red Devil roll and the butterfish... melts in your mouth!!!!
author: K. N.

description: Totally awesome! Went there last night and had a great time! First, it takes reservations! Second, if you're vegetarian they have some fantastic creative rolls (shitake, tuscan, aspara-avocado) (not ur run of the mill cucumber, avocado roll-though they do have that if you want to be safe) Try their veggie gyoza for sure- it took awhile but they were made from scratch and absolutely delicous. Fun atmosphere, real nice service and very creative and original menu! Definitely go here.Can't wait to go back.
author: sue c.

description: Apparently this place has received multiple awards, however, its not that great. The fish tastes REALLY fishey...which isn't good :( My roommate got sick TWICE after eating here and she's never gone back. I still eat here on occasion because I live a block away and i like the mango thing, but they overprice everything because of their status.
author: Erin B.

description:
this place is great.

we had a reservation and they were running a little late but made up for it by quickly bringing us our drink order while we waited.

its a very lively and busy place.  a bit bigger than i expected.  very attentive service without being intrusive.

we ordered 4 different things and while everything was very yummy and creative... the hawaiian breeze was by far our favorite.  the cilantro pesto makes it a new and lovely combo i've never had.

highly recommended!
author: Jen H.

description:
I found this place because a lot of my chef friends hang out there and love it up.  I can see why. Amazingly creative and wonderful fusion experience here!  

I highly recommend two lovers, but everything on their menu is brilliant! 

They are super nice folks, too. 

If you become a 'regular' they keep your wooden saki cup for you (and you can decorate it yourself!)  

FUN FUN YUM.
author: Alison V.

description:
!!! This place was great!!! My boyfriend and I usually wind up eating somewhere on Clement Street, but decided yesterday to show some love to Balboa! And we loved it! And it loved us back! Everything we had was really good. 

We started out with the Hamachi Kama, and were both pleasently surprised. It was so flaky and delicious, I couldn't wait to get our main courses. I got the Ahi Tower, because the few times that I've eaten sushi, it really hasn't been my thing, its not the fish, its the nori's texture that throws me off...anyways, my boyfriend got the Aloha 101, and I snuck some of that. After our first bites, we were pretty much fighting each other to get more of both of them because they were both awesome. 

I definately would recommend going here, and plan on going back. My only complaint was that they aren't great on filling up water, and it was HOT yesterday! But thats a small thing, and I think i'm the only one who pays attention to that, so it's pretty forgiveable.  

It was definately busy for a Monday night, which was kind of nice, as my "weekend" is Sunday and Monday and it's sometimes nice to go busy places because then it really feels like a weekend. The prices were really good for a sit down restaurant, everything looked and tasted amazing, and was really fresh, great quality seafood!

I think next time I might even bring myself to try sushi rolls of my own- and hope it's soon!
author: denise d.

description:
This place is good, not great. I ordered the Sashimi plate, chef's choice. Very great picks of fish. I just felt a bit claustrophobic in there, and I did not feel as though there was any privacy. 

Good place to go to if you just want to drop in.
author: Rahul T.

description:
this resteraunt is amazing!  my friends have been going here once a month for years and i just had my first experience yesterday.
wow.  the fish is so fresh and the rolls are different and extremely scrumptious.

hands down the best sushi i have ever had.
author: erin f.

description: Delish!  They have tons of Hawaiian influenced rolls which I loved AND they have soy paper which is a great alternative for those of us who aren't diggin' on the seaweed.  This place is always hoppin', super place to bring friends (and out of town guests) and they often give a little bowl of cucumber salad, as well as come ice cream . . .for FREE. YAY!
author: Jorie p.

description: There are few sushi places I can go to and think what am I going to have this time. Usually its a Tem-Maki, a little ebi, maybe some spicy tuna. At sushi bistro, you can enjoy sushi in a whole new way. Their susi bowls are awesome. The Caucasian Afro is amazing. The lettuce wrap sushi is great too! Something about a hot tempura shrimp and the cool lettuce just works together. Do yourself a favor, don't eat for a few days, then go here. You will not be sorry.
author: Aaron S.

description: LOVE this place!  Sushi is TOP notch, best in the city (or any city i've eaten sushi in), just make a reservation!  Great music, great food.  Small but cute ambiance.  I crave this place.
author: Margarita R.

description: You don't have to travel towards the Embarcadero to get great sushi. Sushi Bistro has great rolls and fresh sashimi. It's a tiny place, so it gets pretty crowded. You can pick up an order if you don't want to wait (especially since parking's horrible - no surprise it's SF after all).
author: Jane K.

description: A friend came in town from Texas and wanted to get Sushi in San Francisco. I asked a few friends at work if they had any recommendations and three of them said, "Sushi Bistro." I made a reservation for 9pm on a Friday and was very pleased. The area is residential with lots of street parking. We showed up about 30 minutes early and they seated us about 15 minutes later. We ordered a few things off the menu to sample as much as we could: the winter lettuce wrap, tuna sashimi, M&L sushi (I think that was the name),  and a spicy crunch roll. Everything tasted great, especially the winter lettuce wrap. All of the food plus two glasses of wine came to $50 and we were surprised the bill was so low. If you want to eat dinner in a happening part of town with lots of cool shops and restaurants near by, this is not the place, as there are mostly just houses close by that are unremarkable. This was a solid sushi dinner and the service and quality of the food was great.
author: Rachel S.

description: This hip restaurant, just expanded to a bigger location next door from where it used to be, it's very well organized, nicely decorated and with a friendly and fun atmosphere. The food is great.  For sushi lover like me, keep an open mind,  notice that this is not the usual sushi restaurant, they reinvented and rediscovered new type to rolls and other combination that make this place, an alternative sushi restaurant. I love it and even if it is out of the way, it's worth the trip. Reasonable prices and flexible on menu changes. Go get it!!!
author: Laura C.

description: My fiancee and I came here on a Friday date night, and were initially disappointed in the 30 min. wait time, but the atmosphere and style of sushi really intrigued us. Once seated, we ordered a hot onigoroshi, and it hit just the spot on a chilly San Francisco winter evening! We were about to order your typical entree meals, but noticed the majority of the menu was unique sushi rolls (the entrees were stuck on the back bottom corner). Needless to say, we had to go all sushi, OMG we're glad we did. We ordered the new wave Mahi Mahi (my favorite), crouching tiger hidden dragon (my fiancee's favorite) and Hirame fusion (both of us loved!) and OMG again it was SOOO FREAKIN' GOOD! Everything was absolutely fresh, the ingredients were perfectly balanced, the flavor was delightfully unique, and the taste was truly an experience in your mouth! Hands down, this was the best sushi both of us have had in the City! It was a bit pricey and it would have been 5 stars if it weren't for the wait time... but nevertheless, it was well worth it!... =D
author: Vince C.

description: I LOVE sushi bistro.   A bit pricey, but well worth it. Try the baby lobster salad
author: Linda P.

description: Holy smokes...I love sushi and mango! The chef uses interesting/creative combos that light my fire. Nemo Found was quite a treat!
author: William H.

description: Not a big fan of the whole fusion thing but man this place was fantastic! The fish was fresh, the service was over the top and the dishes were very well presented. We'll be going back sooner than later..
author: Natas N.

description: I give Sushi Bistro 5 stars!  Seriously the food is really good - fish is fresh - prices are reasonable (surprisingly for the quality).   It's a cute funky little place; with a bar that seats like 7 people maybe and the decor is eh.. average, but who cares! its clean and the sushi is muy sabroso!  Try one of the lettuce hand rolls -- So gooooood!
author: Liza F.

description: You MUST try the yellow tail basil roll (lightly fried with garlic).  I take food for granted because in SF I can eat well 7 days a week.  But this roll was really different - amazing.  So was the equinox lettuce wrap and the Double Jeopardy.  Yum, yum, yum.  Fast, pleasant service, nice ambiance, reasonable price.  Can't believe I've lived in this neighborhood for 3 years and never tried this place before.
author: Gaping F.

description:
It was ok.

However, I fail to see why it was so crowded or why it gets so many positive reviews.  It was highly Americanized, decent quality sushi at moderate prices.  The service and space are adequate, but nothing more.

There can be no joy in visiting this place or eating its food, it is just an adequate way to fulfill a need to eat.  No reason for me to return.
author: Richard P.

description:
My cousin recommended this place. I went with her and the first thing that struck me as different was the Reggae being played in a Sushi restaurant.  It was decent reggae, just sort of an odd place for it.  It sort of told me they didn't take themselves too seriously. Also, I'm used the stoic sort of angry faced Sushi chef who as far as I know has never had or cared to have a friend. For one, there were two chefs and they were laughing, talking and generally quite jovial while still keeping their eye on the food. Fun to see Sushi made!
    As far as food, I went American,and ordered California rolls. Go ahead, mock me. They're delicious. We could get hand rolls or chopped sushi. Our chopped sushi was tiny. not per say in volume of food, but in that each sushi piece being rolled very small. It was fresh and clean. Not the most amazing sushi, but still quite good. Especially for being pretty cheap for a good evening bite to eat.
author: Christian M.

description:
I've got to second all the great reviews.  I really enjoyed pretty much every roll we had except the fried stuff, which normally isn't my favorite.  I go to sushi for the texture and taste of raw fish, which you miss out on with fried rolls.

The drunken Halibut was fantastic, as was the nigiri, especially the butterfish.  The rolls generally don't include much rice; in fact many of them don't have any rice at all.  They really feature their fish, which is great quality. I highly recommend the Big Island and Five Wishes.

Regrettably, the immortal Chef Shin did not appear to be there.
author: Nate X.

description: WOW! Is all I have to say about this place. My cousin and I thought the name was a little silly but you should never judge a book by its cover or by its title for that matter. The staff was very friendly; just three people that night. When we got the sushi we were blown away. It was the best I had ever had. I have gone there several times since. In fact, after I had gone there for the first time I was on my way back to SF from Detroit and someone on the plane was talking about this great place that I should go for sushi. I was thinking about Sushi Bistro and when he told me the name of the place and it happed to be Sushi Bistro, I was not really surprised. I did get a laugh out of it though. You must try this place.
author: Martin H.

description: I just changed my review from 5 stars to 3.  My wife and I have been going here for years but they have recently raised their prices and narrowed their menu.  The quality does not seem as good as it was before either (the quality is still great, but not exceptional like we remember).  Note:  we gave this place 3 more tries after our average experience just to make sure it was not a fluke.
author: Kevin C.

description: Service was good, but food was so-so. I've eaten here a couple of times and it seems the quality of the food has gone down through the years. Service has always remained good. I had the stinky salmon, sashimi salad, some kind of salmon thing w/ shrimp chips, unagi hand roll, and other dishes, but they were all just ok. The unagi hand roll was the best out of everything tonight, but you can't mess up unagi! I won't be back to this place for a while...
author: Maria C.

description: I love the sushi at this place and the service is always friendly. Dave knows his customers well and always makes a place for us.  Casual dining and great sushi that isn't overly expensive. I dine here often.
author: e b.

description: I have been to sushi bistro so many times and I don't know why I haven't written a review until now. Anyways.....SUSHI BISTRO IS AWESOME! The food, service, and ambiance are all great.  S.B. has a wide and creative selection of rolls and sake.  If your looking for great sushi in the inner rich, look no further.
author: Jessica Y.

description:
They know they're popular, have you seen the iPhone commercial for Urban Spoon?  There's a lot more people working there than there used to be so the service is fast fast fast.  Oh, and I hear they're moving to a bigger space a few doors down and opening a second restaurant in the Mission.  Wa-hoo!

If you don't want to wait, make a reservation...or do what I do and go alone.  Then you don't have to share.
author: Sarah S.

description: Creative rolls and okay fish but way over priced.  Definitely more of a designer sushi restaurant then authentic Japense cuisine.  Fun for a try but not worth the price.  If you like sushi for real try a sushi bar not a bistro.
author: Lauren H.

description:
I really like this place, except it can be LOUD - wow, when I did get so old!  Quiet down, kids!  I'm trying to eat my sushi!

Noise level aside, the fish is super fresh, the rolls are skillfully prepared and generally I dig it.  This is a neighborhood place that's cool enough to take friends - and you can bet that after dinner at sushi bistro, they'll be wishing they lived in the neighborhood too.

On our most recent visit, our favorites were the yellowtail nigiri and the c-2 roll.  I'm getting hungry just thinking about it!
author: Steve J.

description:
I've been here at least five times, for lunch and dinner, and have never waited for a table or a seat at their sushi bar.  Granted it's very small, there are about 8 tables and seating for 8 at the bar as well, but the one waitress provides alot of coverage and always responds to a smile and/or wave for service.

The space is small, fairly plain, and can grow noisy.  What remains consistent is the quality of fish and the creative new ways to cut and prepare the fish.  Kudos to their sushi chef.

Freshness and creativity appear to be the staple.  Their appetizers or small plates have changed and offered a taste of raw and seared fish that I would not have expected so consistently from a local sushi restaurant.  Try their seared albacore appetizer, or their tuna belly nigiri.  It's all good, it's fairly affordable, and a gem along the inner Richmond.
author: M K.

description:
Great food, affordable, excellent service and nice atmosphere.

The quality of the fish was excellent! Shin and Alberto were fast and friendly. Music sounded like a mixture of Bob MArley and the Specials bu t not too loud.

I think we've found our new sushi restaurant.

Norm
author: norman w.

description: Good americanized sushi.  The plates are very well done, however don't watch them make it (the artistry in action is somewhat missing.)  Great sake list.
author: Luke G.

description: For sure one of the top three Sushi places I have ever been to. Every time I have been there, they have one new dish that amazes me. Great  combination of tastes and flavors really is what their strength is. Their salad and C2 roll was just unforgettable.
author: Emm C.

description: The most bizarre combinations for sushi rolls and obscenely large pieces of fish for nigiri -- and these are all good things.  Music is also great but expect to wait because there are only a few tables and people have discovered this really fun spot.  M&L roll rules!
author: Amy D.

description: I always order tuna sashimi, so when I went to this place I looked at the menu and thought geez! this place is expensive. Then I ordered it anyway, I got the 4pc, which is  what I would normally order. Then they gave it to me and the pieces were abosolutely huge!!!!!! I was like no wonder why it was so expensive! I couldve easily order the 2 piece and been satisfied. The tuna had the best color to it also. Great great sashimi!
author: lauren d.

description: My absolute favorite sushi in the city! I recommend the Rock in' Roll and the Spicy Crunchy Toll. The service is always great, too. It is definitley worth the wait but I recommend calling ahead of time for a reservation.
author: Lizzie N.

description: I came here last weekend for a birthday party. I thought it might be good b/c of YELP rating is high. But, I was disappointed. The presentation of the food is good. But, taste is like 4-5 out of 10 scale with 10 being the best. They are more specialized in rolls than anything else. So, if you want authentic Japanese food, this place is no where near. The sashimi was oversize and not fresh. The fire mango ice cream was another big disappointment. I thought it was something interesting based on its name, but its was pancake flour wrap in ice cream (not a good combination).
author: Michelle N.

description: I don't get why this place is so well reviewed. Their sushi is awful! For me, sushi is all about balance, the proper proportion of seasoned rice and fish and the nigiri here is completely off. HUGE, HUGE pieces of fish atop tiny dollops of rice. Each piece of fish could easily have been cut into two pieces, it was completely unbalanced and therefore felt like a travesty to proper nigiri. Also the fish did not taste all that fresh and was not properly sliced so that it was tough and hard to chew. Also, I was excited that they had a lot of different rolls you don't normally see on a menu the ones we got (California for the hubby, Baby Lobster and one other that I can't remember) were again, not good, totally unbalanced and not fresh. Their California and Baby Lobster rolls had way too much sauce and creaminess and therefore took away any of the fresh, sweet flavor of the crab and lobster. In addition, the restaurant was raucous, noisy and had some of the worst acoustics I've ever heard in a restaurant. I would not take a date here, or friends or even my worst enemy. One star for the fast service. That's it.
author: Cathy T.

description:
This is not your traditional sushi place.  It's more a contemporary California style sushi with lots of interesting and creative rolls.  Its sashimi offering is very good and the portion and freshness of toro couldn't be found anywhere for the price.  Certain rolls are meant to have mayo and if you don't like mayo don't order such rolls.  Don't rant and bash this place just because sushi is supposed to be low fat and the rolls you ordered have mayo that puts your diet plan out the window.

I have traveled the world and have eaten at the best and the most exclusive Japanese restaurants in Japan.  Honestly for the price and value and the consistent quality of its sushi, sashimi, rolls, as well as cooked food, Sushi Bistro ranks as one of my most favorite sushi places when I'm overtaken by my craving for sushi.

Sushi is not for everyone and not everyone likes sushi.  My mother doesn't like raw fish or anything raw, but then again it shouldn't mean sushi or rare steaks don't taste good.
author: Tiger L.

description:
I've been to Sushi Bistro quite a few times and I've never left completely satisfied with the quality of the rolls. 

I will say that their albacore sashimi is amazing and the sashimi in general is super fresh.

However, 3 stars is for the ridiculously long wait and for the quality of their fancy rolls. I feel like they often use too much rice and try to cater to the newbie sushi crowd as most of the rolls are packed with non-traditional rolls. I feel strongly that if a place tries to pack their sushi rolls with lots of cream cheese,  cheese or deep fried batter, they are covering up something. We ordered the rock & roll and were expecting the usual: BBQ eel with cucumbers. What we received didn't replicate the texture, the look or the taste of what a Rock and Roll would be. Instead, it had some cheesy, mayonaisse topping on top and I nearly wanted to throw up. It's one of those rolls you can only eat one piece of. I've ordered the Crouching tiger, hidden dragon roll which was good, but not impressive. I've also ordered a few other things like the tofu kara-age, gyoza & tempura and they were all pretty mediocre to me. I don't know, but I feel like I'm expecting so much from a place with almost 5 stars. I guess I'll just have to stick with my traditional spots. 

The service is great though :)
author: 3beeskitchen ..

description:
I'll keep this review short and to the point. If you are like me and actually can differentiate between good and bad sushi, then please save yourself a trip and some money, and avoid this place at all costs. 

If you're the average sushi eater who just orders roll after roll, then this place might suffice for you. The nigiri was completely out of balance. Huge slabs of fish were recklessly cut and placed on top of hardly any sushi rice. The fish, in general, was not fresh, smelly, and lacking in flavor. The toro cuts especally were tough and didn't melt in my mouth as I've come to expect from toro cuts. I ended up eating a ton of ginger to wash my mouth of the fishy taste that seemed to linger endlessly. 

AVOID
author: Sam G.

description: I don't get the hype behind this place. Is the food ok? maybe. Is it overpriced for what it is? Definitely.  If you are a sushi purist who enjoys simple Huber fresh fish with the perfect portion of rice, then stay away from this place. SB is all about overly sweet sauces and gimmicky rolls. They have some interesting stuff, but overall not worth the wait or money.
author: Andy N.

description: This place has really interesting and flavorful dishes.  I haven't tasted much else like some of the items they offer at the Bistro.  The one and only complaint I would have is that the service can be very slow, so be prepared to be patient.  It's worth it.
author: Methanie D.

description: Excellent sushi.  The atmosphere was basic and the service was a little off (still waiting for those edamame) but I think the lapses were simply honest mistakes and don't have anything to do with the staff's attitude or demeanor, which were fine.  The baby lobster roll was very good; the Hawaiian was cucumber, mango, and ahi and was better.  Go for the sashimi, though, as the portions were very, very generous.  The toro sashimi had two gigantic, multibite slabs---yes, slabs---of deliciously fresh fish that had that great fatty texture.  Presentation was excellent, too  Could get upped to 5 if I get back.
author: Alex T.

description:
M&L Forever Roll is worth getting over and over again.  That and the Y.T. Jalapeno appetizer of hamachi sashimi with a dash of salt, a thin slice of jalapeno and some lime juice.  The hamachi just melted in my mouth!

The toro was unfortunately a little fishy.

There are a of of creative rolls on the menu and entrees for those that don't eat sushi.  

It's very reasonalby priced, however the place is small so call ahead for seats.
author: Ellie K.

description: Yum yum yum!! I went the other night for the first time due to the fabulous rating on Yelp and I was NOT let down! Very cute atmosphere and fantastic music. I schmoozed with the very social sushi chef and enjoyed some of the most innovative rolls I have ever had. My boyfriend and I completely filled up for $55 dollars... unheard for good sushi if you ask me.
author: Sam M.

description:
I just went here for the first time last week, and I LOVE it! I eat tons of sushi, so it was nice to see something new on the menu besides the same old concoctions that you'll find on every menu here in SF. 

I highly recommend the black and white roll and the Hawaiian Breeze. I can't stop talking about this place, and I'm going back tonight!
author: Lex m.

description:
We ordered the Chef's Choice sashimi platter, $35/20 pcs.  Seven types of fish were served.  The butterfish absolutely melted in your mouth.  The sake (salmon), tuna (maguro), seared albacore, regular albacore,  hamachi (yellow tail), and toro (fatty tuna) were very, very fresh, and each piece was 1"x3"x1/4" - in other words, huge. If purchased separately, it would have been $42+.  The service was efficient, but we were there fairly early in the evening when there weren't many patrons.  

It's a small, neighborhood restaurant with minimal decor.  But, if what you are after is fresh, excellent sushi or sashimi at a very good price, go to Sushi Bistro.

Also, to be fair, there were many, more exotic choices, and we will probably return to try many of them.
author: Francesca A.

description:
I would have given 3.5, but that just isn't possible.

The sushi is fun - lots to choose from, interesting combinations, lots of fish/veggies in their rolls (to be honest, I would have liked a little more rice in my rolls).  However, the flavors don't always meld and the proportions of ingredients varied considerably - many of my rolls were way heavy on avocado.  The prices are reasonable and the service is friendly and prompt.  I did feel a little rushed at points - the timing of roll preparation was a bit faster than my preferred eating speed, but then it took a little while before we got the check and got paid.

Overall, it was a good dining experience.  I will go again.
author: Kristin B.

description:
The Bistro is a small space full of energy... big tumbler cups with flexi straw, cucumber salad, saki, fresh fish, creative and delicious rolls, green tea ice cream.  Staff works their ass off in an always busy enviroment! 
Favorites:  Poke Salad, the C-2, The Big Island, The New Legend, The Yellowtail Basil, The Watermelon Man...
author: cole m.

description: i appreciate that sushi bistro offers several different vegetarian sushi rolls. everything i've eaten here has been delicious, however the service could use improvement. there is always a noticeable wait to get the check and, during my last visit, our waiter was inattentive. for example, brought my vegetarian friend a seafood roll that he didn't order. regardless, i will be back for their quality veggie rolls. i would suggest bringing your patience and a healthy appetite if you're choosing sushi bistro.
author: Alix G.

description: Delicious innovative sushi! We arrived around 9 when our other dinner plans fell through; the place was busy but we took a seat at the bar. They had Kirin on tap which was the first indicator that this place was going to be awesome. The vegetarian selection was well thought out and expansive. We ordered the veggie gyoza, the asparacado roll, the classic veggie roll, the shiitake mushroom roll and the crispy veggie rolls. The classic veggie roll was like a salad in a sushi roll, it was amazingly fresh and crunchy from the romaine lettuce and the salad dressing perfected it. Sushi Bistro definitely loves to use sauces to make their rolls pop; they were the highlight of the rolls. The only negative I can see for their sushi is that some pieces would fall apart, perhaps they were in a rush? My favorite roll was the crunchy veggie, something about a crunchy texture on sushi is extremely appetizing. This place is awesome and now my favorite sushi.
author: Cori W.

description:
Sushi Bistro is like that quiet, unassuming, shy kid in the back of choir class.  She sings softly in a large group and doesn't talk to anyone. However, when asked to do a solo performance, this beaming, gigantic voice comes out, streaming beautiful melodies.  Making the class respond with standing ovations.

When my friend first took me here I thought, "Where are we going on Balboa?!"  I was amused by their icon of "S" and "B shaped to look like a butterfly.  When we first walked in I wasn't impressed because it was super crowded (which is why I didn't give them the 5 star rating).  But we waited only 15 minutes and was seated at the sushi bar.  The sushi chef  (in fact the same one I see everytime I go now - been here 6 times), is amazing!  He took our order and within minutes we already received our fresh oh-so-delicious albacore sashimi.  He even gave us an extra slice on the house.  

Sushi Bistro offers an assortment of rolls, the freshest sashimi I've ever had, delectable dinner entrees, and specialty fushion small plates. The prices are reasonable considering the kind of quality sushi you get.  I want to highlight their rolls and sashimi in this review since that's what makes them so memorable.

THE ROLLS:
Reading their list eclectic selection of rolls will make your mouth water. From the Aloha Roll (seared ahi, mango, no rice, flash fried & served with spicy garlic sauce) to the 5 Wishes (five different types of sashimi with avocado served over crabmeat with spicy sauce), these delicious creations will make you sing.  The Albacore Dream and Watermelon Man are must-have's!

THE SASHIMI: 
The sashimi will make you swoon.  I'm a picky sashimi eater.  I purposely sit by or at the sushi bar just so I could see the chef cut the slices.  And also, how its handle and stored.  The sashimi is not only super fresh, but given in large portions. My 2 pieces end up being 4 pieces.  One time I went with 3 of my girlfriends and in unison we all said "Mmmmmmmmmm...." out loud after taking a bite of the Yellowtail piece.  The people sitting next to us turned around, giggled, and ordered the same thing.

This place has consistently been a crowd pleaser.  Everytime I take a new person here they love it.  Special note to Vegetarians - they have a good selection of veggie-type rolls.  Not just your usual cucumber or avocado ones!  The music is cool too. They play reggae which gives it a chill, island vibe. 

P.S. You get free ice-cream for dessert!
author: Trish M.

description:
4 stars for the food. fresh. inventive.fresh. original. fresh. creative. fresh. unique. fresh.did i say FRESH? price is a few dollars more than other sushi bars...but so worth your money as they put a lot of meat in their rolls & most of all...the rolls are unique.

1 less star for long lines, ZERO parking, small wait staff, & their lack of care in greeting clients.
author: le petit chef c.

description:
Meet my new favorite sushi restaurant in the city! 
I'm someone who has been around the block a few times when it comes to Japanese food in SF.  That said, my relationships with each restaurant can be likened to various romances in my life.

1. Ozumo, Chaya: Upside: handsome immaculate presentation, someone your mother would brag to her friends about, 5 stars--easy Downside: Blackberry addiction, lacking that spark and sense of humor
2. Ebisu:  Upside: Long history, friends with all your friends Downside: You went away for college while he stayed at home, you grew apart but attempted to drag out the relationship before you finally split up citing irreconcilable differences.  But remained friends.
3. Okazu Ya (various locations), Noriega Teriyaki House: Upside: consistently economical and steady, kind of like the family minivan if it were made out of that mayo-surimi filler that they call "crab salad" Downside: Booorrriiing
4. SushiZone, No Name:  Upside: Fun, cheap, spontaneous (which can be good or bad), a quick fix to make you laugh Downside: too much of a mess to ever consider long term--despite efforts to change him, it'll never happen, he'll always sleep on that dirty futon

So Sushi Bistro: Upside: Exciting, interesting, thoughtful, fresh, and super cute
Downside: I'm so inclined to eat there every week, but I don't want to act too available because I may tire too quickly and ruin my chances in the long run

Sushi Bistro is so money!  Great food, great service, great value, difficult parking, and a Sexy Scallop that definitely lives up to its name!
author: Al N.

description:
I went with my friend last night, and I was a little surprised by how small the place is. But, the food was awesome!

The sushi rolls came fairly fast, and they gave us these cucumber slices to start off, which was nice. I love the rolls they have -- the C2 roll was awesome, and so was the crouching tiger hidden dragon! The sexy scallop was really good too... They have such a wide variety of rolls that I have to go back next time with my other friends and try them all~
author: tianyu c.

description: We were lucky enough to get the table right away at 7pm on Tuesday night and the place was packed. I was excited to finally be there as I have live only couple of block away and constantly hear about how great this place is from everyone. I was not disappointed at all, the menu is very creative, the service was excellent and the prices are not bad at all for the quality. Will definitely be coming back :)
author: Mashylya r.

description: So I read all these wonderful reviews on this place and decided to try it. So one night I ordered two rolls for take out. But when I got home and started to dig in I was more than disappointed. The rolls were almost soggy/mushy. One of the rolls I couldn't even finish because even the seaweed was soggy and it seemed like all mayo or I guess it was the  aioli that they put in everything . I will never try this place again. I had better sushi in Denver and they aren't even near the water.
author: MICHELLE G.

description: This is definitely my favorite sushi restaurant in the city. They have a very creative menu, a quaint  and cozy atmosphere, and amazing, amazing sushi. My favorite: the YT Jalepeno, hands down.
author: ash a.

description: Yummm to Sushi Bistro! The menu offers a variety of different types of sushi and even choices with brown rice. A plus in my book, especially for those who are looking for healthier alternatives. I love some of the creative names they came up with for their sushi like Hot Love, Caucasian Afro, or Sexy Scallop. Haha! My favorites would have to be the Butterfish Blasters, Albacore Dream, and African Spider. The Butterfish Blasters, like it's name is so rich and melts in your mouth like butter. I never even knew what Butterfish was but it's delish! Albacore Dream was really fresh and came with multiple tunas in it. African Spider was good, anything fried is a winner. The soft shell crab was crispy and not oily or greasy. I also tried the Hot Love because everyone Yelped about it but I'm not a huge fan of it. It was thick and therefore got tiring. Also tried the Black Weeds and Hirame Fusion which I didn't care too much for. It was kind of bland and lacking some sort of sauce. I'll be nice and round up to 4 stars since Yelp doesn't do half stars, but they lose some stars in their service. Even with reservations, I felt like I waited the same time as some of those without reservations. Being San Francisco, the place was packed and cramped. Waitresses were friendly but slow. It felt like forever just for them to get us our tableware and water. Since it's always so crowded, I'll be understanding, I'll give them another chance to make up for service since their food is good. However, they'll lose more stars next time if this poor service keeps up. They have to make it worth my while to drive all the way up there from San Jose.
author: Karen L.

description: A girlfriend of mine did some research and found this cute, funky place for us to meet before we caught a movie at The Bridge last night. Cue Sushi Bistro. I came back again tonight, for a second visit, this time bringing my husband. Both times I've been now, the wait staff were attentive and very friendly, and the food arrived very quickly. Between the 2 nights,  we sampled salmon nigiri, fresh and perfect; tekka maki, again, fresh and perfect, and the rock & roll (crab roll with scallions and that melty-spicy mayo sauce baked on top). Husband LOVED the rock & roll, we ordered a second plate of it. I also ordered The New Legend (shrimp tempura filler, albacore tuna and green onions drizzled with eel sauce on top). I enjoyed The New Legend, Husband thought the sauce had a smidge too much sesame flavor in it. Atmosphere was dark and loungy, they played a little deep-bass trip-hop, which I'll always support. We'll definitely visit again.
author: Kimberly N.

description:
I LOVE SUSHI BISTRO! There rolls are absolutely fantastic! Service was really great. I recommend the Ragin Cajuns if you like unagi and crunchy stuff. Its the BEST! The only flaws about this place is that it is really small and parking is a BITCH. I made reservations for a girls night out and i was short on cash so I had to go to an ATM and the nearest one was on Clement and 7th Ave so I had to drive there and when I got back I spent almost half an hour trying to find parking! and therefore I missed out on the rest of the girls night out dinner! Reservations are also HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!

FOOD= 5 STARS
PARKING= 2 STARS
SERVICE= 5 STARS
SPACE= 3 STARS
OVERALL= 4 STARS
author: Janelle B.

description:
this sushi joint isn't exactly my favorite place ... 

japanese cuisine mixed with a modern twist ... *shrugs* it's a super super small ass place with a decent amount of creativity involved ... prices were relatively average, $9 and up...

can't believe how jam packed this lil bistro can hold ... what happens if the fire alarm goes off? can all of the patrons be able to evacuate? sheesh* ... 

we tried to be risky and decided to go for their brown rice sushi, going from $12, when lil do you know, they gave us WHITE RICE, and insisted it was brown .. i think i VERY WELL KNOW the difference btwn brown and white weirdos ... 

service? well, let's just say one of the japanese guys was an a-hole. the minute we walk in, he asks us how many ppl there were in the party. we say 2, and tells us to hold and that a table was to be ready within minutes ... we wait 10 minutes, and i see another table next to the door ready. i kindly ask him if we could sit there and he told us that it was reserved for 3 ppl. ok, 3 folks ... there was another table that had NO RESERVED SIGN and 2 empty seats.. i ask him again about the next table, and then he snaps at me and says, "it's reserved for 4 ppl." "u told me it was 3..." "can you hold? that other table is coming up..."

no need to be rude ... 

no need to be PMS-y ... 

no need to snap you bozo ... 

why do i come across morons as such?

anyways ... i MUST* say one thing i really appreciated about sushi bistro ... their nigiris are to die for ... they are super generous and give you a huge chunk ... i was happy ... 

parking - O M G. don't even count on it ...
author: Jennifer S.

description: My husband and I are in love with this wonderful place. The food is great and delicious. Can't wait to get our favorite snow crab and C2 again. Service is pleasant and very fast as well. We highly recommend this place if you wanna try something unusual and tasty!
author: Olga F.

description: Still a fan, but I must admit that the new location a few doors down lacks the personality of the original setup. The family who used to run around grabbing the food and drinks is no longer visible - now replaced by Marina types - the atmosphere just isn't as authentic. However, the food is still consistently good.
author: Daniel B.

description: Wow this place is great. The fish is super fresh and soft, and the rolls are innovative and very tasty.  I had the albacore dream and one veggie one that had sweet potato in it -- both were great, as was the poki salad.  Service is friendly and fast.  Environment is cozy, contemporary.  Highly recommended sushi in SF.
author: Scott W.

description: The sushi here is not the usual but instead has a twist. I had the rolls with the the jalepenos on top (to die for). Hands down best sushi flavors ever. Cramped seating, but good enviroment. I will definately be going back.
author: Kirsten D.

description: Place is now larger after they moved two doors down.  Food is not as great as it used to be.  Sashimi is as good as other sushi places, but their appetizers are still really yummy.  Service is different.  Atmosphere is way different.  I like the old Sushi Bistro.
author: Christopher C.

description: Came here last night to celebrate two of my buddies birthdays, thanks in part from a recommendation from another good friend (Thx Nikki!)...the place is very stylish-looks like a bar/nightclub and is pretty spacious. We ordered variety of rolls and sashimi--the fish was fresh and the slices were humoungous! The Benito was off the h-h-h-hook and so was the Hamachi. I also had the baby lobster salad and that was awsome too. One roll we ordered, the "one love", or something or other, with baby lobster and rich cream was also really good. One downside, our party of six would not fit in the front so we were seated in the back, away from all the hotties & music and bar. But we still had a great time and service was top notch. Parking sucks but, hey, name one place in SF, aside from Ocean Beach, where it's easy! Allow 15 min extra to find a space.
author: Steve K.

description: If I could, I would give this place ZERO stars. If you plan on ordering rolls and tempura, you will love this place. However, if you like sashimi, aka raw fish, no rice, no nori, DO NOT EAT HERE. I had the worst, most fishy, room temperature, chewy, DISGUSTING toro of my life. When I let them know that it was bad, they made a huge scene in the restaurant, attempted to re-serve it to me multiple times, and then refused to take it off of the bill. Sashimi is my favorite food, I eat it at least once a week, and I know when I have been served bad fish. I was so turned off by their refusal to acknowledge how bad their fish was that I will NEVER GO BACK, nor would I recommend it for someone who doesn't eat sashimi. Go to Namu next door, they are super nice, and the food is delicious. Or go somewhere else! GIANT RED FLAG.
author: Jamie T.

description: cool place, tried a ton of rolls and sushi and everything was great. i'd say the best were the new legend roll and two in one roll. albacore dream, monster in law, butterfish blaster.....basically everything we ordered was great, and not that expensive. was all full at 9pm on a thursday all the way until we left a bit before 11.
author: J A.

description: If you are looking for a different type of sushi place go HERE! The rolls are very different then your typical sushi place. Watermelon, Really? Mango? Really. But I have to say the food is great along with the presentation as well. Try one of the Brown rice rolls along with any Mango Roll! The vibe is very hip and fun. Not your same every day sushi place. The only thing that is not great is the parking...Well thats the CITY!
author: Matt S.

description: they got a new place its bigger and better.. so fresh and soooo good...
author: nancy w.

description: Always great fish and some interesting specials.   I had never sat in the back room until last night.  Before I thought it was some cool private space, but now I know it's pretty dank and not too impressive.
author: Alex L.

description: this place is happening.  it is packed and then some.  there's always definitely a wait but worth it.  the size of the pieces of sashimi is ridiculously awesome and yet so fresh!
author: nancy c.

description: I love their  sashimi (big portion and fresh). but their rolls are ok, they just up too much unagi sauce on rolls
author: E L.

description: I LOVE Sushi Bistro!!  I've been going for 3 years and it is always fresh and delicious.   I recommend albacore dream, C2, new legend and my personal favorite, the tuna poke special.   The cuts of fish are always huge and super fresh and the price is totally reasonable.  I don't go anyplace else for sushi.  Thanks, David, you run a fabulous restaurant!
author: Sara S.

description: This is my favorite sushi place in SF. The fish is consistently amazing, and the service is top notch.
author: Alek I.

description: This place does have amazing sushi and very generous portions of sashimi (which I can't complain about) but call me crazy - I kind of like my nigiri fish cut slightly smaller so the texture remains in tact (it's hard to explain). I loved everything except for one thing that really ruined the dinner for me - the oyster shooter. Don't get it! I think everyone at our table could agree - WAY too big. I got a huge mouthful of soju, oyster, uni, wasabi which on paper sounds great but ended up being too alcoholic and too much salty creamy in your mouth. Now unless you're into that (which some people are) then I'd steer clear of this dish unless you want to shoot ocean cream into your date's face.
author: Christie W.

description: I've been to this place a couple times and what I love about this place are their unique sushi rolls.  We usually get the crunchy veggie roll and the C2.  They usually serve a small tiny cucumber salad, but they didn't this time.  I guess it's sporadic.  This time we ordered their maui salad, which was surprisingly a bigger portion than we thought, it was also very good, especially the little potato crunchy things.  We also ordered the caucasion afro, weird name, huh?  But it was so yummy, definitely going to order it again!  It had avocado, spicy tuna, and the potato crunchy things, what a perfect blend.  We ordered another roll but can't remember what it was.  What's also good about this place is free dessert, one scoop of pistachio ice cream.  They also take reservations, and the only drawback is parking.  It's in a residential neighborhood, so don't be surprised to circle the block a couple times.
author: Jen C.

description: yummy sushi.  ordered the crouching tiger, watermelon roll, nemo found, sashimi (salmon, 2 kinds of tuna), 1 bottle of sake, 1 sapporo, tofu, tempura, and some other things.  all really good.  rolls are unique, not heavy on the rice, big pieces.  restaurant is a little small but i heard it's bigger than the old one.  loud music bu not annoying.  fast service.  parking is a lil difficult cuz of the avenues.  i would go back and try all the other rolls.  yummmmmm.  it can get busy so either rsvp or go early at 5.  not that great for big groups unless you want to take over majority of the restaurant.
author: D W.

description: This restaurant has an amazing spider roll.  Ive never had a spider roll where it was fried with such perfection that the entire crab was delicate and crunchy at the same time.  While ordering about 5 rolls my bill came out to around 60, with edamame, but it was definently worth it.  This place is a little in the middle of nowhere, but its definently worth the drive if you love an awesome spider roll.
author: Mikey L.

description: This is decent sushi: I recommend the sushi ngiri and sashimi, especially the toro. The "chef special rolls" are okay, but the sushi chefs unfortunately go a little overboard when it comes to sauces (e.g., Caterpillar, Albacore Dream). At the end of your meal, you may have to ask for the coconut-pineapple ice cream -- it's supposed to be free, but when we ate here I think the waitress forgot to bring ours out.
author: A. T.

description: These guys have some of the best rolls in the city.  Although I have recently become a fan of the Choleste-roll (w/bacon) which they didn't have,  There were some very good choices on the menu.  Big fan of the new location, the music, and the sushi.  If Zack and AC Slater had a post-post college years "the Max", this might be it!  Although this place is probably not romantic enough to win the heart of Ms. Kapowski.
author: Chris M.

description: service sucks. don't come here.  zero tips.
author: Pency M.

description: mmmm, yummm, mmmm, gooooood sushiiiii, goooood scennnnne, goood musssiccccc, good pricesssss.  fish on the nigiri is a little tooooooo big.  why give so much away, don't trust thattttttt, why so much purging their store of fish, hmm.... goooood place, wanna go back.
author: Today Y.

description: more fish for your buck. really good sushi here, was definitely impressed. i keep coming back. again, more fish for your buck.
author: Fred C.

description: This is my favorite sushi restaurant ever.  And in my boyfriend's words a totally "orgasmic" experience.  My favorites are the "hot love" and butterfish blasters".....yummm.....my mouth is watering as I write this review.
author: Ritasha L.

description: The wait is often long, but it's a long wait for a reason.  This is the best sushi place I've been to in the city.  The sashimi is great every time and I have yet to have a bad roll there.  The C-2 Roll (w/ lobster) is a must order every time.
author: Luke P.

description: amazing!  Never fails to satisfy my sushi cravings!  great service too...super nice people.
author: Erica L.

description: this place is GREAT. everything is so fresh and the salmon just melts in your mouth. the menu is eclectic and unique, the prices are fairly reasonable, and the staff is always welcoming. guaranteed good dinner place. i highly recommend the "watermelon man" roll!
author: Roman H.

description: If you're planning on eating at Sushi Bistro, I hope you're in the mood for 2 things: lots of mayo-laden rolls and poor service. The first time I ate here was about 8 months ago. I ordered a roll w/lobster (the name escapes me) and was totally dismayed when I discovered that they put mayo in it, especially since the menu did not mention mayo. I am not a mayo fan or a fan of mayo's "fancier" cousin, aoli so needless to say I was disappointed. Fast forward to last night. We ordered a spider roll, dragon roll, a side of unagi, and some sesame chicken. The spider roll was decent, the unagi was good, but unfortunately the dragon roll had aoli in it! I've eaten many a dragon roll in my day and I have never had one slathered in mayo! As for the chicken, we ordered this after we consumed our sushi. My friend also ordered an additional item following the consumption of her initial order. Her 2nd order was on our table within 5 minutes, however, the chicken I ordered took an additional 20 minutes! Now I'm a patient person and understand that the waiter may have forgotten to submit the order, but what really pissed me off was how NUMEROUS employees kept coming over and asking if we were ready for the check in spite of the fact that we told each person that we were still waiting for a dish! I understand that this place gets busy and they probably needed the table for their mayo lovin' clientele, but come on! I will never eat here again and I'm trying to wrap my mind around why people love this place so much. Next time I'm in the mood for sushi, I'll be dining at Kabuto on Geary!
author: j t.

description: Had a unagi donburi. Not amazing, not bad. Reasonable amount for $13. Namu is next door and might be more interesting but it's closed for the holidays.
author: John K.

description: wowwity wow!! i love my neighborhood even more now! First time at Sushi Bistro even though I've lived in the hood for a while. I don't know what the hell I was waiting for. I love Sushi Bistro! Good thing its a good few blocks away coz I'd seriously be in tremendous debt if i lived across the street from them. I'd eat here every night and make friends with everyone who works there! I love that they play reggae as well. That was a big plus for my bf. He was more inclined to going out for sushi when he found that out. For people who do not like raw fish, they have a good selection of deep fried goodies to choose from. Personally i go for the raw stuff, and sushi Bistro was definitely fresh, fresh, fresh. They also give big honking pieces of nigiri and sashimi. I almost kissed the sushi chef. The more fish the better. My favorite was the halibut sashimi. We got a few orders of that. Yellow tail and salmon nigiri, which was also really good. The rolls, well they have a lot to choose from and I will definitely try all of them one day. We got the black weeds, watermelon man, something with basil, african spider, and the 7 flavor albacore salad. Everything was very tasty and had its own individual flavors. Every roll was very different and has a funky twist. Definitely not a purist sushi place. Its fun and imaginative sushi. We had a pitcher of Kirin with our meal as well and it came out to about $95 w/o tip. Its a little steep for everyday dinner, but worth every penny. Like i said, going into debt is in my future if I continue this sushi bistro habit.
author: Maria B.

description: Sushi Bistro is definitely one of  my favorite sushi restaurants in San Francisco. The rolls are tasty, the fish is fresh and the staff is friendly. It is pretty affordable too for the quality of sushi you will get there. I like the atmosphere, and the place looks pretty nice after they moved. It can get loud, on Friday nights you should make a reservation and it is not easy to find parking in that area, but the awesome sushi makes me cross the city and go back there every time I can. Definitely recommended!
author: Urban D.

description: Dooooood!  Wowser!  This place blew through all the great sushi restaurants I've been to out of the water and is now my #1 sushi joint.  Sorry Zushi Puzzle!  The fish is so fresh is melts in your mouth.  Like Butta!  If you've been there you know it's worth the wait!  The Butterfish Blaster was by far the best thing that we tried that night.  Handfuls of snow crap and slices of avocado are stuffed into a slab of butterfish which is then seared by blow torch for a Smokey after taste! So far unrivaled for freshest, generosity and truly unique menu that is also veggo friendly.  You go Sushi Puzzle!
author: Marilyn K.

description: very good, inventive sushi and sushi-like dishes, including one item called the "caucasian afro" that involves a mound of fresh chopped tuna, avocados, a flavorful sauce, and fried vermicelli noodles (the afro...) on top. however, the service was seriously ;acking. i dont like to have to beg for water, and they never brought us any, and they burned my moms chicken, didnt bring a replacement til the very end of the meal, and never said one word of apology. plus one star for having a russian bakery across the street where i got to witness a fully grown russian man begging his friends to let him go in for a loaf.
author: Lisa M.

description: I did enjoy this place. I mean, the music's pretty loud and somewhat annoying but the service is pretty good and rather efficient and not to mention one of the few sushi spots in San Francisco that actually allows you to make a reservation for six. For some reason, other sushi joints max out at five for reservations and no more is accepted. Hmph! Fortunately Sushi Bistro saved the day and my group had a lot of fun. Their sashimi is ridiculously fresh and I give tons of applause for that. It's harder than people think to find seriously fresh sashimi. I thought their chirayashi bowl was spectacular and very well-priced too. Big nice slabs of sashimi tastefully arranged around a bowl of great rice. There is more sashimi than there is rice (which is the way it's supposed to be). I got their "Hot Love" signature dish and it was just an orchestra in your mouth. It's so good with baby lobster and shrimp and avocado and more. I wouldn't go to this place frequently but would absolutely book here again if I'm going with a large group.
author: Pamela L.

description:
i'd heard some good things about this place, so we decided to try it out. had reservations so no complaints about long lines. the service was fine.

my complaints are with the food and the prices.

the tuna sashimi smelled and tasted pretty foul (this was on a saturday night) and everything was way overpriced. for three people, we dropped $40 each on not much food.

there's so much better sushi in this city and at much better prices.
author: Saikat P.

description: This is my favorite sushi place in all of the Bay Area! Yes, parking is awful, service is hit or miss and reservations are sometimes a pain, but the fish is fresh, rolls/apps creative and portions insane! I am absolutely obsessed with Sushi Bistro's fresh and enormous nigiri and in fact I will drive all the way from Menlo Park to satisfy the craving. Sushi Bistro is a great place for a date or dinner with friends.
author: Kimberly S.

description: Great nigiri, large portions of raw fish, the salmon was super fresh, as was almost everything, except for the tuna which was dry and flaky.  The rolls we didn't care for much, even though that's what my gf told me the place was known for.  Also, popular place, so the wait was long.  The four of us arrived 9ish, was told a 30 min wait and weren't seated until 10:15ish close to when they closed.  And we had to sit separately at that.
author: Susan Y.

description: Let me start by saying the food was incredible.  Unfortunately the service SUCKED. The menu was a great creative variety.  Their Unagi Nigiri is one of the best that I have ever had (Bond Street Sushi in Manhattan comes 1st).  Their server staff left something to be desired. I'm a food server veteran and figuring out who was ours was a big old guessing game.  And the sad thing was that neither of the two servers who were supposedly "waiting" on us - barely did.  The most helpful to us was the food runner, an Asian guy who remained attentive the whole dining experience.  The girl server who greeted us, took our order and ignored us the whole time even though she had forgotten to place one of our entrees.  The other supposed server was 89% caring about us, but then gave up as soon as a better 4-top was seated in his section. Understandably, but still no excuse. The topper was that the next time we saw the girl server was when my check went down and she ran to get the tip.  Come on!!!
author: Fashionista M.

description: good fresh sushi. large, diverse menu with good appetizers, and lots of rolls. the sashimi is very fresh. nice casual atmosphere
author: Yinnie Q.

description: Great recommendation Dr. Santos! The C2 roll is pretty good, as was the Dragon roll. Very busy little restaurant, so call in advance.
author: Mama L.

description: Someone recommended this place to me and since sushi is my top favorite food, I really look forward to trying every single place in the city that sells slabs of fresh fish.  This place is great!!  The service is nice and the place is clean...now let me get to the sushi part...the fish tastes so fresh and their rolls are so unique and fun to eat.  We had a hard time choosing which rolls to go with because they all sounded really good.  I'll definitely be back to try more!  The place is small so come here on a date or with a small group of friends.
author: Trisha H.

description: Sushi Bistro is a Californian style fusion restaurant with a creativ menu on rolls but not a wide variety of nigiri. The fish on the nigiri is thickly cut and there is very little rice underneath. All together I guess the bad reviews come from people who search authentic places and the good reviews from people who like fancy fusion places. Prices are very reasonable, we ended up wth 25$/person being stuffed. However, I guess I will not come back, having so many other choices.
author: Bettina O.

description: We decided to have a late dinner this past Saturday and decided to walk over the the Sushi Bistro. This place is awesome. We ordered the African Spider roll, Albacore Dream roll, Crunchy roll, and the Tempura appetizer and washed it all down with Sapporo.  All of which was very tasty. The service was friendly and fast. The atmosphere was casual and they had good music to listen too. I am defiantly a fan of this place.
author: Nicole W.

description: My colleague/friend set me up with her sister-law, and her favorite food she said was "sushi." So, I thought this would be the perfect place to go because neither of us been here and it was highly rated on yahoo. I  really wanted to really impress her.  Well, dinner went all right here. The sushi was good, we had some tempura rolls, some caterpillar rolls, and a special mango roll.  I also order Chilean sea bass as a side dish which was very nicely done I thought. Unfortunately, the atmosphere of this place was disappointing. It wasn't very  lively, as I thought it would be. I came to early to avoid waiting in line I thought. Instead, we were the only ones there. The place picked up afterwards, so maybe I came too early. My date said the food was good, but nothing really special happened at that place, I'm sorry to say. I guess I was expecting something more for this place and my from date.  Do you know what I mean?!  But the food was good and service okay, so I give 4 stars still.
author: Leon C.

description: i like this spot., I highly recommend their  ahi tuna salad its delicious! its served with greens and crispy crunchy type noodles made of potato and some sort of mustardish dressing- its GOOD! the watermelon rolls are the bomb! ( no watermelon in them) its tuna and mango, yum yum yum!!!
author: Osiris Z.

description: Okay, I'll admit that I am not a sushi connoisseur BUT mango salsa and pesto?  A crazy combination that worked for me BIG TIME!  It was a bit crowded but they took reservations which was very convenient since I went with a big group of friends.  Service was quick, sushi was yummy.
author: Crissy M.

description: This place is awesome! We had reservations for 7:30pm, but we arrived an hour early and they still gave us seats! This was hands down the best sushi I have ever ate, definitely try the Butterfish Blasters and the Sashimi, also, I recommend the HOT LOVE, you will not regret it!
author: Thomas J.

description: Before sushi bistro, I can't say I ever craved sushi. My little sister just moved to SF and wanted sushi for her birthday dinner. After hearing many friends praise this place I decided to take her here and am now a sushi fan myself! I was able to get us a reservation here too, which was a good idea as the restaurant was small (though I think they just moved to a different location down the street...). Excellent service and such good food!!!!!! I will definitely be eating more sushi now :)
author: Annie L.

description: I do have to admit that I like the food here but I am NOT a fan of the service. I felt like I was being rushed throughout the entire meal.  I was there tonight with a friend. We were given the bill immediately after they cleared the plates although I was not done with my drink. Once I finished my drink I paid the bill and during this time they were cleaning other tables and slammed a two-top table into ours without as much as "i am sorry." My friend and I continued to chat for a bit at which point one of the employees came to our table, told us that they had a long waitlist, and would we mind leaving. We left only to notice that we had ONLY BEEN THERE FOR ONE HOUR. I do not think this is acceptable. No one even asked me if I was interested in another drink.
author: Meredith C.

description: The wait is a little long but the service is fast and the food is good.  I will come back for sure.
author: Marie N.

description:
the good:  many attractive choices on menu, good food, creative presentation, good music (reggae)

the not so good: reservation was not honored, so waited ~ 20 or so minutes.  when i first walked in they said a 20 min wait, then i said i had a rez and they said 5 min.  not so much.  it was also a little loud b/n peeps and music, our table was next to the front door, where peeps stood and waited for their tables 

go but plan to wait

seems like a place that should not take rez's since they cant honor them
author: Henry F.

description: Good sushi!  Great selection of rolls and very friendly people and service.  There are so many trendy sushi places in the city and this is definitely not one of them.  Very fresh fish and I would put this in my top 5 sushi places in SF.
author: Glen E.

description: one of the best sushi places in SF!!!!  they have amazing fresh fish.  every time i go there i get something different, and i trust anything they have on the menu that looks good.  try the yellowtail nigiri, the spider roll, the crouching tiger hidden dragon, crunchy roll, and the magic mushroom. . .DELICIOUS!!!  i crave this place so i have to go once a week, and their house sake is pretty damn cheap too!!!  i give it 5 stars!
author: Allison M.

description: food is great! but its always so crowded! kind of gives that claustrophobic feeling. and noisy. we always to go it, much faster!
author: Wwy m.

description: very the yummmy long time....the fish is soooo good!
author: Elsa K.

description: great sushi, great service. what else do you want?  great prices perhaps?  yeah, they got that too.
author: N C.

description: This is by far the best sushi I've ever had. The Butterfish roll (I forget the name), Dave's Legacy, and Hawaiian Breeze (I think), were amazing! The Poke Salad was also incredible. And the nigiri portions are the most generous I've ever seen. I can't wait to go back.
author: David S.

description: Good selection of special rolls and unique appetizers. Cheaper by about $0.50/item than places like Tokyo Go-Go and Sushi Groove and quieter, since there's not an alcohol bar. Just really good food and none of the annoyance of loud, obnoxious party-goers.
author: Elise U.

description: This is where I learned to love sushi- I lived around the corner from this place and had to fight the urge to go there every day.  The fish is incredibly fresh, and they have a ton of unique, insanely delicious rolls.  Some of my favorites: hot love appetizer (as good as it sounds), miso glazed sea bass (melts in your mouth), big island roll (amazing visual presentation), spicy crunchy roll, new legend roll, and yellowtail basil roll.  Also, the lettuce wraps are fantastic.  The prices are very reasonable considering the portion sizes.  Seriously, this is the best sushi in SF.
author: Molly C.
